Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JW5576
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the XV Beacon recently and absolutely loved it. We have traveled extensively on business and pleasure and found this hotel to be by far the nicest. The room was very comfortable and had everything we needed. The gas fireplace a great touch. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: nikolai69
Reviews.Content: Couldnt agree more with what everyone else has already written here. A true gem in Boston, not least due to the great service, and wonderful rooms. Not a huge fan of the Mooo breakfast - unappetizingly large portions of average food at very high prices. But the hotel itself: Just Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Not great. Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: Renee R
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for this boutique hotel because of the many rave reviews I read before booking. We usually stay at Ritz-Carlton hotels wherever we travel, but opted to try something new on our trip to Boston. The XV was good, but not exceptional .We are willing to pay for a truly awesome experience and felt like we did, but just received a good experience. Nothing was wrong, but nothing was truly great. We did have an issue with the temperature and asked it be addressed upon our return from a day out. Our room was still sweltering upon our return and we again asked that it be taken care of. They kept asking us if we had the fireplace on. Duh! No! We couldn't even use the fireplace, although it was chilly out because the room was a sauna! The maintenance guy came, looked, and offered to open the window and bring a fan. Not what I expected for the money we paid. The car service was nice. We took it to the Garden, but they couldn't pick us up because they had other people to pick up, they said. No one greeted us when we entered and exited, other than the door man. Our room was very cute and I liked the furnishing. Bed was nice, pillows were either too over stuffed or under stuffed, no in between. It was very central for the park and shopping and there's a great Irish pub just across the street. We ate sushi down the street also, and it was lovely. Overall, again, nothing was terrible or bad. I would have rather stayed at the Ritz-Carlton though.

Reviews.Title: “The best of great choices”
Reviews.Author: shrimpboy1
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at XV Beacon about 11 years ago when it was named #1 Boutique hotel in the world and have stayed at least once a year ever since. I just had the opportunity to spend a couple nights again in this "true Boston" hotel nestled at upper end of the Boston Commons Upon being ushered in by the doorman that remembered my name from a year ago, I notice that several of the satff members had been there year after year and sincerely cared about making my visit excellent. The XV Beacon excels in every facet of a great hotel. The rooms each have fireplaces, Rain showers (that you want to live under), excellent sound systems with several speakers throughout (including bathroom) and superb beds/linens A nightly shoe shine service and morning paper are hung on your door and breakfast either through room service or the hotel's elegant restaurant Mooo begin each day in relaxed style. Having complimentary car service (two Black Lexus) especially when the weather is foul makes the this whole package at this hotel above all others. After staying at several of the other highest rated hotels in Boston, one of my business associates came back to XV Beacon this year and said he was done trying to find a better hotel in Boston..

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway wIth the ladies!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy M
Reviews.Content: We had such a fabulous experience at XV Beacon! The service was impeccable, the room luxurious and the staff was so accommodating! You must stay at XV Beacon if you are headed to Boston....you will feel like you are their most important guests!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: sgmlosaltos
Reviews.Content: The front desk personnel and concierge were particularly helpful and the room service food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel with exceptionally friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DK1960
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed 3-4 times at this hotel over the last ten years but had not been back for several years. We did so this past weekend and were reminded why we liked it so much: unique, attractive rooms, intimate size, great location, terrific restaurant and a wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service does still exist, right here!”
Reviews.Author: Skillz22
Reviews.Content: We stayed Feb 25 at the XV Beacon Hotel for my boyfriend's birthday. Funny enough, my boyfriend and I had a conversation earlier that day that good customer service seems to be non-existent everywhere. We were pleasantly surprised by our amazing stay at the XV Beacon. First of all, I had contacted them on facebook saying "can't wait to stay with you this weekend to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday" They responded and said they were looking forward to our stay. Upon our arrival, two men came out from the building, dressed very nicely and classy. One of them opened our doors of our car, the other unloaded our luggage onto the cart. They took our car for valet, and escorted us to the front desk. Once at the front desk, we checked in and the man working there was extremely helpful with all the details of our stay and services available to us. We then saw the concierge who booked a Lexus for us to take (it's complimentary!) to our dinner in the North End. Were escorted to our rooms and our luggage was unloaded. Once in our room, the bell hop showed us all the awesome things in our room, which included a gas fireplace, stereo system, in room dining, mini bar and the privacy light (no crazy signs to put on the door). Another man, who appears to take care of guest requests and room service, appeared during this time and brought us a few snacks complimentary. This included a chocolate dipped strawberry, chocolate dipped apricot, chocolate chip cookie and an oatmeal cookie with crasins in it. Ice was immediately fetched for us upon our request. Within a few minutes, they came to our door again with a special chocolate cake and waters as well as a card wishing my boyfriend a happy birthday. I was very impressed!! I hadn't even requested this and they remembered my facebook post! We went downstairs to get our car for dinner and the driver was waiting in the lobby for us. We took a spacious and comfortable Lexus SUV and it was nice ride to the restaurant. The car service does only run until 11pm, but they will call cabs for you as needed. The room itself, was beautiful! Not much of a view (we were on the 2nd floor) but the gas log fireplace was awesome, the stereo was great and had speakers in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable as were the chairs in the room. There was a safe in the closet and plenty of area for storage if you were there for a long stay. The mini bar was by far the most impressive on I've ever seen. Everything from gourmet snacks, comfort food, varieties of wine, champagne, hard liquor, water juice and coconut water. The bathroom was very clean and beautiful! The rain shower head was amazing and the jetted tub was treat in the morning before we started our day. A newspaper of our choice was delivered for us the next day and they remembered our room and names during check out! I was so impressed that everyone here is so detail oriented! Our bags were placed in the car for us and the car was brought up to wait for us, while we enjoyed a delicious and leisurely brunch at Mooo... next door. Overall, one amazing weekend in the best hotel I've ever stayed in. This will now be my new go to hotel for when I stay in Boston with your great service, excellent staff and a beautiful hotel in a great location! Thank you XV Beacon for an amazing weekend and for making my boyfriends birthday the best one he's ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: coltsfans
Reviews.Content: The room and location were wonderful, but what really makes this hotel special are the people! The front desk, concierge, drivers and bellmen were so considerate and welcoming. I would definitely stay here again! Oh, and the room service dinner was really yummy, highly recommend the BLT or the tuna.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Idontwant2gohome
Reviews.Content: This is our second year spending Super Bowl weekend in Boston with our two teen age boys. We chose to stay at the XV Beacon this year. Our stay at this small boutique hotel has been just wonderful! We had 2 rooms adjoining (802 and 804), so we had plenty of space to spread out and watch the game. The rooms are cozy, spacious, and have ample room for hanging out without having to even go near the bed! Each of our rooms have a wonderful little fireplace that adds to the warmth of the rooms. The rooms are well appointed, beds are extremely comfortable, and everything is very clean. The all-marble bathrooms are beautiful with fittings that fit the historic nature of the building. The staff has been very helpful and friendly, always opening the door for us as we enter or exit and helping with restaurant choices. We had brunch at Moo (the hotel restaurant), and it was delicious. The location of the hotel has been perfect, and we have been able to walk to just about everything. While the hotel is located in the heart of everything, it is nestled on a quiet street and is extremely peaceful. We will definitely come back to the XV Beacon!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: joeylady
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of this hotel. It is a gem. It is not a big hotel chain. It is more of a small boutique hotel located in the heart of Boston. I know about Moo but had neither dined there nor really took notice of the XV Beacon hotel. We celebrated a special occasion here and to my surprise, the rooms are much newer and trendier than I expected. I LOVE the bathroom with its marble finishes, a bathtub and the speakers! I love speakers in the bathroom! There is also a fireplace (that's actually very warm). The atmosphere is warm and romantic. One of the most important things is that it was quiet. It was a Sunday night though, not noisy at all. Decent size rooms and a king size bed (love). Most of all, the service was great, from the concierge to the front desk to the car service. Everything was just wonderful. Things don't need to come in big packages. I highly recommend this hotel! A wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michele S
Reviews.Content: XV Beacon's attention to detail is clear. From the well appointed rooms to the very helpful staff, all aspects of our stay were exceptional. XV Beacon is a lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Option - Business of Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: morevacation
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor of Boston and have always been impressed with the Beacon. Convenient to all major business and tourist sites, very comfy rooms and a real boutique feel with service to match. Rooms: maybe a bit smaller than other options in Boston, but they are truly comfortable... stereo system equips all of the space and an awesome fireplace makes for the pefect place to relax after a day in the cold. Bed is plush, decor is cool. Common Areas: really not much to offer here.. the lobby is tiny, but reflective of a boutique so it met my expectations. If you are looking for a gym, they have a contract with a spot about a block away. There is a restaurant/bar attached... which I did not find too exciting, but offers a place for a pre or post dinner drink. The fresh fruit in the hallways is a nice touch. Service: not overly friendly, but very professional. No complaints. Really no need for much since I am usually on business. Location: walking distance to all major touristy sites.. and convenient to most business locations. This is really a spectacular location I think. Tip: eat at No.9 Park, right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SydFam40
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas at the XV Beacon and we had a great time. The location of the hotel is fantastic. We were a group of 7 staying in 3 rooms - the larger suite was lovely - the extra space really was handy for the group to spend time together. The in room fireplaces gave a great warmth to the room, The tolieteries were a great quality - and the lip gloss was a lovely touch. The staff were very good - but the hotel is not necessarily that child friendly, they only have two rooms with twin beds, however it was easy enough to get a roll away bed. The offer of the car is also very handy but when you are a group of 7 it was more difficult to take advantage of it. The coincerige staff were really helpful and provided great detail and information to help with sight seeing and meals. We ate at Moo on Christmas night - and the food was really great - but I was somewhat disappointed that there was no Christmas meal on offer. I would highly recommend this hotel for couples - it is amazing and well worth it,

Reviews.Title: “Not Enough Superlatives for this Property”
Reviews.Author: TSprezzatura
Reviews.Content: Uber-attentive and knowledgeable staff, and immaculate rooms that spare no luxury. Without a doubt the best boutique hotel experience I've ever had in the States. A million thanks to Molly, Mark, and the rest of XV Beacon for making our Christmas magical. Tonianne, Washington DC

Reviews.Title: “"World Class Boutique Hotel" What an absolute pleasure to stay in this amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris_mayes
Reviews.Content: XV Beacon was simply the most amazing experience i have had with a Hotel / Boutique Hotel to date. The decision to go with XV Beacon was made based on the fact that we were travelling up from New York where we had stayed 12 days at the Marriott Marquis over Christmas & New Years. What we were after was a smaller, quieter & more boutique style hotel. What we discovered in XV Beacon though, was a hidden gem. It all started with contacting the Concierge from their website prior to our arrival (about 2 months). I was after recommendations for great restaurants in the area and also appropriate tours of inner-city Boston which would give us a real sense of what Boston had to offer. The Concierge's name was Jonathan. I cannot praise Jonathan enough for all the work & attention he put in to my requests. He listened & his local knowledge was brilliant. The recommendations were exactly what i was looking for and as a result we booked all the restaurants for each night along with a couple of the tours he recommended (for anyone looking / interested there is a 'North End Tour' that i would highly recommend which will give you a great sense of the food culture & history in Boston's North End.) Jonathan also helped in sourcing tickets for both a local NBA & NHL game for the time that we were there. Considering all of the above was discussed & confirmed over email and prepared before my arrival (including the tickets for both the NBA & NHL which were delivered and ready to go at the Hotel) needless to say my expectations were well and truly exceeded by this stage. Jonathan's attention to detail and ability to help the guests queries 100% of the time was a clear standout for this brilliant Hotel. Both Michael & Molly (whom are the other two Concierge's there were also incredibly good to deal with, very helpful and very knowledgeable) Upon arrival to XV Beacon we used the complimentary car service to collect us from 'South Station'. A fantastic feature provided by the Hotel which we used as much as possible to help in getting us around Boston to either dinner reservations or sports games! This was as easy as calling the hotel 10 minutes before the train arrived into South Station and the car was waiting and ready to collect us. The driver we mainly had was a chap by the name of Chris who was absolutely brilliant. He gave us some great local information and insight into Boston and also helped in giving us feedback for some of the things we had already booked. The rooms at XV Beacon were simply stunning. Generous on space, well appointment & fantastic amenities. These alone will guarantee the perfect stay. The Hotel's layout was very appropriate for both its location and size which gave us as guests a very warm welcoming upon arrival. The style in which XV Beacon had been decorated gave a certain charm you don't often find these days in hotels. I have been fortunate to have travelled alot both personally and with work, XV Beacon to date has been the best experience of my travelling life on all levels. A World Class Hotel that will both guarantee a deliver a truly magnificent stay / experience. Both Jonathan (Concierge) & Chris (Driver) are what i would see as incredibly valuable assests to XV Beacon and just helped in making the experience for us one we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicests hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jill970
Reviews.Content: Fifteen Beacon is truly a world class hotel located in the heart of Boston in the beautiful Beacon Hill district. I have traveled exetensively to many different countries throughout the world and have stayed in all the top hotels including the Four seasons, the Ritz, etc. and I can honestly say that this hotel tops them all in overall quality, beauty, and specifically the guest rooms. Every room comes equipped with a beautiful working gas fireplace and a king size plush and comfortable bed. The Westin heavenly bed has nothing on these beds! Fifteen Beacon's rooms are the most spacious and beautiful rooms I have ever stayed in. Their overall character - right down to the beautiful crown molding throughout and big comfortable desiner fabric chairs is spectacular. The rooms come with every amenity you could need and if you don't see something you want, their staff will happily accomodate you. The guest services staff are the nicest and most hospitable staff I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. If you want to stay in an absolutley top notch, beautiful hotel with world class service, Fifteen Beacon is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “World class boutique- don't miss this gem, unbeatable in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Clint V
Reviews.Content: I threw a surprise birthday for my wife in Boston and looked at every hotel in town, ultimately settling on Beacon. We simply could not have been happier. Without question our experience at Beacon stands out as the single best hotel experience I've ever had; simply world class in every respect. The perfect amenities, location and rooms alone are reason enough to stay here, but the service just takes it to a new level. From the valet to the concierge to the front desk, at every opportunity, the Beacon staff never fail to earn your business and respect. The concierge in particular is the best I've ever experienced. From great restaurant recommendations (not a bad one in 4 days) to planning events and logistics, they provide top-notch service. From months before our arrival (about twelve people coming to town) the concierge helped me plan a weekend of events to surprise my wife. From a surprise reception to nights on the town to an impromptu brunch for 12 at the restaurant, they were engaged, personally involved and even followed up after the event to ensure everything was perfect- and indeed it was. Please write if you have any questions- I cannot speak more highly of this place, and we will be back! Finally, a note on the restaurant. I typically feel compelled to avoid hotel restaurants, but the Beacon restaurant is the exception. The brunch we had at Beacon is something we will talk (and dream) about for years, just perfect, relaxed, and absolutely phenomenal. It set a new standard for brunch after a night out- don't miss this place!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!! Stay here”
Reviews.Author: Bullins23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her for a night for our anniversary and couldn't have been more pleased. I could rave on and on but will try to make it concise and to the point. Concierge team is TOP notch. They made dinner reservations, arranged multiple trips in the house car (definitely used this amenity) before I even checked in. Everything was smooth and on time. The manager sent a complimentary bottle of champagne and snacks to our room upon arrival, which was a appreciated. We stayed in a Studio Room which was fantastic. Very nice blend of contemporary and old Boston charm. Well appointed, very nice linens in the bathroom, great selection from the mini bar, bed was SOOO comfortable. Fireplace was great and the surround sound through out the room and bathroom was pretty cool. TV reception wasn't very good, but we only had it on for about 5 minutes anyway. Doorbell for each room was neat and a light on the outside of the door to indicate "service" or "privacy" was something i hadn't seen before, but I liked it. Very clean room and bathroom, loved the hardware in the bathroom and shower. Jetted tub was nice and relaxing. We had room service for breakfast and it was delicious. Only took about about 10 minutes to bring up eggs Benedict, continental breakfast, coffee, juice and a fruit plate. My only complaint it the breakfast was a bit pricy at $60, but for room service I guess I cant complain too much. I will admit it was some of the better room service I've had. I doubt the breakfast would have been better in the restaurant, which is rarely the case with room service, so I guess i can swallow the high price. A wonderful experience for my wife and I and we will certainly be back in the near future for a nice weekend getaway. Great boutique hotel and highly recommended. I would highly recommend trying this out for a more personalized, unique experience rather than some of the luxury "chain" hotels in the city. You wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds all expectations in quality and luxury.”
Reviews.Author: RoninOtter
Reviews.Content: On a brief couples' romp in downtown Boston, we arranged to stay at XV Beacon to take a couple nights away from the crazy daily life. Our well-pampered stay here was just what we needed. If you want to pass on valet parking, the Boston Common Garage is a great alternative right close-by. The hotel itself oozes class and sophistication. Travelers used to hotels that only do the bare minimum are in for a happy surprise. Plus, the genuinely fiendly and endlessly helpful staff will ensure that you do not go wanting for anything. Without doubt a modern hotel, it boasts every convenience expected of a 21st-century establishment. Sure, there's WiFi, an iPod dock, flatscreen TV with surround and an auto-bar, however entering the building feels almost like a step back in time. Like a grand-dame hotel of old compressed into a smaller space, everything from the elevators to the rooms live and breathe an air of experience in the art of elegance. Openly defying today's slap-dash and on-the-cheap culture, XV aims for doing it right the first time. Smack dab in the heart of Beantown within easy walking distance of both the waterfront / Faneuil Hall area and Theatre District, XV Beacon capitalizes on terrific location without skimping on quality. Downtown Crossing is a stone-throw past the State House with food and nightlife just seconds away. Park the car and forget it because between the "walking city" and the hotel's complimentary Lexus car service, you won't need it. Expect to splurge on this trip. But if a swanky few nights on the town are what you're after, look no further. XV Beacon has you covered.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: fernamay
Reviews.Content: this could be the best hotel ever. First of all the location is perfect. The building is a gorgeous old building. Beautiful architecture, and design. You will feel like you are time warped back to old Boston and getting a taste of luxury. The rooms are incredible with fireplaces, large flat screens, surround sound, iPod stereo, posh furniture, jetted tub and oversized shower heads. Even the shampoos, soaps etc. we're high class. I especially enjoyed the vanilla lip balm. The hotel also provides the guest with rooftop access to enjoy a drink and enjoy the skyline The staff is also the best hotel staff I have ever encountered. The valet and bell hop were incredibly helpful. I enjoyed the surpise visit in the early evening by the staff to drop off a plate of gourmet cookies The front desk friendly, and the concierge made the best recommendation for a restaurant ever. It was also pretty nice that the hotel provided a complimentary Lexus and driver for the guests needs. If you stay in Boston and you don't stay here then you are crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, small friendly and excellent car service”
Reviews.Author: Geoggy08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on our first trip to Boston. From the second we arrived, the service was excellent. All the staff we met were friendly and helpful. Special mention to the doorman / concierge Jack who was a real character. Our room was lovely. A studio room with huge and very comfortable king size bed. The hotel gave us a complimentary bottle of Cava to celebrate our wedding anniversary and would happily chill other bottles for us at any time. The room was excellent - gas fire at the touch of a button, high quality TEAC stereo and flat screen TV, plus an ipod dock on the bedside table. A lovely seating area and ample storage with a huge bathroom and excellent shower. What more could we want? A few minor issues with the room were sorted out immediately. Concierge in this hotel were brilliant. Great advice on where to go and booking the house Lexus for drop offs, plus pick ups if the car was free was just a brilliant facility. The location is also perfect. I wouldn't want to have been anywhere else. Beacon Hill on the doorstep, Quincy Market a 5 minute walk and a T stop just around the cornet. The location was simply perfect. We will return to Boston. It is our new favorite US city - so much more laid back than NYC and more of a "European" feel to it. Many thanks XV Boston - we will be seeing you again soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel, with a few flaws.”
Reviews.Author: therealscoutfinch
Reviews.Content: Lovely visit at the XV Beacon this weekend. The rooms are small but beautiful and cozy. Plan to live out of your suitcase, because there is very little space to unpack. The fireplace was wonderful, but made the room quite hot when we came in for the evening. The bathroom is very small, and hot water is hard to come by. The staff was excellent, cannot say enough good things about Molly and Jonothan at the concierge desk. They were both very helpful with restaurant reservations. Car service was a great addition to our trip. We would definitely stay here again. Also, check out Mooo for dinner, great food and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amanda H
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay, furniture was a little worn but quiet and comfortable. Can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: PhilaTraveler22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while traveling on business and it was by far the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in. The second I walked in the room, I knew that I wasn't going to want to leave and ordered myself some room service. It has a very classic style with every modern convenience you could hope for. The bed is very comfortable and the fireplace makes it very cozy. It wasn't cold enough for me to really use the fireplace but I did anyway and cranked up the AC. The shower was also fantastic. I immediately declared that I needed to get myself a rainshower as soon as I was able! It is a pricey hotel but definitely worth it if you can swing it!

Reviews.Title: “Character and a touch of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: GazPerth
Reviews.Content: The XV Beacon is a great pace to stay in Boston. The hotel is located on Beacon street, with about a 5 minute walk to Downtown Crossing, 10 Minutes to Quincey Market, 2 minutes to Boston Common and 15 minutes to Charles Street. So for us, we could forget the car and walk everywhere quite comfortably. Even a walk down to Copely Place only took about 30 minutes. In addition to the hotel restaurant, which offers high quality food and service, there is also a cheaper but good dining option right next door and a Dunkin Doughnuts over the road. We stayed in a Corner Studio which was a good size offerred plenty of light and decorated pretty much like the hotel website pictures. Some aspects of the furniture were starting to show a few scratches and bumps, but overall the quality of furnishings and decoration were definately 5 star. The only thing that bugged me was the restaurant adding 20% tip for a table of two. While the service is definately of the highest order, I think it should still be up to me to add a tip which I think is justified. But overall this is a great, albeit expensive, hotel. Its in a great location for exploring Boston and while a little removed from a variety of dining options. many are available with a modest walk. This hotel comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AVERAGE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: emannh
Reviews.Content: Honestly for a hotel of this caliber I was disappointed with the attention to detail. We had only one bath towel in the room, private bar was locked and had to request it to be opened, no shampoo but two body lotions. I may seem petty with my issues but when you are paying nearly $500 p/n I feel the hotel should anticipate my needs. The XV has an issue with the shower values and it is very difficult to regulate the water temp, had the same problem a few years ago when we stayed here. On the plus side the hotel is very comfortable with in room fireplaces, nice linens and towel. You can not beat the location if you are a tourist with close proximity to all of sights

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Terri879
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this small boutique hotel. The location was fabulous, easy walking distance to lots of sights. The room was small, but romantic, with wonderful decor. It was summer, and we had a fireplace! We will have to go back in the winter to use it. I really liked the way they designed the fireplace, TV, and bar all on one wall opposite the comfy bed. Our bathroom had only one sink and a shower, but it was a luxurious and up to date. Most hotels give you small shampoos etc., but XV Beacon included a cute little lip gloss in a square container with their label. Very chic!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: gepmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the XV Beacon for two nights. The hotel is small and really stylist. Our room was huge and very comfortable. The best thing about our stay was the staff, they were extremely helpful, we wanted to have dinner at Mooo but it was fully booked (it was a Saturday night) but they managed to get us a table as well they gave us great recommendations for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be an outstanding choice”
Reviews.Author: my4sons
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay in three years, so we clearly like staying here. I have reviewed before so I won't drone on. We enjoy the serenity (rarely hear other guests), privacy, and luxury that the rooms afford. The fireplace is such a nice feature, as well as the large bathrooms. The rainshower is so amazing, so powerful. The stereo system needs an upgrade and should integrate with the TV. And I have noticed that the furniture is getting tired. Three years ago, the room was fabulous. This year, I was a bit disappointed with the chairs and couches, they are a bit saggy and worn. Even the mirror in our room had chips on it. However, these are small criticisms. We had a great long weekend and will certainly return. Hopefully management will address the furniture and stereo soon.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: mbboston632
Reviews.Content: as local residents and first time guests, we found this hotel exceeded our expectations. staff were nothing but attentive and hospitable. our room was upgraded upon arrival; we couldn't have asked for more. this is a lovely hotel with not only luxurious amenities but superb staff. we can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful... Great Location... Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: drkoz23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Boston for the first time this past June 2011. As we were planning for our trip... everything I read about XV Beacon made this place seem like a great place to stay. Luckily for us... when we were ready to book... the hotel was part of a Sniqueaway deal and we were able to get a great rate on a Traditional Room for 4 nights. After taking an overnight flight from the west coast... we arrived at Logan around 11 AM. We did not rent a car during our stay and headed for the shuttle bus that takes you to the T Blue-Line. The XV Beacon is a short walk (maybe 5 minutes) from the Government Center station. Upon arrival... I was figuring that we wouldn't be able to get into our room yet... since we were getting to the hotel a bit early. However... the reception was able to get us into our room early so we could clean up after our overnight journey across the country and start our vacation feeling a bit refreshed. The Traditional Room we were given was very spacious but lacked any sort of view (which did not matter to us). The room was well appointed... clean... and very modern. There is a small sitting area as well as a desk. The queen bed was quite comfortable with a large flat panel TV above the fireplace. There also was a stereo system... which was tuned to some relaxing music by the staff who did the turn-down service. Overall... we were quite impressed by the size and design of the room. The only suggestion I would put toward the hotel... since there isn't a shower curtain and just a partial piece of glass in the bathroom separating the tub from the rest of the bathroom... water easily escapes onto the bathroom floor when showering. Its only a minor detail... but we did have to clean up some water after each shower. Day 1... My wife and I visited the New England Aquarium in the afternoon (took the T Blue-Line) which was nice... but nothing like the aquariums in Chicago... Atlanta... or Monterey. It however was enjoyable for the cost. For the evening... since Game 7 of the Stanley Cup was taking place... we decided to go to The Fours to watch the game. The T Green-Line was jam packed heading to this part of the city (since it seemed the whole city of Boston was heading up to near The Garden as well). We luckily were able to get in to The Fours and somehow got a table (I still don't know how). This was 2 hours before the game... so we ordered dinner and then kept ordering drinks while the game was going on. It was quite the experience to see the fans celebrate their first Stanley Cup since 1972. We ended up walking back to our hotel... watching fans celebrate the entire way. Day 2... We accidentally slept in a few extra hours since the bed was so comfy and we were exhausted. This extra sleep probably helped though since we were heading out to do the Freedom Trail. The XV Beacon is in a great location to start the Freedom Trail... only a block or two from Boston Common. We used the Boston Frommers Book to guide us along the trail... which we thoroughly enjoyed. There was nothing to skip... eveything was so interesting. To get back to the harbor... we took the T Ferry back to near the aquarium for dinner. We went to Legal Sea Foods for dinner... which was excellent! The staff was very friendly... and took extra care of my nut allergy. The gazpacho was oh so yummy and my salmon filet cooked to perfection. We chose this as our dinner because we were heading out on a Sunset Harbor Cruise right afterwards. Seeing the city from the harbor was beautiful. We also got to see "Old Ironsides" lower her flag at sunset. Day 3... We did the very touristy think and take the Boston Ducks tour. It was a good way to see the sights of the city while sitting back and relaxing. It definitely was worth the price. Afterwards... we went to Cambridge to take the tour of the Harvard Campus provided by the students. It was a job well done. We got to learn about the history of the campus and learn about some of the famous graduates. For lunch... we visited Mr Bartley's Burger Cottage. Definitely not a healthy meal... but oh-so-tasty! This evening... we went to go see the primary reason we went to Boston for vacation... take in a baseball game at Fenway Park (Brewers v Red Sox). The park is amazing! It should be on everyone's "bucket list". Day 4... Since the Boston Bruins celebration parade was this day... our second baseball game at Fenway was pushed to the evening. So... to get out of the crowds in downtown... we took the T Red-Line to see the JFK Library and Museum. I highly recommend seeing this if you are interested in politics... history... and want to learn more about JFK. After getting back downtown... we visited the Public Gardens and took the famous Swan Boats. What a beautiful area in the middle of a metropolitan area. Then we headed out toward the ballpark with a stop at the Atlantic Fish Co for dinner on a recommendation from the concierge at the XV Beacon. One word about the food... WOW! The clam chowder was amazing and the sea bass just melted in my mouth. Probably our best meal in Boston... even though it was a little pricey it was definitely worth it! Afterwards we headed to Fenway for the ballgame. We actually walked most of the way back to our hotel since the T Green-Line was stuffed from all the fans. Day 5... Departure Day. My wife and I went to the Prudential Building for a view of the city from atop the tower. We were able to pick out many of the landmarks we had visited during our stay. Afterwards... we wandered around the Beacon Hill neighborhood. Finally... we picked up our bags from the XV Beacon and headed back to Logan after a wonder visit to Boston. The XV Beacon was a great starting point for each of our days activities. The hotel is very close to many of the T Lines. The neighborhood is extremely safe and not once did we feel at risk when walking around at night. There are always people around at all hours of the day. The staff at the XV Beacon were very professional... friendly... and helpful. They recommended dinner locations... got us checked into our room early when we arrived... helped us print out our airline boarding passes... and greeted us whenever we got back from a day on the town. The room at the XV Beacon was just what we expected. It is as beautiful as the pictures on their website. The room was comfortable and nicely appointed. If you are thinking about booking here... go for it... you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Purser_LH
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the XV Beacon very much. We got an upgrade to a Studio Room, which we loved. It was extremely spacious and beautifully decorated. For tourists the location of the hotel is very good. The staff is friendly and helpful. The Lexus Service was another highlight and was very convenient. We would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Leah0216
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler, it's always tough to find a great hotel for design, functionality, and service. The XV Beacon was all that and more. This is now my favorite hotel on the East Coast! Where to start?? The staff is incredible. I was greeted by name, warmly welcomed back by the doorman and front desk reception every time I passed through the lobby, and had the pleasure of speaking to the General Manager upon check out- and met her amazing dog, the "mascot" of the hotel. The hotel public spaces and rooms are beautiful. It was such a pleasure to curl up next to the fireplace and watch tv or read a book. And I LOVED that I could hit a button next to my bed to turn off the fireplace! The four poster bed was great. The bed linens and mattress were super soft, and the room was incredibly clean. The technology and functionality of the room was also perfect for a person traveling with ipads, computers, blackberry's etc. Outlets in all the right places, and a great desk space for working. Perfect lighting in the bathroom as well- which is always a plus for ladies. Mooo steakhouse was a real treat. For sure one of the best meals i've had and the service was wonderful. I will be back to the XV Beacon again soon. This is also a really great hotel for a romantic getaway, and you can literally walk everywhere. Close to the fabulous Newbury Street- best shopping in Boston. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just brill”
Reviews.Author: PeterTring
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in XV Beacon Street and had an wonderful time. The room was out of this world and made our stay in Boston better. The staff in the hotel could not anymore to make our stay any better. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sara K
Reviews.Content: As I travel extensively to Boston for business, I have found this divine hotel the perfect place to call my home away from home! The staff is beyond incredible from the Hotel's GM Lovable Dog, Heidi who greets you with a big kiss to the staff that meets your every need! The staff is warm and caring and knows everything about the city! They have aided me in finding great Yoga studios, fine restaurants, getting my shoes repaired better than at home, and getting my pants repaired after I fell in the Boston Commons and suffered from cuts and bruises! I even lost my phone in a taxi and while awaiting my overnight express one of the staff lent me their phone so that I would not be without a means of communication! The room service is superb, rooms delightful, and car service around the city that is priceless!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: ajb6210
Reviews.Content: Magnificent rooms with WOW! SPACE to live in, not just crash for the night. Bath alone is bigger than some rooms elsewhere. Exceptionally clean too. Some negatives: common areas are rather dark. Gym on roof level is small and cold.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale, Modern Design, Centrally-Located, Dog-Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Travelingwithdog
Reviews.Content: As my husband accepted a job transfer to the US for a year, we did extensive research before the move to insure we could get our 10 year old Chesapeake Bay Retriever safely over from Munich to our end destination of Philadelphia. We naturally booked a direct flight and chose a smaller airport (Boston, not JFK or PHL) to minimize as much of the chaos associated with airports as possible. We flew with Lufthansa as they are quite experienced in transporting dogs and seem to take their job seriously compared to some of the carriers out there where misadventures abound. Boston has several modern, upscale hotels that not only accept dogs but cater to them and their owners. After much debate, we chose XV Beacon for its location near The Common so that our dog could romp not far from the hotel. During the planning phase, I found the Concierge there extremely helpful in answering my many questions and in arranging a limo from the airport, roomy enough for our 4 suitcases, dog crate and we three weary travelers. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted in a genuinely friendly manner and shown to our comfortable, well-appointed Corner Suite Room, selected for its roominess and lay out. When we booked our room, we actually took the Dazzle Your Dog package, as I think it was called. So, our dog, upon entering the room, was thrilled to find water, a loaner bed and some apparently very yummy homemade peanut butter dog cookies. And the best part was that her name was written on the cookie plate with edible peanut butter script! Every letter was appreciatively licked up. What a nice treat after the stress of such a long flight and ordeal! As for our comforts, the seating area was well- thought out, the beds not too firm or soft and the shower was modern and the towels lush and thirsty. The whole room design was welcoming. As we were very tired form the long flight and associated stress, we ordered room service which came in good time, was attractively presented and tasted as we expected it to. The disappointment we had was with Moo, the restaurant downstairs. We found the food over-priced for what it was and did not live up to the interesting descriptions on the menu. Then again, we had the less than stellar experience for lunch, our breakfast was okay and our dinner we experienced in our room was also acceptable. Maybe lunch should be avoided. But all in all, the hotel served its purpose for our needs on this trip: We all felt welcome, we were able to decompress after the stress of this unusual trip and enjoyed the service and atmosphere of XV Beacon.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: boooche
Reviews.Content: Celebrated my 18th anniversary at XV Beacon this weekend. Had an amazing time. Beautiful accomodations and the best staff I have ever encountered from the valet to front desk staff to bell hop. All were freindly and helpful. I would definately go back. Architechture was amazing and lots to do and see in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lojaDorset
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent boutique hotel.We stayed here twice during our trip to New England. Once when we arrived in Boston and again two weeks later when we returned for our flight home,four days in total. The room on the higher floor was slightly larger and had more storage space than the one on the lower floor.Both times we were on the back of the hotel facing onto an office block,- not a good view but quiet.The location and accommodation are great but what really makes this hotel special is the excellent staff. Customer service could not have been better.The car service is a bonus. On the last night we splashed out on a meal in the hotel's restaurant, Moo,and it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hanalei_1
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel and a perfect location for the city. This hotel has higher-end appointments and the service is excellent. We stayed for four (4) days and the front office managers call you by name, etc. Ask for a room along the Beacon street side of the hotel - better views. The complimentary Lexus service is a huge bonus - basically, just leave your rental at the hotel. If you're just staying at the hotel, take a cab from the airport. You're within walking distance of all of the Boston historical areas. We recommend a walking tour of Boston as well. Be sure to visit the Holocaust Memorial - it is a very somber, yet moving experience. Great hotel, great service, perfect room amenities. Stay here if you're in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Weekend Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: VTgirl8
Reviews.Content: From the service, to the rooms, to the food, to the excellent customer service - I can't say enough about this hotel. You truly are treated like royalty and made to feel very welcome. Would stay here again in a heartbeat and have recommended this hotel to my friends and family. Thank you for an enjoyable stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RetiredFloridian
Reviews.Content: This charming, elegant hotel was perfect for our six day visit to Boston and we whole-heartedly recommend it. The location in Beacon Hill could not have been better. Staff is friendly, professional and always helpful -- and plentiful. The room was adequate in size with sufficient drawer space, although the bathroom was small (two people could not be in it at the same time unless one was in the shower, and a great shower it was). The furnishings were comfortable, especially the bed, and the decor attractive. A working gas fireplace was a bonus and added to the charm of the room. The amenities of the hotel make one feel pampered including a small plate of sweets on arrival, two newspapers delivered every morning (you choose which ones on check-in) which included the Sunday New York Times, turndown service that includes replacing used towels, bowls of apples and oranges on each floor and, best of all, the complimentary car service. The hotel has a sedan and a SUV, both Lexus, and one or two drivers (depending on day/time) provide complimentary car service within the city. Service that goes from the hotel can be reserved in advance. We had a plan of our activities and on arrival reserved car service for once or more each day. The driver then gives you his cell phone number, and when you are out and about you can call directly and, if the driver has time available, he will pick you up where you are and take you someplace else or back to the hotel. We tipped $5 each trip, but even more than the savings in taxi fares was the pleasure of being treated like royalty. There were just two things that marred what would have been a perfect hotel. The lighting in the room was inadequate overall (although bathroom lighting was fine) and there is no coffee service in the room or in the lobby. Coffee at the hotel's attached restaurant Moo is $4, expensive even for Boston. In fact, we ate breakfast there one morning and for two coffees, one bagel with cream cheese and one omelet (served with potatoes but no bread or toast) the bill with tax and the included 20% tip was $38. Fortunately, half a block away is a Dunkin Donuts, as well as a cafeteria (Monday to Friday only) and a small convenience store. We would definitely stay at XV Beacon again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Content: If you want a top knotch hotel, staff and perfect location this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cat55PerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It is situated in the nicest part of Boston, on top of the hill and within walking distance to many of the local attractions and also very nice shops and restaurants. The only criticism was the room was smallish, however the bed was really comfortable and the rain shower to die for. The complimentary rides in the Lexus was also a nice touch and the staff were very knowledgeable and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: WashintonDCTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the XV Beacon in June 2011, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location is perfect for visiting historic downtown Boston, and we used the complimentary car service to visit locations outside of walking distance. Our room was very nice, and we particularly loved the gas fireplace, which came in handy during an unseasonably cool and rainy weekend. The staff was friendly and attentive. They even offered to send someone to a local pharmacy to pick up some bubble bath when we asked if they had any. We would gladly stay here again next time we're in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury beyond compare”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan075
Reviews.Content: XV Beacon is a feast for the senses. The rooms are spacious and modern with carefully appointed accessories and furnishings that are luxurious and comfortable. The towels and linens provided are top-notch. The location of the hotel can not be beat, most everything in Boston is a short walk away, and if not, the hotel Lexus limo will happily whisk you away to your destination. The staff is friendly and not at all pretentious, they really make you feel at home. The concierge staff is knowledgeable and provided some fantastic recommendations to area restaurants - made reservations for dinner and the limo to take us there and back. If you're heading to Boston, make sure XV Beacon your place to stay - you'll enjoy every minute there.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at XV Beacon now for years.”
Reviews.Author: scott w
Reviews.Content: The finest service in Boston. The front desk, concierge, room service all get the highest marks from me. Room service is fast and excellent!! Everyone who works at the hotel are friendly and courteous. At XV Beacon your not just another guest with a room key, you are made to feel like you just walked into your house. I love it

Reviews.Title: “xv”
Reviews.Author: beanielf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights. The rooms are very nice and large. We had two studio rooms that connected. My complaint is that for the money I expect perfect. Our tub had calk that was cracking and mold growing. The shower only has one big rain shower that is not adjustable so water just falls on top of you. There is no complimentary water left by your bed at night or any offerings of coffee in the am. After staying at The Jefferson in Washington this hotel really did not live up to my expectations. The staff were very nice and helpful especially when a $60 charge from the restaurant was charged to my bill and we had not eaten there.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: WernosMGP
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel, especially liked the way the rooms were thought out, with the electronic controls next to the bed, mini flat screens in the bathrooms and overall comfort. Was given a complimentary upgrade overlooking the park, thank you! Bar service could have been a Little frendlier but all in all I would highly recommend this hotel over the more commercial hotel options Boston seems to have to much of.

Reviews.Title: “It's ALL in the details - First Class & Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: KimVancouverBC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many top notch hotels around the world. It's the attention to details that make this boutique hotel stand out. This includes both the rooms and in the service provided by its staff. Kudos to the owner. It's obvious he knows what it takes to accommodate clientelle who enjoys and expects a certain standard of accommodations and service. Having a majority of their staff still within their employment from the hotel's initial opening speaks volumes in terms of how they are treated and respected. The staff take pride in every aspect of being a part of a classy understated establishment. It's evident. Having worked for a US Fortune 500 organization with 42,000 employees for many years and in charge of operations, I'm not easily impressed with how businesses operate but when I see one operating in the manner XV Beacon does along with the commitment of all its staff extended through their concientiousness, care and effort, I was TRULY IMPRESSED. Like some have mentioned in other reviews, yes, the lobby is dark and yes, the rooms may also be a bit on the dark side during the day but I would think most people don't check into this hotel to stay in during the daytime hours. It is a perfect setting in the evening if you wish to come back to a tranquil, handsome, and soothing space and remove yourself from the bustle of a business day or having navigated a city full of tourists. Keep up the efforts. It shows and is appreciated. I guess what doesn't hurt is what appears to be an owner with the resources and coommitment to keep everything in fresh form in the rooms and of top quality in every arena. If you like frilly fussy styled establishments, this isn't the place for you. If you like eloquence, professionalism, and efficiency executed at every level, try XV Beacon. I don't recommend much but wholeheartedly do so in this instance. Congratulations to all involved with this establishment. A job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations”
Reviews.Author: laundrygal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at XV Beacon for five nights in August on a sightseeing trip. Check in was easy and our room was gorgeously furnished. We had a small plate of treats on the desk to greet us, each was delicious. Our room was on a corner on the 7th floor and very quiet. We never heard noise from the street (we were toward the back of the building) or our neighbors. We ate brunch at Mooo! and enjoyed it but we also loved a simple breakfast around the corner at Fill-a-Buster next to the state house, or a little further down the road at the Paramount. The hotel was very well placed -- we were able to walk to several T stations to easily access the green, red and blue lines. We were also able to walk to the Freedom Trail, North End, the waterfront and throughout Beacon Hill. The staff was very pleasant and friendly throughout our stay. However, we did not make use of the concierge or front desk staff during our stay so can't comment on that service. We found only two very mild drawbacks to this hotel. First, the shower shield on the tub that is meant to keep water from splashing onto the floor leaked, I believe from a design flaw. The cleaning staff gave us extra towels to use as an extra thick bathmat but it was an annoyance. Hopefully this will be fixed with better shield. The second drawback was the television didn't seem to be high def and the analog channels were a little fuzzy. These drawbacks were not major to us and the benefits and character of this hotel far outweighed them. If we return to Boston (which we hope to!), XV Beacon will be first on our list for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Jewel in the Middle of the City”
Reviews.Author: Putt4Doe
Reviews.Content: I was only able to spend one nite at the XV and tried to extend to a second nite to no avail. My one nite was very impressive, and look forward to coming back again in the future. This isn't your 'cookie-cutter' Starwood or Marriott property, the XV is a boutique hotel with alot of character and fantastic customer service. I stayed in one of the 'classic'/regular rooms and was very satisfied with the layout of the room. It was an excellent find and highly recommend to anyone looking for a nice place to stay centrally located in downtown Boston. If you're expecting a Starwood or Marriott - don't come, it isn't a cardboard cutout room.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & Service”
Reviews.Author: vicnlibby
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night (so wish we stayed for at least two) for my birthday. The Corner Studio is lovely and very comfortable. The service was friendly, efficient and very helpful. The concierge was very helpful, they had arranged for a beautiful flower arrangement to be delivered to the room for my birthday at my boyfriends request. It was waiting there for us when we arrived in the room. They also helped in getting us reservations for dinner and arranging the car service for us to take us to dinner. One downer was we couldn't get the car service later, simply because we didn't book it ahead and I think it stops at about midnight. No worries though, rarely do you have a problem getting a cab in Boston. The bed was very comfortable and I slept better than I had in a very long time. The fireplace added to the great atmosphere. One minor suggestion would be to maybe swap the location of the couch with the desk so the couch is facing the fireplace and TV. The stereo was wired to play throughout the room and bathroom with a separate volume control in the bathroom, very nice! The rain shower was fantastic, water pressure was perfect and the heated towel rack was a nice extra touch. The room overall was spacious and very comfortable for the two of us, for once we weren't running into each other or climbing over things to get around. Just a wonderful hotel. Check out the view from the roof top terrace, just amazing. Only problem is that now I don't want to stay anywhere else in Boston. :)

Reviews.Title: “Charming, central and sophisticated, with wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: AustralianWillTravel
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with friendly and helpful staff that made it an absolute pleasure to stay here. The rooms are light and comfortable and beautifully decorated. The location is fantastic, just a short walk to Boston Common, The Freedom Trail, the historic sights and wonderful restaurants. Just a little walk further is the waterfront and great shopping. The subway is nearby, and this is an efficient way to travel a bit further. It's only half an hour to Salem! The staff are fantastic, and nothing is a problem. Ask the concierges anything and they will deliver. The staff at the front desk are particularly helpful. And thanks Mitch, for lending my husband your golf clubs!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, chic and friendly - a winning combo”
Reviews.Author: EssexPaul
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, excellent service and unbeatable food at Mooo! the restaurant affiliated to the hotel. It's absolutely perfectly positioned too, just shy of the common. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could hope for and more”
Reviews.Author: joolsmorris
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful boutique hotel with every amenity you could wish for. The rooms were spacious, well-equipped and extremely comfortable. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, at any hour, and all our requests were dealt with immediately. They were extremely gracious in accommodating us during our problems due to Hurricane Irene. The bar is a welcoming but elegant place to hang out and the food in both bar and restaurant was fabulous, we ate here three times during our stay. There was a great roof terrace where you could enjoy your drinks in the sunshine.The limousine service was a nice touch, and the hotel was convenient for all top sites and amenities of Boston. A wonderful hotel, I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to anyone wanting luxury in the heart of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, specious rooms, luxury transportation service”
Reviews.Author: hamad94
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying in this hotel with my teenager twins. The room was big and there was space for our 4 big luggages. The staff were really nice and helpful. There lemosine car service was excellent. The location of the hotel is near everything we need from resturants, subways, shopping and the big garden. I'll come to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday in Boston Boutique”
Reviews.Author: netgrowth
Reviews.Content: Quaint, excellent service, room service was 4-5 star. Rooms are small, and the shower just has a curtain, which was disappointing, but the water pressure made up for it. Very private rooftop garden with jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beth06
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel with all the luxury you'd expect....bedding, bath, shower, vibe!!! great concierge and the car service sends this place over the top.....the restaurant Moo for dinner was great....noisy, hard to hear your dining partner, but very nice....small gym but still within the hotel so that was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “third time-still a charm!"”
Reviews.Author: 416sheree
Reviews.Content: our third trip to XV Beacon--they can NOT do enough for you--from the minute you walk in until their free sedan takes you to the train station for your departure--wonderful decor, concierge, door man, driver, check-in, room service--and the restaurant is great for steak! we will be back again and again and again

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Boutique Hotel right in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Slipless71
Reviews.Content: This is a five star calibre boutique hotel Rooms are spacious with fireplaces as sitting area Great restaurant Walking distance to parks, sights, newbury street. Very comfortable in all aspects. Complementary car service to all destinations within 2 miles

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: tfitz13
Reviews.Content: We travel with friends once or twice a year, from knocking around the Marais in Paris to relaxing in a bungalow in Belize. This time we chose a long weekend in Boston, and stayed at the XV Beacon. The Concierges, both Jill and Michael were very helpful. We had a last minute change on 1 request and Jill took care of it with no fuss. Her attitude was always, "we can make it happen". Mitch at the front desk always greeted us with a smile. At the last minute, we decided to dine at MOO, which has a well deserved reputation. PJ had us seated at a lovely round table in no time despite the bustle of arriving guests with reservations! Now the room: we had a junior suite which was generous in size. The four of us often wound down with a drink in our sitting area. That same area was spacious enough to accommodate a couples massage with 2 therapists. Amenities were well thought out and the bed was very comfortable. Everything was spotless! Turn down service each evening included the next day's forecast and ice, a thoughtful touch. In fact, those well thought out details and gracious staff were the things that elevated the XV Beacon from a nice boutique hotel, to one worth returning to again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor and some faults”
Reviews.Author: xvintagepearls
Reviews.Content: Our family has been coming to Boston for several years and has always stayed at the Westin. After reading the recent reviews regarding bed bug reports, our family decided to try a different hotel, XV Beacon. While the hotel's decor was certainly very nice, there were several negative things that my family and I found while staying at this hotel. Firstly, the staff is lovely and very friendly. Unfortunately, however the service is extremely slow. On one occasion we were told by room service that someone would be up in 10 minutes with our ice cream, however it took nearly 40 minutes for them to bring the ice cream. And this was after we had called down to see where our food was. Secondly, the classic room is extremely small (compared to other hotels), and can barely fit a rollaway. If you are a family larger than 2, you are going to need more than a classic room to fit your family comfortably. Thirdly, the classic room DOES NOT have a bath tub. So, if you are looking for a bath tub, the classic room is not a room for you. The reason I am writing about this is it is not explicitly stated on the website. Aside from 1 hotel that I stayed in in Europe, I have never stayed at a hotel that did not have a bathtub or bath/shower combination. On the other hand, we found the breakfast to be quite delicious. They were very accommodating and the order came out quickly. It is however, expensive. Breakfast for two people was nearly $60.00 for 2 egg dishes and a cup of coffee. While it certainly did not affect our stay at XV Beacon, I would like to make mention of the fact that the hotel's online reservation system is not updated. When my family wanted to upgrade our room, the front desk told us that no rooms were available. However, when we went online shortly after and tried to book room for the night it allowed us to chose from several different options. It even allowed you to put in all your credit card information etc. and book a room. Just to be safe, if you book a room online, I would call the hotel to verify that you have secured a room. If I had arrived to the hotel and not had the room I paid for, I would have been extremely upset!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent..unique”
Reviews.Author: Krmrn55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at XV Beacon for 4 nights the end of July. We had a fabulous experience here...loved the room...we had a sitting area and fireplace always love rooms with a little foyer. The staff was friendly warm and accomodating the concierge helped us get wonderful seats to Fenway and the house car was available all week( it does help to give her all your appointments ahead of time) moo the restaurant was about to close as we arrived late but they accommodated us and we had a great meal as well as a few breakfast. Room service coffee and breakfast was good and fast My one complaint and downgrade was the wi fi was so poor. Numerous calls to desk and support still didnt resolve the slowness of wi fi so if doing business. You must be able to plug into ethernet

Reviews.Title: “Need to sort out wifi”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: Welcoming reception - we were early checking in before 12 noon and our room wasn't ready but they took our cases and put them in our room whilst we went shopping. Room 804 is lovely: a big studio room, with four windows onto Beacon Street, comfy bed, separate sitting area with chairs, sofa, tv, desk, mini bar and fireplace. Bathroom smallish with shower over bath, and separate sink unit and small walk-in closet. Shower awesome. Decor very smart and quite light. Wifi available but poor on the 8th floor: it was best by the door, but failed to send an e-mail, even in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Room OK, Breakfast Revolting”
Reviews.Author: grw1947
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, if a bit overpriced. The location is very good. But the breakfast, omigod the breakfast at the hotel restaurant. It was not only overpriced ($16 for an omelette and then an additional $2 for toast!), but it was inedible. Perhaps the worst omelette I have ever tried in my 60+ years. It looked like a skullcap, had the texture of a bathroom sponge, and tasted like athlete's foot.

Reviews.Title: “It takes more than a nice decor to make a boutique hotel unique”
Reviews.Author: Frank G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beacon XV for three nights and admittedly, the hotel has a unique decor and cachet. The rooms are decorated with taste, it is small and personal, but somehow it did not do it for us. The reasons are a staff that is polite, but conveys a feeling that is also has other worries. For example, the concierge, sitting 2-3 meters away from the front desk, talks with the receptionist on duty with a loud voice to be heard by his colleague, in our presence, worse, talking about other guests: it this necessary? There is stress in the air....is the hotel understaffed? Then on another level, one sink for a room occupied by two persons is a bit cheap. Must the minibar really be stocked with half bottles of wine worth more than $100? The decor is nice, but more suited for the winter (all is quite dark and little view from the rooms). The location is top, as well as the restaurant (Mooo...). In short, it very expensive, but go there on an expense account...

Reviews.Title: “Yes it was a nice hotel.........”
Reviews.Author: PennyBermuda
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a three night stay. Overall the hotel does impress and the staff were absolutely fantastic, very helpful and obliging. My observations are: 1. It is a dark hotel, the lobby quite dark "atmospheric" and the rooms were also very dark with nothing of a view, and faced with an office directly opposite we had to keep the curtains closed and due to the dim lighting in the room had to go to the bathroom if I needed to do anything that needed a good light. 2. Queen size beds and not the best mattress quality, i was really surprised at this being such a classy hotel. We had a room on the third floor and had to ask to be changed as it was very noisy during the night with traffic outside our window. The staff obliged and we were put on the 7th floor which immediately was quieter and lighter (but not by much). 3. On our last morning we needed to be up and about by 5.30 to get an early flight and when my husband rang for coffee we were told by the reception that it wouldn't be available until 7 when mooo opened. I was not a happy bunny!!!! They advertise 24 room service and yet failed to deliver with coffee for the early risers. Why advertise 24 hour if it's not. Eventually I just couldn't function and rung down and told the guy that I wanted coffee and that they advertised 24 hour so why couldn't I have it??? If you're not going to provide coffee on a 24 hour basis then suggest you get coffee makers in the rooms. Finally at approximately 6.45 coffee arrived. The bathrooms are OK - we had a studio. Bath small but then this is Boston where I suppose space is at a premium. We used the hot tub on the first night as it was open, but when we tried to use it again the next two nights it was covered up and not working. Again, if you're going to advertise a facility then please leave it open during the hours you state it will be (7 am till 1 pm) we shouldn't have to wait for an hour for someone to come and sort it out. It was certainly warm enough all it needed doing was switching on but we couldn't find the switch to do it ourselves. Would have loved use of the hot tub after a long day of walking round town. I can't say enough about the staff who were so pleasant and helpful from the door men, to the drivers, concierge (who were fantastic) and the reception - perhaps with the one exception of the reception guy on nights who wasn't the happiest person there but then I suppose after a night on night shift (without coffee) I wouldn't be either. Storage wasn't that fantastic either for a studio room. One hanging space with a couple of drawers underneath (kept having to move shoes to open the drawers) and baskets on top of the hanging space which was just too bulky and impractical. I wanted drawers, a chest of drawers that all pull out to put my clothes. And the hanging rail wasn't that long as i wear maxi dresses and long skirts these were dragging over the side. Would I go back........ don't think so, I think I would try other hotels that really do provide 24 hour room service and coffee when you want it and have a hot tub that really is available to use. I would recommend for location and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel and perfect for special Occasions!”
Reviews.Author: Laura1565
Reviews.Content: Well my fiance surprised me and actually proposed to me at this hotel! I can't say enough good things about the hotel and the staff! This was such a special place for us and the staff was just amazing. We loved not having to worry about transportation since the hotel has a driver. We also loved that we could walk places around town even in the freezing weather when we went. The hotel rooms are beautiful and it feels like you are the only one's at the hotel. It's a tad on the expensive side but well worth it! Especially if you are going for a reason or romantic trip!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: KNUCCI
Reviews.Content: Situated between the Boston Common and Fanieul Hall it is a lovely hotel. Rooms are very comfortable with a desk, fireplace and flat screen tv. Fresh foot by elevator on each floor and a town car available, free of charge thru the concierge. Very service oriented and luxurious. Downsides: Queen beds in many rooms and no views,

Reviews.Title: “A+++++++++++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: lmcclain
Reviews.Content: XV Beacon sets standards that most others could not/would not live up to. Upon arrival to the hotel guests are greeted by courteous and attentive bellmen. Carlos and Mark are two that I remember. They are helpful not with just luggage, but they have travel tips and dining tips as well. The lobby is not large but it is full of welcome and the concierge staff (Jonathan, Julie and Michael) is usually there to be of assistance. They arranged car service, dinner reservations and theater tickets. They seriously go out of their way to address every need. We saw Jonathan loan his shoes to a guest who needed something besides his sneakers to wear out for the evening-this is no joke. I can't imagine anyone else doing this. Check in was quick and easy. We stayed in room 706-Corner suite. It overlooks Beacon Hill. It is the perfect room. It is spacious but not pretentious. It was comfortable for our 6 day stay. We had plenty of room to sit and put our feet up after a long day of walking. The room is well appointed and gives that 'home" feeling. There is a stereo (with sound throughout the room), a gas fire place and a mini-bar like I've never seen. There is something to please every palate in there. The bathroom utilizes the space in a well thought out manner and the toiletries are nice. Our room was tended to twice a day and they did an excellent job. In the evenings when we came back from dinner, our bed was turned down, the music was playing and the next day's weather forecast was left for us. The room attendant always did a top notch job. The temperature in the room was easily controlled. We were never uncomfortable. We got room service for breakfast one morning. It was delivered quickly and the meal was delicious. The fitness room was great. There are treadmills, a life cycle and free weights. It was cool in there and there were clean towels and cool water. The roof top patio has a beautiful view. You can see a lot of Boston from there. There was comfortable patio furniture up there and you can order room service items for up there. Overall the hotel is very quiet. I can truly tell you we never heard a slamming door or water running. The only noise we ever heard was a garbage truck one morning. XV Beacon exceeds every expectation possible. The staff is thoughtful and attentive. They are hard workers who strive to ensure the comfort and happiness of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Great Service, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MIKENANCYToronto
Reviews.Content: This Central Hotel had excellent service - the complimentary Lexus was always offered when avaliable. The staff were very helpful - they made reservations for us at restaurants before we arrived and reserved the complimentary car. Boston had record heat on our stay - the a/c broke down but was eventually fixed (our rate was adjusted for our trouble) - the staff did the best they could always offering cold water etc...Rooms were beautiful, 2 adults and 2 children had enough space in our rooms. Would recommend this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance on Beacon HIll”
Reviews.Author: nyc333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our recent stay at this gem of a boutique hotel on Boston's legendary Beacon Hill. From the moment we arrived we were treated with warmth and professionalism by this top notch staff. The property and room were well designed and comfortably luxurious. The sophisticated inviting surroundings were an oasis of taste and comfort. We were able to take advantage of the complimentary car service which was a convenience much appreciated by us. We are looking forward to our next stay at XV Beacon and will continue to sing its praises to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, nothing to shout about”
Reviews.Author: Love-travel-culture
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location - great for getting to the shops and restaurants of Back Bay, strolling nearby Beacon Hill and the business district. The hotel lobby is small and dark with hardly anywhere to sit, much less take a drink. The rooms, though nicely done and comfortable, are equally dark (and we were on one of the 'high' floors, floor 9), not helped by the choice of furnishings with lots of dark wood floor to ceiling. The windows look directly into neighbouring offices so necessary use of the blinds and curtains also exacerbated this. Breakfast in their evening restaurant is fine, if a rather hushed, formal setting. The staff are friendly and helpful enough. I could stay here again but would probably try another hotel if I were going back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, without a view”
Reviews.Author: GreenMountainLover
Reviews.Content: I wanted so badly to fall in love with XV Beacon, but we parted only as friends.
