My husband and I stayed here over the Fourth of July mainly to take advantage of the rooftop deck for fireworks viewing. We stayed in a Classic Room--the least expensive room type. The room was nicely appointed with showcases like a cashmere throw, a gas fireplace (which is likely delicious in the winterâ€”not so beneficial in the summer), a doorbell, and built-in speakers. This room taught me two valuable lessonsâ€”to be perfectly happy I need a view and a bathtub: this room had neither. When I inquired at the front desk I learned that all Classic Rooms (and all of the least expensive room types at XV Beacon) face the alley behind the hotel which is approximately 20 feet from a Class B office building (complete with people working at their desks). Given the premium of space in Boston, especially in Beacon Hill this makes perfect sense, but when paying an average of $401.72 per night (including all taxes) in an attempt to escape from my own office job, I didnâ€™t care to face directly into someone elseâ€™s office. While there is no way to upgrade the view for these rooms, the hotel could mitigate the situation by installing sheers behind the light-blocking curtains. If there were sheers, the curtains could be opened to let in light (the strategic lighting in the room created a unique atmosphere, but was way too dark for dressing, unpacking, packingâ€¦), provide privacy, and give the impression of a more desired view. XV Beaconâ€™s rooftop deck delivered the fireworks with a decent view of the harbor and speakers which pumped in the Fourth of July broadcast. During the rest of our stay we were able to enjoy the hot tub on the rooftop deck when we planned ahead. The challenge was the hot tub required a call ahead of one hour to pre-heat and closed at 11:00pm, which eliminated a spontaneous end-of-the-day dip (and we missed out on our anniversary because we stayed out on the town until 10:00pm). The fitness room which has excellent equipment located indoors adjacent to the hot tub has more flexible hours. The aesthetic features are what make this hotel truly special. The transparent elevator shafts add interest and excitement and the apple and orange bowls around the hotel serve one part ambiance, one part late-night snack which is especially good because Boston is a city that shuts down early. The stairwell is constructed of gorgeous marble of a bygone era, but we got the sense that guests are supposed to travel by elevator as the stairwell is home to housekeepingâ€™s staging area and used room service items are placed on the stairs. We chose XV Beacon because we were looking for something intimate, but even with the boutique-nature of the hotel it had a busy, hurried feel. Overall, XV Beacon is a beautiful hotel in a prime location with a hardworking staff. While it likely would be ideal for business or family travel, it is just missing a certain je ne sais quoi for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Special and unique boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: K_P_S24
Reviews.Content: beautifully designed, friendly staff, great location and all the special touches

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dfund
Reviews.Content: We stayed at XV Beacon on July 4 and had a wonderful experience. This boutique hotel is located next to the State House and within walking distance of most Boston attractions. Service was outstanding. Check-in was a breeze, valet parking efficient, bellman very courteous, and the restaurant staff most accommodating. Our room was beautifully appointed, very comfortable and quiet (we slept quite soundly). The wild mushroom frittata for breakfast in the hotel restaurant is not to be missed! We look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAWItravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what a 5 star boutique hotel is supposed to be like. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The bedrooms were immaculate and classily decorated, not over done. The amenities were perfect. Room service had a large and wonderful menu to choose from and you can choose from food in the restaurant that is downstairs also. The food was absolutely tremendous. If you get a chance go up to the rooftop garden it is absolutely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: n00dles
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! I stayed here with my husband for just one night before having to switch over to the Liberty (where the wedding party was staying...eh.). For such a luxurious hotel, the staff was so kind and unpretentious. Here are the things I loved: -Great location - close to: the start of the Freedom Trail and most of the historic landmarks on the Trail; Faneuil Hall for food/shopping; downtown; the pier and the Legal Seafood in the area; the T and a few of its lines; a convenience store -Very special room - our Traditional room did not look at all like your standard hotel room. It was spacious, had character, was romantic. Loved the sound system. Bathrooms were beautiful. Loved the fireplace and shelves. Looked just like the pictures on the website. I liked how the water flow for the shower was not restricted by a water saving device. (I'm not into wasting water, but sometimes hotels restrict the flow too much!) Nice toiletries. -Special touches - small plate of treats including cookies and chocolate-dipped strawberry welcome you when you arrive to your room; complimentary driver (yes - you can have someone drive you places!); complimentary shoe-shining. They promptly responded to our request for hot water to be delivered to our room. I regret not checking out the roofdeck. :( I will rave about this hotel to everyone I know. The room was so cozy, I felt like I was staying in a condo, not a hotel. STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “XV Beacon--forget the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: The absolute best amenity that XV Beacon offers is the complimentary Lexus and driver, available to take you to your destination of request in Boston. We used the car three times; twice for restaurants, and another time for a gallery visit on Newbury Street. Other posters have raved about the rooms and personal service; we can only second their kudos. The personal attention and intimate scale of this hotel offers a totally different experience than the luxury chains i.e. Four Seasons or Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING BOUTIQUE HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: laurelerin22
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at XV Beacon while attending a friend's wedding in Boston (wedding was at a different hotel). I cannot say enough good things about this hotel! I only wish we had been able to stay there more than one night. It was beautiful, the service was impeccable (we got a free upgrade to a one-bedroom suite at check-in), and the room was amazing: huge flat-screen TV, gas fireplace, killer stereo with speakers everywhere (including the bathroom!), TV in the bathroom, awesome rain shower and jetted tub, and THE MOST COMFORTABLE BED I have ever slept in at a hotel. The location is fantastic as well - right off of Boston Common and within walking distance to the subway and lots of the sights in the city. We were really impressed with the front desk concierge, who called us shortly after we checked out to alert us that we had forgotten something (I think most hotels would've just tossed it in the trash). We weren't able to return to get the item, so the hotel express shipped it to us that day (shipping charges were billed to my card on file). Oh, and one minor little thing that I was also impressed with: for being such a high-end hotel, the mini-bar prices were really reasonable! This is an expensive hotel, but well worth a splurge for a special occasion (or if you happen across a great sale, like we did!) I would recommend XV Beacon to ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “Like Coming Home”
Reviews.Author: wendytruth
Reviews.Content: This is the sort of hotel you go to when you want to be pampered. From the moment you step out of your car they are there to help you and great you by name. The complimentary car is a blessing when you need to run errands around Boston. The food - both in the restaurant and room service - is first rate - even if it is a bit pricey. The gym is small but the view is great and the equipemnt first rate. The beds are super comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Just Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: THX-LDN
Reviews.Content: Staff really helpful and friendly, hotel immaculate, rooms comfortable yet deluxe. Very centrally located for all that Boston has to offer. Free use of the hotel town car was really useful. Canâ€™t recommend it highly enough â€“ will be going back next time Iâ€™m in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Lune14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well worth the stellar reviews. Located in Boston's prime neighborhood, Beacon Hill, it is walking distance to main touristic, business and shopping sites, and has easy connections to public transportation, including the "T" to the airport. There are other hotels with same attractions, but what sets this one apart is the attentive yet unobtrusive service, and the classy modern decor and amenities. It is a small hotel which makes you feel like coming back to your own apartment in Boston. It is a quiet place and the beds are heavenly comfortable! I will certainly come back here when I return to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: gussington
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel and only ever received the most courteous and friendly service at all times. We were greeted each time we returned to the hotel and made to feel welcome. Any questions we had were answered efficiently and help offered. Although we didn't use the bar in the room, it was incredibly well stocked. The towels were soft and very white. The room decor was a nice blend of modern and comfort with no jarring colours. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would happily use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel, exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: YolyNewton
Reviews.Content: Everything about our 4 night stay here was perfect. We came with our two teenage sons and per the reservationist suggestion booked a corner studio. It provided us with ample room, great amenities, and super comfy beds. The best thing about staying here besides the hip factor, was the exceptional concierge service! All of the staff helped to make it a special trip!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant boutique hotel with lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: brill95
Reviews.Content: We really couldn't find much fault with the XV Beacon. It's in a good location at the top end of Boston Common - on a busy street where it's noisy during the day but quiet at night so you get a good night's sleep.The staff were all welcoming, pleasant and polite. The rooms were very comfortable, and delightful in appearance with one major problem - no blinds at all, with no privacy - so unless you wanted to walk around in full view of the office workers across the street with a perfect view into your room, you had to keep the curtains closed. If you want to dine in the restaurant attached to the hotel you have to make a reservation, there is no priority system if you are a guest in the hotel. We wanted dinner one night but despite asking to help us get a reservation the front desk said they couldn't as the restaurant had nothing to do with the hotel, which was rather curious . This is an expensive hotel and I think if you are paying this amount you possibly might want all the services that go with a luxury hotel - that said, these were two niggles in what was essentially a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: SJM061
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at XV Beacon on a recent trip to Boston and believe this hotel to be one of the best we have ever stayed in. From the doorman to the front desk staff the service was impeccable. Everyone was friendly and more than willing to assist us with directions and reservations and anything else we required. The rooms are truly beautiful and the working fireplace was such a treat on a frosty Boston evening. We also had the opportunity to dine at 'Moo" the hotel's restaurant and everything was delicious. the package we booked included breakfast which we chose to take in our room - it was delivered promptly and was of the highest quality. This hotel is worth every cent it costs to stay here

Reviews.Title: “The best boutique hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: nuggets00
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying at XV Beacon. It's a great small hotel with personalized service in a great location downtown. The prices are pretty steep though so I would say that unless you want to stay at a unique full service small boutique hotel, you might be better off looking elsewhere. If you stay here be sure to try the neighboring Scollay Square restaurant if you like bloody mary's. They have a make your own bloody mary bar! The good: the hotel has a warm cozy feel, staff is very polite and courteous; rooms are unlike any others that I've been in, for example: stereo system with built in speakers throughout the room, working gas fireplace, tastefully decorated as if you are in someone's home, electronic do not disturb/clean my room signal so you don't have to fiddle with door hangars, good size flat screen TV, jacuzzi bathtub; real flowers in the bathroom; nice towels; towel heater in bathroom; TV in bathroom; very nice headboard or four poster bed (depending on what type of room you get); free parking if you have a Lexus and free use of the hotel Lexus with driver who can take you around town as needed; they provide complimentary business cards with your hotel address on them; nightly turn down service; very good restaurant downstairs (Mooo); free wireless internet that's pretty fast; complimentary fruit in the hallways. The OK: the bath products are just so-so, bathtub drained slowly, television in bathroom is a nice touch however it doesn't work (said "no signal"); shower partition leaked a fair amount of water on the floor after taking a shower, elevators could use some freshening up (carpet, walls, and buttons are worn). The Bad: nothing

Reviews.Title: “two different experiences”
Reviews.Author: emu711
Reviews.Content: i've stayed here twice, once in feb 2010 and again feb 2011. the first stay, we had a 2bd suite, and i have no complaints about that stay. the rooms were very nice, we had fresh brand toiletries. it was excellent. the second time, we had a single room, and didn't have the nice toiletries (i am a huge fan of fresh), and the room just wasn't as clean as i wanted it to be. small stains here and there - needed a bit more attention to detail. it's a great location (though you have an uphill/downhill walk to/from the common), and the staff is very nice. i LOVE the working fireplaces in each room. we like the restaurant's breakfast. going again in the next month, so we'll see if there are any differences!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leapinluluHartfordCT
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at XV Beacon after driving up from Connecticut to catch a Celtics game. The hotel is lovely. It is old in style, however has every modern convience. The rooms are beautiful and unbelievably quiet. We were going to walk to Faneuil Hall, but Mark the Courtsey Car driver for the hotel said that he would take us. He had great recomendations for restaurants and even called to get us a dinner reservation while he was driving us to the restaurant (which by the way was FANTASTIC)!!! Hotel also offers free WIFI. I have stayed at many places where you are paying over $500 a night and they cant even through in WIFI (a little peeve that drives me crazy) I would gladly pay a little more for a higher level of service. And would pick XV Beacon again because of Mark the Courtsey Driver.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: maximilianIreland
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor. This is a very good hotel but it is by no means the best hotel I have stayed in. It is in a great location and the staff are excellent in terms of service and friendliness. However, I was expecting the rooms to be much better in terms of size based on their hotel rates. This is an expensive hotel to stay in and while the Moo Bar and Restaurant serves great food, it is also expensive. Similar to another review here, I did at times find it difficult to get a good night's sleep as my room faced on to Beacon Street and you could still hear a lot of noise from the street late at night and from early morning. A very good hotel but it could offer better value.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Luxury!! XV Beacon is #1”
Reviews.Author: DLW262
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel XV Beacon on 8 separate occasions over the course of 8 years. This hotel is a lovely botique hotel with luxury accomodations, impeckable service, extreme cleanliness. The Ritz Carlton has nothing on XV Beacon when it comes to service and accommodations. Each year I visit XV Beacon for a week and am always greeted by smiling faces who remember me by name. The accommodations never disappoint. The service is never less than excellent. Employees at this hotel are the same people that were there for my first stay 8 years ago. The employees seem to love their jobs and there workplace which converts to a happy atmosphere for the guests. I have recommended this hotel to at least a dozen friends. All have praised XV Beacon after staying there. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. IT IS WORTH THE PRICE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: alk222
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Boston on a whim - XV Beacon an oasis in the City. As others have said - great location, wonderful room, comfortable bed and pillows. I especially loved the fireplace in the room and the jets in the tub. Very relaxing. Moo, the steak house restaurant on site, was great for breakfast, drinks and a dinner at the Bar. Staff was wonderful, friendly, helpful.....the best.

Reviews.Title: “Beacon hill beauty”
Reviews.Author: blushingbath
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this great boutique hotel. The location was perfect we walked to everything. The aquarium, eating, shopping, was aii with in walking distance. The only thing we needed a car for was Fenway and the hotel had a curtusy car at our disposal. We eat both night in moo and were more than satisfied with our meal. We had no complaints at all about this little gem. Our bed was very comfortable our room was beautiful and the service was very accommodating and friendly. Our driver that took us to Fenway Park was very helpful with shopping and eating tips. This hotel made our trip to Boston very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: peniferous
Reviews.Content: This little known boutique hotel was 5 star in every way from the impeccable service from all staff, the luxurious rooms kept in pristine condition, the spotless & friendly free limo service, the well maintained hot tub on the roof to the wonderful chocolate martinis and sumptuous food in the dining room. Idyllic location close to great shopping. Kudos to the owners for living up to their advertising. With this review I only hope they have room for us when we return to Boston. Thanks for the wonderful memories.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Dirk_London
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and I'd happily recommend this to anybody looking for an upmarket comfortable option of somewhere to stay in Boston. Very friendly and efficient staff, exceptionally comfortable and large rooms. It's slightly away from the main restaurant options but there are plenty of good places to eat nearby and it's close enough to walk almost anywhere you'd want to go in town. The fruit bowls on each floor outside the elevators are a lovely touch. I wish all hotels were more like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay from start to end”
Reviews.Author: SMBMAK
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at XV Beacon and loved it! We had two rooms, a "corner studio" and "traditional" room. Both were very well appointed although the studio has some nice extras including a surround sound for the TV and iPod. We hosted pre-dinner cocktails for seven in the room and were not at all cramped. The studio has a sofa and several chairs. The room lighting and fireplace made for quite an elegant setting. Bathrooms are very nice and remind me of boutique hotels in London. A very large, separate closet allows you to stash your stuff out of sight. Towels, linens and robes are all top-quality. The hotel has a small, but good quality, workout room on the top floor. A couple treadmills, elliptical and stationary bike. There is also what appears to be a sun deck - not much use in March, sadly. The hotel staff does what they need to make your stay enjoyable. The doormen are extremely helpful not only with luggage but also directions and suggestions. The concierge was great as were the front desk staff. It's one of those places where your problem becomes their problem and they do what they can to solve it. The hotel has complimentary car service within a couple mile radius - a new Lexus LS400. Not too shabby. It's in demand, however, so you have to plan ahead. They have a deal with Lexus; you can valet park any Lexus for free. Otherwise, it's $44 overnight. The attached restaurant, Mooo... was excellent. Like all upscale hotels, watch those breakfast prices, it adds up fast. We were very pleased with our stay at XV Beacon and hope to return soon. Great rooms, fabulous staff, quiet and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: anthonytonemorgan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at VX Beacon for our 20th Anniversary. The staff was extremely accommodating from the moment we arrived. From Valet to check-in to Concierge to Bellman...everything was superb. Just what you should expect from an upscale, boutique hotel. Located in the historic Beacon Hill area of Boston VX Beacon is located near everything you'd need. Museums, the New England Aquarium, shopping, fine dining establishments, the Theatre District, Historic Boston Common, Faneuil Hall, Boston's Financial District, the Seaport District, etc. The rooms are impeccably clean and spacious. We had a corner unit with six huge windows. The bedding is fresh and comfortable. The shower has plenty of pressure. Our room had a jacuzzi tub. There were a small color tv in the bathroom. His and her plush robes. The towels were quality grade heavy cotton and since I'm not a small guy I have to make this statement..."It covered me well...with room to spare!" I believe that is very import. I have to say that VX Beacon truly superseded all of my expectations. If you go to their website you will see a picture of the room that we stayed in. "As good as it looks in the picture is as good as it looks in person." As a travel agent I would recommend VX Beacon to all my clients looking for a nice boutique hotel. By the way, they had no idea that I was a travel agent, therefore they couldn't treat me any different from the way they would treat anyone else!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: my4sons
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and sweet, because the other posts have covered most of the bases. This was our second time staying at the small boutique hotel. Do not hesitate to book a room here. The rooms and bathrooms are beautiful, staff helpful but not intrusive. Great location. We relaxed and felt pampered all weekend. Room service was excellent and delivered promptly. Kudos to the XV Beacon team.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: heardinggroup
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at XV during February this year for 3 nights. The location is fantastic. They are right on the edge of Boston Common and right next to the state house. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. Upon arrival we found out that the drain in our jetted tub was not working right. I put in a call to the front desk and within 3 minutes, (no lie) they were there fixed the problem and were out within 6 minutes. We stayed in a studio. It had a King bed with a stereo system throughout the room and bathroom. There was a gas fireplace and great views of the city. I read one review that complained that they could see into the building across the street. It's a city people! come on! The sheets were very soft and there was turn down service every night. They also turned on the stereo at this time to some easy listening music which was nice to come back to. The concierge Jule was a great help for setting up appointments and suggestions for restaurants. She was also a big help in getting us the hotel car for a few trips around the city. All of the drivers we had were great; friendly and professional. Housekeeping did a great job during our entire stay, even organizing my shoes for me every day. I have very few negatives to say about this hotel. While they did have an iPod dock it would have been nice to have it tied into the stereo system. Also, the fireplace is tied into the heating system so it shuts off when the room gets too warm and we had issues trying to find a balance trying to keep the room cool enough to be able to enjoy. I figured out that we need to crack the window a little to get it right, but I think there should be a better way. All in all we loved our stay. A quick tip, head down to the Lush store on Newberry and pick up a bath bomb before hitting the jetted tub.

Reviews.Title: “As a native Bostonian I was blown away”
Reviews.Author: Hawk_11
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Roslindale. I lived two doors away from The Public Garden on Arlington Street. I went to Boston Latin School and thought I knew everything there was to know about my hometown. XV Beacon exceeded my every expectation. Whenever I visit BeanTown, it is my new home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Classy but Quaint.....just perfect, so romantic”
Reviews.Author: Brownsugar01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had such a memorable stay at your hotel. We cannot stop bragging about our stay at XV Beacon. The added touches were remarkable, such as sending slice of chocolate cake and a bottle of wine to our room in celebration of my husband's birthday. What a great surprise and so very thoughtful. He especially love the personalized card as well. Our room was cozy, romantic, roomy and Â luxurious all in one. We loved the soft pillows and comfy robes, and the fireplace added the warmth of home. Â The chauffeur service was also a nice touch, it added such class to your hotel, and to our stay. Â We have stayed at a few hotels in Boston, because we like to try different places. But I think we have found our home away from home. Our 9th year wedding anniversary is approaching (October 6), and we made plans to come back to XV Beacon to celebrate our special moment. Thank you and all your staff ( especially Johnathan at the concierge desk), for a weekend we will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “The Little details”
Reviews.Author: Bartlett1
Reviews.Content: I treated my wife to a belated Valentine night in the city. I had let it slip that this was my reason for staying when I booked the room (Corner Room). When my wife and I checked in we were greeted with friendly welcomes, but the greeting the room gave insured my wifeâ€™s happiness which all husbands know, insures ours. They had soft music playing, fire place on, Champagne with chocolate dipped strawberries, rose peddles scattered around the floor and in the shapes of hearts on the bed. Even the toilet paper had been folded into the shape of a rose which my wife even put on her facebook page:) The room was spacious and cozy. Bathroom with jetted tub. Overhead shower. Car to take you anywhere complimentary (please tip). XV Beacon staff work hard to earn your business and they certainly earned mine.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: David_Boston_MA
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! We stayed here for two nights to celebrate our anniversary. We booked a "traditional" room but we were upgraded to a corner studio with a nice view of Beacon Street. The room was very large with a comfortable sitting area, gas fireplace, stereo and CD player, and flat panel TV. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom had a separate sink area, walk in closet, and separate room for the toilet and tub/shower. Everything in the room was top quality. We emailed in advance to reserve the complimentary car service for a trip to the Museum of Fine Arts. It was a treat to be dropped off (in style) in front of the museum. There is a small but adequate fitness center on the top floor, and in warmer months the rooftop deck (I imagine) would be a fantastic place to enjoy a drink or a snack. All service staff, from the room attendants to the front desk staff and concierge, were extremely professional. This is a very special place. I highly recommend it for special occasions, or for business (if your company allows it!).

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be Better!”
Reviews.Author: GilasGhia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I regularly travel Christmas to New Years and decided on Boston this year. When we chose XV Beacon, we had no prior knowledge of the hotel other than looking at its website and review on Tripadvisor and booking.com. We arrived Christmas Eve, the night before the blizzard and you would think that anyone working Christmas Eve would want to do anything but be at work, let alone during a blizzard. This couldn't be further from the truth at XV Beacon. The staff was amazingly attentive, friendly and helpful without being overbearing. During the night of the blizzard, the only restaurant open was the hotel's (Mooo) which happens to be an amazing steak place in its own right. The hotel's room service is also served by Mooo, so we decided to have a great steak in our room, snow and wind blowing outside in front of the fireplace in our room...what could be better. From the bell staff, front desk, concierge and cleaning staff...you simply don't find service like this in most hotels, let alone more expensive ones. We highly recommend XV Beacon to anyone wanting a great place in the heart of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Engagement weekend ... PERFECT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sweetp187
Reviews.Content: I cannot possibly thank the people enough who helped make my engagement weekend absolutely perfect. The entire staff of XV Beacon, led by the incomparable Emily Alber, helped me pull off the engagement surprise with precision, elegance, and some surprises of their own. Unbelievable. It was so much better than I expected. The hotel itself is clean clean clean and the location is walking distance to the heart of the city. What else can I say? Why am I limited to only giving it a 5 out of 5??

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in the Heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: traceyg
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay at XV Beacon and I don't have enough space to say just how wonderful it was. I was planning a team meeting and booked 8 rooms. After looking at 7 other Boston Hotels I choose XV for our stay. The location was great (walking distance to Fanueil Hall and by the Frog Pond). The rooms were amazing. I loved the fireplaces in each room and the decor was very warm and inviting. I also loved all the small touches; chapstick as one of their toiletries, fresh fruit in the halls, choice of newspaper,complimentary car service, ect...I also booked one of the suites which was truly amazing. I still can't get over the size of the suite! Lastly I have to mention how amazing the staff are. Everyone was so kind and accommodating. They went the extra step to ensure our meeting needs were accommodated and as guests we were comfortable and enjoying our stay. Everyone from the Bellman, Front Desk, Concierge and Car Driver were the best. I'd highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to come back with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, and as good as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: MusicLovingCouple
Reviews.Content: First trip to Boston and picked this place based purely on Trip Advisor reviews and the hotel's own website. Very glad we did. Arrived in pouring rain but the doorman had spotted our taxi and was there with the umbrella to get us to the door. And the excellent service continued from that point onwards. Not that we needed much - we're pretty independent, and besides, you don't really want for anything there. We had a standard room only, which was perfectly adequate - deluxe actually! Very well appointed, plenty of space, lovely bathroom with massive towels, great smelling toiletries, and quiet. Really quiet. In fact, that was almost the nicest thing about the place. We never heard another resident. Maybe old thick walls and ceilings? No street noise either (our room faced an office block on the 6 th floor, so maybe that was never going to be an issue). No sweeping views, but then again that's what you step outside for. Great location, easy to walk everywhere, close to the airport (just a $20 dollar ride away). There is so little traffic in Boston, and so few sirens etc., that the ovrwhelming feeling is one of calm. The restaurant downstairs ('Mooo') is excellent, though not cheap. In fact, Boston struck us as expensive all round. It's pretty upmarket. But provided you go there expecting that you won't be disappointed. Standards are generally high, and XV Beacon does not disappoint. The other big impression is of the designer's influence. Everything has been so well thought out, and the branding is subtle and classy. Dark, muted colours, limited but effective pallette, quality materials and furnishings, lots of little touches, all beautifully realised, and delightful discoveries at every turn. Would definitely recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “XV Beacon a fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: SRZurich
Reviews.Content: We booked XV Beacon based on the TripAdvisor reviews ignoring some recommendation about other famous chain-hotels. If you also need a reason why to book this hotel instead other big names in town here they are: First is for sure the STAFF: is the plus of the hotel indeed! friendly, helpful, cheerful and of course professional. Mitchell and Emily at the front desk, they upgrade us to a beautiful room, made all the check-in/out procedure as fast and smooth as possible better you cannot ask for. Julie and Michael at the Concierge, organised our free time at best, was always prepared in suggesting the best place in town. We were never disappointed with what they were arranged for us. The bellmen at always a smile and friendly words to welcome us back after a day out. Just to mention some of them but everybody does a great job since also in our room we never had an amenities missing and everything was clean and tidy we never had our room undone or a turn-down forgotten. Second is for sure LOCATION:from the hotel you can walk everywhere in town. There are trolley tours leaving almost in front of the hotel door, the parks just two minutes away, charming Beacon Hill just behind, restaurants, bars, shopping street and commercial center a few streets away. Furthermore the hotel provide an extra service: a great Lexus Limousine to drive you around within the center for your dinner reservation or business appointment (and the drivers are wonderful too!) The AMBIENCE is also very special, is not an hotel of uncountable rooms. There are 10 floor all very nice decorated, the lobby as has been written is not big but cosy and honestly who needs to be in the lobby when you have a beautiful sitting area with own fireplace and lounge music waiting upstairs.. The room are elegantly decorated using only best items; new towels by Frette, crispy bed linen, king size bed with best comfort mattress (we never slept so good despite the time difference!) cashmere blankets by Marzotto. Big marble bathroom with whirlpool bathtub, quality toiletries refurbished daily. We were during Xmas time for a weekend break, Boston during holiday season is sparkling and romantic but staying to this hotel add such a special "magic" to our trip we will never forget!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: wogjr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here this past weekend on a recommendation from a friend and were a little worried about the cost of the hotel. When we got there, we realized that you can't always put a cost on quality service! From the moment we got there, until the moment we left, we felt like VIP guests. The concierge went out of his way to find the exact type of restaurant we were looking for and then arranged a reservation for us. The car service was a great feature and the driver was very personable and helpful. All of the staff at the hotel made it a point to make sure we had a great night. They seemed genuinely happy to accommodate us in any way they could. If anyone is looking for a night or two on the town in Boston and wants to be treated like a VIP, this is the hotel. The price is a little steep, but in the end I forgot about the cost and enjoyed my stay. I will definitely be heading back here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Killer!!!”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditionDaddy
Reviews.Content: This is clearly one of the nicest places in Boston. It seems I've stayed at nearly every major Back Bay or downtown hotel and this is is awesome. It is pretty over the top for a business trip but for a romantic weekend or something like that, you won't find anything better. It is practically in the dead center of the city so everything you're likely to want to see is equidistant to you. It's very cozy and each room has a working fireplace. The beds are AMAZING and when you pull the blackout shades, you're in a cocoon. The food is terrific as is the service. It goes without saying that it is spotless and the staff is on top of your every need. The only drawback I can find, if there is one, is that given its location and the low-rise nature of the building, I don't think any of the rooms have much of a view. The bar downstairs is rocking too, although you don't hear a thing upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Link3
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to XV Beacon for her Birthday and it ended up being the perfect gift. The staff was welcoming and extremely helpful, even greeting my wife with a "Happy Birthday" when we checked in. The room was beautiful with every amenity we could have asked for and the Manager, Amy, even left us a little welcome gift upon our arrival. We enjoyed dinner at Moo and and a quiet evening by the fire back in our room. We are hoping to get away again very soon and would happily rush back to XV Beacon.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, retro fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MrBenjamin
Reviews.Content: A smart modern hotel, newly refurbished and in great location. This was my first trip to Boston and a stay at Beacon XV did not disappoint. Only 15 minutes from the airport, the hotel was perfectly located in the centre of Boston but on a quiet side street so no traffic noise. Plenty of nearby restaurants, bars and pubs meant you didnt need to go far for food or refreshment. We stayed in one of the 'standard' rooms, which by any stretch of the imagine I would not consider to be standard. The room was huge, with a huge TV on the wall and an integrated sound system, a fantastic built in gas fire which was really romantic. Also we had free internet connection for our stay. The beds were incredibly comfortable, and apart from the inevitable jet lag, we had 4 very good nights of sleep. I would definately stay at beacon XV again (my next trip to boston is early next year). The hotel also offers a complimentary car service around central boston which is a great bonus. Overall Beacon XV gave us everything we needed for a short city break, and we definately return. We loved it. The Mooo restaurant is a must, I can recommend the brunch on a sunday, steak & eggs, wow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at XV Beacon”
Reviews.Author: dvg_loves_cali
Reviews.Content: I stayed at XV Beacon for a week in June for business. Location was excellent for business or pleasure. It was not a far walk from a lot of the sights of Boston. Charles Street was pretty close and the cemeteries and other sights (like Fanueil Hall) were not as far as you'd think. I liked this location a lot better than my previous visit which was to the Copley Square area. I was concerned that it would be far from the T, but it wasn't far at all. I took it almost every morning to the Silver Line to the Seaport World Convention Center without any issues. The hotel valet was pretty good about getting me a cab when I needed one. The hotel advertises use of a car, but every single time I asked I was told it was booked. I thought this was lame. Also, the restaurant in the hotel ("Moo") was overpriced and underwhelming. Not recommended. Other complaints: the hot tub on the roof is not kept hot (more like lukewarm) and so needs advance notice to be heated and there was a billing error on checkout (something double-billed) which was eventually rectified. One other niggle was that someone kept changing the radio station on the sound system in my room! Sounds minor, but we were annoyed by this! Otherwise, though, my stay was great! My room was a corner room which was decorated in a sleek modern manner. It had a jacuzzi bath tub and a heated towel bar (which I actually took advantage of to dry my socks which I washed in the sink). It had a great bed and a nice surround system. It had a lot of windows, but the view was non-descript - mostly views into neighboring office buildings. I thought that it was a pretty good value for a hotel with a luxury boutique feel. I felt fortunate to book here versus the Hyatt, Marriott, etc. or even the Ritz-Carlton which was holding a special at the time which would have made it cheaper. I base my rating mostly on the location and the decor/amenities in the room, which were top quality. I will stay here again when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, incredible staff & service!!”
Reviews.Author: blerbee
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing!! The wonderful staff made my engagement weekend absolutely perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Anna-Roz
Reviews.Content: And exceeded all our expectations! This is an exceptional hotel in a great location; beautifully and tastefully appointed with no expense spared on anything (gorgeous furnishings, amazing bed, Frette linens, stereo system, uber stocked mini bar); fantastic service, including a private car ready to drive one to/from shopping, to/from restaurants, and concierge service; adjoining restaurant and bar. They made us feel like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Another renovated hotel with very air conditioning.”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely well located hotel with really nice staff and a free Lexus to run you around.However, we were put in a courtyard facing room which picked up a jet engine style air conditioning exhaust system outside. For the first time in 35 years of travelling I asked to move at 1.30 in the morning. I have had a run of decent hotels, either brand new or those operating in renovated altered buildings in recent months where the air conditioning has been loud and not "tuned" properly.At the end of the day a hotel has to provide a good bed and a quite environment or else it fails.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisit urban elegance”
Reviews.Author: liluxor
Reviews.Content: On all levels this hotel was absolutely worth it! Great location, beautiful building, excellent service, spacious, tastefull and very comfortable room! The room was particularly enjoyable: well furnished and lit, high-quality finishes, gas-fireplace, superb sound-system, great bathroom, fresh flowers, good cosmetic products, excellent mini-bar... Definitely the high-end but by no means snobbish place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a great location within walking distance of Boston Common, the State House and the Freedom Trail”
Reviews.Author: chuckychigger
Reviews.Content: We spent four delightful nights in this historic beautifully refurbished hotel. Our large room had a gas fireplace, a built in music center and a fully stocked mini-bar. Cheerful doormen were always on duty as well as a very helpful concierge. Transportation was provided by hotel cars to anywhere we wanted to go in Boston. We really enjoyed being in walking distance of the North End and Long Wharf. The hotel is in a great, central location convenient to many of Boston's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at any other hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Rosebudand007
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at XV Beacon. My wife and I stayed on the 9th floor for two nights visiting Boston and in all the city hotels we have stayed in over the world this was possibly the best. The staff are also of the highest standard, very helpful and efficient at all times. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again when we next visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: chasecadet
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend here for the weekend since it was his birthday. We also brought our dog. We just loved this hotel. Everybody was especially accomodating & friendly. Our dog got the royal treatment since they gave her warm peanut butter dog treats on a plate w/"Welcome" written in peanut butter. Very cute. We stayed in the Studio sized room which was large enough and had amazing views of Beacon Street. The bathroom was also generous and liked having the tv in there so you could watch something while showering. The rain shower was very strong. We loved the use of the free Lexus to take us out to restaurants and clubs at night. We have to give our special thanks to Mark who took car of us by getting us on the guestlist of a club we wanted to attend one night. We liked his recommendations for nightlife. The location of the hotel is perfect esp. if you have a dog since Boston Common is across the street. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: kingsleypark
Reviews.Content: I cannot say a single negaitive about our trip to Boston - the service from the staff was so good i swear they were telepathic - they sort of knew what i wanted before i even asked. We got two complimentary tickets to the museum of fine arts which was a lovely touch. And the restaurant Moo Moo was great value for lunch and tasty too

Reviews.Title: “Modern sophistication”
Reviews.Author: wsofrin
Reviews.Content: XV Beacon is an amazing hotel. Last Christmas I we stayed at the Four Seasons, and XV Beacon was much better on many levels. The staff was very personal, and the attention to our needs was met with the highest regards. We had to bring our dog with us, and the hotel baked him special treats, and helped to make sure he was equally as comfortable as we were. The location was perfect as we were able to walk everywhere we wanted, and when we needed a car, the hotel was happy to drive us. Moo, the restaurant downstairs, is amazing! In fact Moo has been the best American Hotel dining experience for myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great repeat experience!”
Reviews.Author: candjoshea
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights over the Labor Day weekend, the same number of nights as we stayed in October 2007. An elegant, small hotel! The front desk and room service staffs, the concierges, restaurant and in-room breakfasts, and the chauffeured car service were all excellent. Our room (#407) was very elegant and quiet, was on the west side of the building, and had windows on 2 walls. Our only problem was that the sink taps were very tight.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeRob9
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant weekend stay at the XV beacon. I was very happy that I did not stay in a huge impersonal hotel. The staff was friendly and accommodating. I loved the quiet neighborhood. We at at MOOO, the food was excellent, the price at little on the high side, but not a bad value considering the quality

Reviews.Title: “the ideal place”
Reviews.Author: jzerner
Reviews.Content: this was a lovely boutique hotel that was suggested to us by a friend. located right next to the state capitol and boston common, in an ideal walking around location. the employees were all very energetic and willing to help us out with anything that we needed. plus, as a dog lover, i love the fact that they allow well trained dogs in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tarky1968
Reviews.Content: The Beacon XV is a great boutique hotel that gives you the look of feel of traditional New England with all the modern touches. The staff go out of their way to assist you with any needs, its clean, cosy and quiet. Of course Moo's the restaurant is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: pursuit
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend has stayed here several times for business trips but this was our first leisure visit--service remains impeccable. Still received his personalized business cards and professional attentive service. Rooftop is a nice touch on a warn day to share a bottle of wine. Hotel car service was a great perk as well and we used it every night to go to our dinners around town. I am a huge product snob--the Lemon Sugar line from Fresh that they provide in the rooms has made me a regular user. And the location is perfect--within walking distance to everywhere. When it's colder out, we will return and use the fireplace in our beautiful room.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect 2 Day City Getaway”
Reviews.Author: skw64
Reviews.Content: Friends and I wanted to meet in Boston for a couple of days to catch up, see some sights and spend the night in a luxurious hotel. We decided to stay at XV Beacon Hotel where we had the best time! The staff are so professional and attentive, we felt like "celebreties" from the valet, doormen and concierge to the wait staff, room service and attendants we were greeted and treated with the utmost respect, no favor was to small, no detail overlooked. Our room was just beautiful! It warm and cozy, equipped with all the latest technological wizidry. The decor is neat and very inviting with the most amazing cushy beds & pillows. & who doesnt love to relax with a drink in their room ~ the mini bar did not dissappoint! The "Moo" restraunt was very impressive too with a superb menu and delicious wine list. We were very pleased with the generous portions!! I will say that one of the things I most loved was the fresh apples & oranges decorating the hallways but my favorite parts were all the personal touches, General Manager Amy Finsilver and her staff go the extra mile to make sure their guests experience is the best it can be! My least favorite thing was???? that we couldnt stay longer! Great Great Hotel ~ Awesome Staff all in a perfect location for anyone looking to getaway for a couple of days in Boston! Enjoy the City and stay in one of the finest luxury hotels in Boston's prestigious Beacon Hill region. XV Beacon Hotel ~ we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a night to remember.”
Reviews.Author: patgaston
Reviews.Content: I was very fortunate to be a guest at the lovely place on Beacon Hill. The staff was absolutely wonderful. This boutique hotel has all the right touches: excellent location; beautiful design; elegant and comfortable rooms (your towels can be warmed for you); apples for your pleasure on each floor; a spectacular roof top area and view; a fitness center and a cozy lobby seating area. We had fine dining experience in their restaurant and the food and service was excellent. It was indeed a night to remember and next time, I will make sure I have the opportunity to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: zugs
Reviews.Content: Small room (Room 205) with extra small bath. In the bathroom, the cold and hot labels should have been relabeled 'pretty hot' and 'very hot'. Cold was N/A.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveMidlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston for two nights and my wife in particular prefers small boutique hotels. This hotel was really outstanding and excellent. Wonderful room, chic, stylish with all the technology you could wish for. Truly excellent customer service. Plus it has a great restaurant and bar which meant rather than have to search out somewhere to eat you could experience Boston night life in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful - with an amzing team of people to make your stay memorable.”
Reviews.Author: Andrea-Peter
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 8 nightsat XV Beacon and it was amazing! We pre-booked a lovely corner room with extra space and great views and rose champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries on arrival. All of the amenities at the hotel were everything we expected of a 5* hotel but what really made our trip so lovely was the hotel staff. They were simly fantastic to us. From Mitch on the Front Desk, to Michael and Julie as Concierge and the wonderful drivers, including the effervescent Mark, who take you to dinner in the courtesy sedan, nothing was too much trouble. They arranged Duck tours, trips to Provincetown, found the best ice-cream parlours and made my birthday truly memorable. We became very fond of them all!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: 1981Mirjam2010
Reviews.Content: We travelled businesswise to Boston and stayed in XV Beacon for 4 days. There aren't enough words to describe this amazing hotel. The staff is ever so friendly and helpfull. Lindsay, Joshua, Mark, I still think about them sometimes with a smile. Nothing is too much for them. And their attention and interest feels 100% genuine. The food in Moooooo is also lovely, as well as the surroundings. I loved my room: spacious and luxorious. The best thing was that when you returned at night the fireplace would be on, a little card with weather forecast was laid on the bed, Ice was refilled in the minibar. I will definately go back one day, also because of the wonderfull city of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of Class”
Reviews.Author: GlenHT
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity recently to visit XV Beacon in Boston along with 3 teenagers (2 of them exchange students from Europe); Our experience was nothing short of fantastic. The staff at XV Beacon went out of their way to create an atmosphere that was both friendly and family-oriented. The Doorman and Car Service man (apologies for forgetting their names) were professional and entertaining at the same time - traits not so easy to perfect together. It is clear that this hotel is professionally run and I highly recommend it for business or pleasure. Glen Teague Niantic, CT

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful....Staff is Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: DarTanzania
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at XV Beacon three different times this summer in June, July and August. Each time our stay was just perfect! The hotel is beautiful and located wonderfully close to the park and gardens. I booked everything from overseas by email and the communications were all efficient and welcoming. On our first visit we arrived after 20 hours of travel and were extremely jet-lagged. Check in was easy, staff were helpful and nice despite the large volume of luggage we had. The corner suite was lovely with a nice view, pull out couch for our son, and also a great flat screen tv where he could watch the celtics! The bed was wonderfully comfortable. Breakfast the next day was terrific as was the great dinner we had pre-booked at Moo (superb steaks and truffle fries!). The free car was such a help as my son and I purchased a lot of new computer equipment from the Apple store - all of the drivers we had were polite and friendly. The doorman was a genius at packing the truck of the taxi as we departed making sure all of our luggage fit so we did not have to take two taxis (a real feat if you saw all of the luggage we had)! On the second visit it was just myself and my husband. The staff remembered us and made us feel like we had returned home. We were upgraded to the corner suite and had a wonderful last night in the US where I enjoyed watching a movie on the bathroom tv while soaking in the bath. Our romantic room service dinner was also a treat. The car service again did not disappoint; the staff were even flexible and allowed my husband to use it to travel to his hospital appointment despite the fact it was technically outside of the radius for use of the car. I had also worked with the management to set up breakfast on the roof patio to entertain my cousins and their twin babies. When it ended up raining, the hotel didn't even blink and eye and found a quiet place for us at Moo where my cousins did not need to worry if the babies were fussy. The waiter even comped our coffees. This said the real reason I am writing this review is because of the way the staff at XV handled my family's third and final visit. We had planned for my teenaged son to fly back to Boston from a 30 day hiking trip in Alaska, meet my mom who was coming in from Atlanta , stay overnight with family before returning home to Africa where we live. Unfortunately his flight was cancelled and subsequent flights were delayed. It took him from 9pm on Tuesday to 11:30pm on Weds to get to Boston. Meanwhile my mom had been up since 3am trying to help him make the flight changes. Knowing they needed a "soft place to land" I called up XV and was able to quickly make all of their arrangements (rooms and the next day's airport transport) despite the early hour in Boston (about 6am). Because the hotel had all of our information on file from our previous visits they were able to bill my credit card so that my mom did not incur any additional costs. The staff were great on the phone (calm and reassuring) when we kept calling and finding that my son had not arrived as expected (yet another delayed plane). When they finally did arrive the hotel greeted them like superstars. At check in the man at the desk talked a bit with my son in swahili (what they speak where we live) They also upgraded them to the corner suite (again!), which my son loved, and had the beds ready as soon as they arrived. My son said the room service burger was the best food he'd had in a long time! The next morning my son only had four hours do do any shopping before catching his flight out of the US and the hotel made sure the car service was available for him so he could fit everything in before leaving. As a parent halfway around the world it was amazing to be able to count on the hotel to greet my son (and mom) and make his horrible day just a little better. I cannot recommend this hotel enough - thanks to the Katie Barr and the rest of the wonderful staff. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “76.94 for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodHillsCyn
Reviews.Content: It's been awhile since I've felt compelled to review a hotel. But in this case, I'm so in some ways freaked out by this place, I feel it's necessary. Here's the thing - the people who work here could not be nicer. They put a major emphasis on service and I'm really impressed. They're considerate and efficient, they don't forget anything, and that says something. Another major perk is they have a car service that will drive you to local spots (though you need to pre-arrange this). But the drawbacks, I've found, are pretty severe. I might just go in order of what struck me wrong. When I arrived, I checked in and had to ask for someone to bring up my bag. Then I got to the room. It's in a business area of Boston and out my window are people very close to me in the adjacent building, working. Way too close for comfort. Outside the other window is a building wall. They have plants outside the window which would be nice but because of the watering, the windows are filthy. I mean dirty to the degree that my Mom, who's almost 80, noticed how filthy it looked. In requesting another room, the front desk definitely made a concerted effort to accommodate me, but to be in another room, it would cost more, I'd not have two beds, but one and a pull out from a sofa, and I'd not have that room for a full stay. I decided to stick with what we have and find another hotel for the remainder of my trip. Very kindly, the front desk man, Terrance, sent a bottle of Champagne because they were sorry they couldn't work it out with me. I thought that was very nice. I'd love to leave the story at that and yet I wouldn't have been moved to write anything if not for a few other real weird and one very costly problem. The room is DARK. I mean dark like it's cavernous. My mother wondered if it was an afterthought - as though perhaps it was extra space and they should've made it a large utility closet and instead they decided to make it into a room. When you draw the curtains so you don't look at the work people, it just becomes ga-loom-y. Perhaps in the winter that would be nice but I'm not so sure. And there is very little lighting. I'm traveling with my mom and so reading is frustrating for her but even for me, and I love "atmosphere," it's dim in here and hard to read. The colors are nice (all shades of browns and whites) but somehow, in a hotel room, especially this one that suffers from poor lighting, it ultimately feels depressing. There's also not a whole lot of space to unpack. We had originally planned to be here four nights. But there are a few drawers and a small closet. For two people that's not so hot. I kept stuff in the suitcase. And then there was breakfast. I actually started to laugh when I saw the bill. Here's the thing, we got a full breakfast. I'm not going to say we only got a few things. We got 1/2 a fruit plate, two juices, coffee, oatmeal, yogurt with berries, toast and bacon. They add in a 20% gratuity on top of tax of course, and somehow that is 76 dollars. I've spent that much on a budget hotel room in California, a dinner out, a haircut -- but breakfast? That blew me away. Two or three times a year my mother and I meet up in Boston to stay in a nice hotel, play Scrabble, go out for a few meals, and connect -- I live across the country and this is what we do to spend some real time together. We're kind of a kooky little travel duo. We've stayed in some very nice places with impunity (The Charles Street Inn and Hotel Commonwealth -- where we're about to head next). I've had problems with hotels, restaurants, etc. but I'm not a complainer. I'd never want to warn anyone about anything unless I really felt as though I'd be helping someone not get screwed. If you're reading this, I just don't want you to get screwed. I'm sorry to say we cannot recommend this hotel. As nice as the staff is, we're not rock stars, the economy sucks and this is insane.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable in every way - our new favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stlouisfolks
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was above and beyond wonderful. The hotel is dignified without being stuffy, elegant without being pompous. There is a personal touch added to every service, from the concierge to the chauffers who cheerfully drove us to our destinations in style. Our room was spacious with those lovely calm deep brown, soft tan, and cream colors; we did not even feel like we were in a hotel. We loved the location, and were able to make the most of our short time because it was so centrally located. We will certainly be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: dconnolly6
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at XV Beacon with my sisters and mother and had a great time. The employees were extremely friendly and accommodating. They have a beautiful view of the city and state house from the roof top deck. The rooms were gorgeous and very comfortable. The hotel was within close proximity to Boston Common and when we needed to get somewhere outside of walking distance the car was ready and waiting for us. Everyone there wanted to make sure we were as comfortable as possible. I had to leave at 7:30 am and my car was already outside waiting for me. It was a fantastic visit.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel with friendly, world class service!”
Reviews.Author: geeg5646
Reviews.Content: We stayed at XV Beacon for a girls day/night in Boston. From the moment we arrived until I left by being driven to the airport in their complimentary Lexus car service (such a great touch!) the service and friendliness of every hotel employee was top notch. Concierge gladly arranged the purchase of our Duck Tour tickets, the welcome treats were delicious, the bell hops were helpful, the check-in/check-out process was smooth - I can't say enough. The rooftop deck offered great views of Boston. The hotel and rooms were beautiful and clean. Everyone who showered before me kept saying how amazing the shower was, I kept thinking, "it's a shower, how great can it be?" Well, let me say, it was AMAZING, perhaps the best shower I've ever had. The gas fireplace in the room was perfect to warm us up after we came in from the rain. I could go on forever! We had dessert and drinks in the attached Mooo restaurant. The dessert was incredible! We had the cheesecake and parfait. Even after being full from dinner offsite, we forced down all of the dessert because it was just too good to waste. The service and friendliness of XV Beacon definitely continued into Mooo. I travel quite a bit for work and spend a lot of time in hotels. It is pretty rare for me to be impressed by a hotel. XV Beacon is a very impressive hotel that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We had one of the nicest stays ever”
Reviews.Author: BML328
Reviews.Content: The General Manager, Amy, and her entire staff were incredible! They even had a bottle of champagne waiting in their rooftop garden for us. Room service was fantastic and they were unbelievably fast.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, the best boutique hotel in town.”
Reviews.Author: Belles504
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at XV Beacon and the service, ammenities and attention to detail were all outstanding. They are pet friendly and even had a special plate of treats waiting for our dog. There is no other hotel I would rather stay at. It is located in the heart of Beacon Hill and just blocks to Back Bay and Fanueil Hall. I cannot rave enough about how fantastic our stay was. The staff is first rate!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel whose priority is the satisfaction of the guest.”
Reviews.Author: wilgo1
Reviews.Content: XV Beacon is a quality hotel that caters to the care and comfort of the guest. From the moment of arrival the staff anticipates every need and are pleasant, courteous and efficient. The room was tastfully decorated, functional and had a great stereo. All the amenities are provided. The complimentary shoe shine was a bonus. I enjoyed having coffee and reading the newspaper on the roof garden. All in all of the pleasant visit to XV Beacon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: teedee60528
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at this lovely hotel over the past weekend. We felt welcome from the moment we pulled up. Each and every staff person we encountered was friendly and helpful. We had two rooms. The beds were very comfortable, with good mattresses and nice linens. Everything was clean and the bathrooms were immaculate. Several of us commented that we could stay in the showers all day. Each room has a gas fireplace and it came in handy after we were caught in a drenching rain. We had drinks and dessert in the hotel's restaurant, Moooo. The cheesecake and butterscotch parfait were out of this world. I would definitely return to try out the restaurant for dinner. XV Beacon is a hotel that I would not hesitate to recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bevvy312
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the hotel for two nights as a stop off on our way to Maine.. We booked a corner room, which was situated on the 2nd floor and found being close to the street very noisy in the early morning hours. On check in which was early morning they kindly gave us a day room and later in the morning we decided to go out and about to do a little sightseeing. We returned around four o'clock and went up to the room which unfortunately had not been cleaned but our luggage was in the room, so we left for another hour and on return found the room clean and tidy but unfortunately we found left over dinner from the previous guest in the mini bar fridge. The following day we ordered breakfast in the restaurant downstairs and went out for most of the day and returned late afternoon and again our room was still not made up so we ventured out again and returned an hour later to find it cleaned. Besides the housekeeping department being unorganized the hotel was very pleasant and the concierge was extremely helpful sending us in a courtesy car to a fabulous tappas restaurant they had recommended and even organized a rental car which was delivered to the hotel on our departure for Maine.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED AT - and i have stayed at over 150 hotels”
Reviews.Author: alka67
Reviews.Content: this place scks - nothing works - phone connection bad an spotty wireless on blackberries dont work half the time wirelessinternet is bad staff very rude and unfrienldy would never recommend for business ever

Reviews.Title: “Comforts, Kindness, and helpfulness of home!”
Reviews.Author: MrsTigger_10
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of spending four glorious days at the Beacon VX. From the moment that I exited my car I was met with a Bellman that immediately took care of my bags and walked me to the front desk. The pampering and first class service continued with a speedy check in and a concierge staff (Thanks a bunch Jonathan and Juilie!) that was patient, thorough, and accomodating. If I had to choose the most unique amendity that the hotel offered, I would have to say that it was the Lexus car that provided drop off service within the city for FREE! (THanks Mark and Carlos!) (For a nominal fee, the car will drop you off at the airport.) The rain faucet shower, the gas fireplaces,the almost soundproof walls (I never heard sounds from my neighbors), and a KEY to open the door to my room provided a comfortable environment for me. My positive ravings could continue, but my best suggestion is to see for yourself!!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel I've Stayed at in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: Nicest hotel I've stayed at in Boston. Without exception, the staff was very gracious and accommodating, especially the concierge Sunday evening, June 27. Lemonade or ice tea is offered at check in. This will seem small, but a nice touch is receiving an envelope with the room key and what looks like a business card attached with your name embossed on it, the hotel phone numbers, and the phrase "In residence through (date)". A small plate of cookies, a full bucket of ice, muted lighting, and background music are waiting in the room. Lots of upscale amenities, starting with a complementary Lexus courtesy car and driver to take you around town. Complementary shoe shine is available over night. TV, phone, towel rack warmer, bath robe, and rainforest shower head in the bathrooms. Beautiful accommodations with lots of crown molding and two tone paint jobs in the rooms. Downsides are no iron in the room (but readily available from the front desk), and no in-room coffee maker (typical of up-scale hotels). There was a very large flat screen TV mounted on the wall, but the layout of my room limited viewing to the bed or desk chair. Gas fireplace in the room is nice... and available for use even in June! It would be wonderful in the winter. Easy access to T at Government Center Station - straight shot from the Airport Blue Line Station ($2.00). Room service for dinner was excellent. 14 ounce sirloin steak was cooked exactly right. The chef filled a special request for a baked potato, even though not on the menu... and gave me two of them. Evening turn down service includes filling the ice bucket and leaving a card on the bed with the weather forecast for tomorrow. I wouldn't hesitate to go back on a pleasure trip... the true test of how much I like a hotel. I would, however, ask about the availability of a larger room if my wife is with me. The one I stayed in this trip was OK for one person, but would be tight for two.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy and modern boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyfitch
Reviews.Content: I'm a very aesthetically orientated person, so I love this hotel. The room are quite spacious, with large modern and dark furnishings. There is a slightly opulent/oriental feel to some parts of the lobby and some small decorations, so in all it has a dark, modern and sexy feel to it. The hotel has been refurbished with high quality materials that wear well and still appear very nice. The beds are gorgeous and have excellent bedding, as well as robes available. Bathroom is light and bright, very modern with good amenities. The minibar has a great selection available. The staff did not mind me coming in loudly in the evening with a friend, they seem quite down to earth and do not have a stiff approach to their work. They are friendly and helpful, giving you space and privacy. Located away from the business district, but in the best and most fashionable part of town. Near lots of lovely little shops, cafes, bars etc.

Reviews.Title: “a must stay”
Reviews.Author: BobBBoston
Reviews.Content: Was fortunate enough to stay at this impeccable property. The rooms and service were 5 star and look foward to my next opportunity to spoil myself.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: lobean
Reviews.Content: My boyfreind and I stayed for one night during the weekend. We did have reservations at the Top of the Hub, we ended up canceling them, because the hotel was so nice. The resterant that is connected to the hotel is called "Mooo" . We got room service and orderd from Mooo. We both had the filet, witch was excellent! We had the studio suite, witch consisted of a fire place, serieo (with sround sound), TV/DVD player in the bathroom, a rain shower head, a tub with jets, and a IPOD dock. It was on the side of beacon street, so the view was nice. The staff was so plesent... i would go back with out a doubt, Its the pefect setting if your looking for romance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel hideaway in central Boston”
Reviews.Author: ivanciment
Reviews.Content: I am in line with other reviews of this property. Attentive service; very nice rooms and decor; excellent location just off Boston Commons right by the state capital building. The rooms are like apartments; I had a corner studio. Other smaller rooms were perfectly adequate. What you aren't getting here are rooms with great views (and the view from the rooftop isn't much to see either) but the window and indoor lighting is decent, gym is a bit sparse (cardio machines plus some small free weights), and the elevators are slow so you often have to wait for them awhile. Dining room for dinner was rather good if you go for steakhouse fare (i wasn't thrilled with the menu but it was fine); breakfast service was a bit off as the servers didn't speak English well and had difficulty understanding what I wanted when I went off the center line. Rooms offered good value for money; the Amex platinum program is especially good value but you should know that "dinner for two" as an amenity really means an $85 food and beverage credit which will serve dinner for one in their restaurant. I would return and recommend highly this hotel as good value especially considering the negative reviews that others are getting in somewhat similar price point territory such as the Langham and the Taj.

Reviews.Title: “An gem in prime locale by the state house, boston common, and fanieul hall; what more can you ask for”
Reviews.Author: boston2NYC1
Reviews.Content: The service was impressive as soon as I walked in to the beautifully renovated hotel on the top of Beacon Hill. Mitch greeted me at the front desk and soon after Jonathan, the hotel's concierge was already asking me if I needed a dinner reservation for the evening. Instead of having to visit the cash machine, I was immediately cash advanced to pay the valet. The ride to the room was short on the classic rod iron that was pleasantly rejuvenated with a glass enclosure; whomever designed this hotel had a ton of class. I stayed in a studio which I recommend that had high ceilings, three feet tall mouldings, a fireplace that you could turn on from the comfort of your own bed, and a mini bar that might rival that of the restaurant bar, Mooo.., downstairs. From the second I arrived, I had needed several things and there was not a request they could not have granted. My good friend came over with a newly bottled bottle of his Diabolique Tequila, a Boston great. We ordered cocktail shakers, mint, pineapple, crushed ice, and muddlers; no problem Mr. Bloomer. Cell phone charger? No problem...Bandaid and neosporin? No Problem...When leaving I was dashed to the airport in no time in the complimentary car service by Lexus having wished goodbyes by the whole staff. If you happen to come to Boston and would like a luxurious boutique hotel, make your next stay at XV Beacon. Don't forget to stop by the Rooftop deck and the fitness room. I didn't have the time to make it.

Reviews.Title: “you will feel like a celebrity!”
Reviews.Author: stefwlthanf
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I were going to the jay z concert at the garden, so we decided to splurge on a nice hotel to spend the night. It was raining as we pulled up our car to the curb and immediately were warmly greeted by the doorman who didnt hesitate to cover us with umbrellas as he escorted us inside. We were then greeted by a very friendly concierge and asked if we were in need of a complimentary towncar any time during our stay. We said yes and asked where we were heading. We told them a concert and a car would be waiting for us when we were ready. We headed up to the room, and our bags soon followed. Upon entering, you feel as though you are in a posh manhattan apartment and NOT a hotel room! the decor is fabulous and immediately we felt pampered. waiting for us was a plate of cheese, crackers, and chocolate covered strawberries (which was very fresh), along with a fully stocked fridge and snack draw with everything imaginable that you could want. As we were getting ready for the night, my cousin realized she forgot her heels in the car and went down to the lobby to retrieve her car to get them. the conceirge told us that there was no need and he would send someone to get the heels for her out of the car. Ten minutes later he showed up at our door with the shoes. we headed downstairs to take the towncar to the concert. the driver opened the door for us and said that he had jay z playing in the car for us! EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: “XV Beacon, A Perfect Experience!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccaabrams_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled from Brookline to Boston (about 5 minutes by car) to spend our wedding anniversary at XV Beacon and dine at Moo. To say that is was perfect is an understatement! We were very impressed at the service and attention that the staff provided. I am interior designer and I was drooling over the decor, sexy, masculine and understated. The restaurant was amazing, I am still craving those truffle fries! Really it couldn't have been better!
