I cannot wait to go again, hopefully for a longer stay;)

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel by which all others should be measured!”
Reviews.Author: jkeil
Reviews.Content: XV Beacon is truley first class! My wife and I recently visited XV Beacon for the 2nd time (the first time was about 6 years ago) and it set in stone for us that it is the standard for luxury visits! 100% of our stay was phenominal & the staff was amazing! It is within walking distance of the harbor as well as the main shopping district. I have been telling everyone that I know that for a romantic weekend, that they MUST try XV Beacon, particularly if they are considering larger chain hotels!

Reviews.Title: “better than fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: dylan053
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to XV Beacon for a romantic weekend. This was my first time at a boutique hotel and I absolutely loved it! The decor was much more intimate and detailed than the Ritz or Four Seasons, yet every bit as luxurious. The hotel rooms were very quiet, the roof deck offered a great view of the city, and the bar had a lot of life. This hotel felt as comfortable as home, yet the attentive staff anticipated and assisted with every detail of our stay, making the weekend relaxing, romantic and perfect! We have decided that XV Beacon will be our top choice for a Boston hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: HeartofStrength
Reviews.Content: We stayed at XV for a Valentine getaway. Partially to celebrate Valentines day and partially to just escape everyday life. From the reservation process to the concierge helping me plan a perfectly romantic suprise weekend and being there to answer all my questions and concerns, to arriving at the valet and trading keys for amazement, to the pleasant/helpful staff and the unbelievable room. Everything was perfect. Champagne and chocolate in the room upon arrival, ice skating in the park, Mooo was great for dinner, breakfast in the room(they brought a table in and it was like having a restaurant in the room). Simply amazing. And our stay can only be summed up as wow. Above and beyond. Great place, great people, and great times.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time after time...”
Reviews.Author: joanas
Reviews.Content: My second visit to this gem....The rooms with the gas fireplaces, cozy bedding, chaise lounge, large flat screen television, cd/dvd player, lots of storage for your clothing, great bar and excellent cocktails downstairs with yummy food....Well, yes, I suppose that's all pretty wonderful....So wonderful that it is hard to leave your room! What I am here to say, though, is that the level of service is beyond comprehension...and I mean from EVERYONE in the hotel...When I need to be treated like absolute royalty, this is my chosen palace....Small, intimate, caring, where nothing is too "much" for the staff to arrange, and a place where "everybody knows your name"...(sorry couldn't resist) I love my trips to Boston, and the staff at this hotel make it all that more amazing...Hats off to the Fifteen Beacon!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: tracy711
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 15 Beacon for a special occasion, and a nice night in Boston. The accomodations, staff, amenities, and overall service in this hotel is unmatched. Our stay could not have been more perfect, they can accomodate any request and the response is top notch. If you want the Best hotel in Boston this is your choice

Reviews.Title: “Tip top in every way - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Londonwanderlust100
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an amazing weekend in Boston with my husband, staying at the XV Beacon. It was our first trip abroad without our son and as it was my husband's birthday, it was super special. Having read Mr&Mrs Smith and cross referenced on trip advisor, we were quite confident that we had chosen the right hotel and upon arrival, our choice was immediately confirmed as the right one. We were upgraded for a reasonable $50 per night to the most amazing room (1006) which was a corner suite overlooking the park and it just got better from there on in. Jonathan and Julie at the Concierge desk had our trip action packed and slickly organised to a T. We went to a Boston Celtics basketball game (great fun!), ate in brilliant restaurants which perfectly matches our brief of being lively, fun and foodie, but not stuffy. Scampo at the Liberty Hotel (actually the worst of the 3 due to the door staff), B&G Oysters, The Butchers Shop, Flour Cafe and The Eastern Standard - a top mix for lunch, brunch and dinner. The use of the limo is great as you arrive in style and that's all part of the cost, so you save a bundle on cabs too. All in all an amazing city (take your walking boots) and perfectly do-able in 3-4 days. The only slight disappointment was the shopping (we are so spoilt in London), but Charles St and Newbury St are worth a potter around anyway, but the Freedom Trail and the Italian Quarter were the definite highlights

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan075
Reviews.Content: XV Beacon is the perfect spot for a weekend get away in Boston. The location can't be beat - virtually everything you'd want to do in the city is about 10-15 mins away, and they are happy to offer their house car to whisk you their in style. The rooms are spacious, the layout is thoughtful and it's obvious they've paid attention to every detail. Room service was speedy and delicious. The staff makes you feel at home even if it's your first time there. I'd highly recommend XV Beacon.

Reviews.Title: “Really Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Leatherman
Reviews.Content: We took three rooms on the same floor. Each floor has, I think, seven rooms. The rooms can be dark, and the odd numbered rooms face another building. My wife and I took a large corner studio room and this served as home base for the family. There is no color in the rooms, all browns and grays with texture changes. A very European feel about the whole place. Not cheap, by any means. But someone has done a great job of hiring just the right people. Of course, I greased everyone pretty big, hey it was Christmas! Nevertheless the staff is first rate. Having the Lexus available was a standout feature. I would stay her again but I also love the Club floor at the Ritz, although this is a $100/day add-on. One major complaint about XV; no coffee maker in the room. I was told this was being considered. Walking the two blocks to Starbucks wasn't bad, and room service had good coffee (at $5/cup) but a coffee maker is standard everywhere but here. We had dinner at Moo the first night, the in-house restaurant. Very expensive and OK food, not great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Everything”
Reviews.Author: Jenn546
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 12/19/09 to celebrate a 35th wedding anniversary, it also happened to be the eve of a huge Nor'easter. The hotel is in prime location, right in the center of everything, but still seems to be a relatively quiet street. The hotel rooms all have there own fire places and jacuzzi tubs. Speakers are piped into the ceiling throughout the extra large rooms. We saw two other rooms that our extended family were staying in and they were just as nice. The entire staff was extremely nice and helpful and the next morning after the "blizzard" they brought our car to us from Valet within minutes. WE enjoyed brunch at the restaurant downstairs and it was outstanding. A little pricey but well worth it for the quality and freshness. I would highly recommend this hotel....I live in the city of Boston and I have stayed at the Westin Copley; The Sheraton in Fanieul Hall and although they were both nice this Hotel is off the hook! The bed was extremely comfortable also and everything was extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Roedel
Reviews.Content: We live near Boston and we choose this hotel for special occasions. It is comfortable and beautifully kept. A very special place that is staffed with people who do their best to make your stay wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chrisduffeur
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, fantastic large rooms, good steak restaurant downstairs, very friendly staff and courtesy car for drop off's in central Boston. Much better than bigger alternatives in the City and fantastic value for money, hard to say anything bad about this little gem!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute highlight!!”
Reviews.Author: megv21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the XV Boston during Thanksgiving. If we could have stayed forever, I would contemplate it! From the monute we walked through the doors, the service impeccable and I can't recommend it enough! The rooms, and fireplace, are luxurious. We couldn't wait to come back at the end of each day to relax. We had a bed and breakfast package, and the food was fantastic. Doormen, front desk and concierge were all exceptionally helpful. Probably the best hotel experience we have had in our travels (granted, it was quiet over the holiday period, so we probably got lucky too). The house car is an excellent service and we took advantage of it most days. The location of the hotel is great and you can walk through Beacon Hill and Back Bay easily. Stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: nurse_niki5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at XV Beacon during a medical conference this fall. I had a standard room which, although it had a view across an alley right into an office building, was at least very quiet. The bed was comfortable and the shower just fantastic! There were just a few missteps that occurred that have me give it a 4/5 rather than the top rating. In my room, one of the bedside lamp's light bulbs had burnt out, the pilot light was out in the fireplace, the remote for the TV kept jamming, and the ancient hairdryer provided had exposed wiring - rather a lot of oversights for a 5-star hotel. That being said, these were remedied very promptly when brought to the attention of the very courteous staff, which is always the mark of a great hotel. Despite these few details, I'd recommend! And for a great evening snack, order the BLT and fries - an upscale take on a lovely comfort food!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Room and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: chiinfo
Reviews.Content: Tim and I own an Inn, so we tend to be picky and we could not have asked for a nicer room, very spacious for a city hotel, loved the gas fireplace, comfortable chairs, and large flat screen television. The concierges were fantastic, very helpful, and the hotel owns a car that will take you anywhere in downtown Boston. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Without question, the best hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: travelsnob43
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in every four and five star hotel in Boston for both business and pleasure. By far, XV Beacon is THE place to stay. The hotel is perfectly situated. The rooms are unique, with a gas fireplace, and include every amenity one could ask for. The staff and concierge were extremely accommodating, providing those extra personal touches which make all the difference in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Experience - Outperforms the Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: tsteven1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true gem and one if its kind. I would call it a "boutique" hotel - a small hotel that is nestled in the beautiful area of Beacon Street in Boston. Upon arrival, we were greeted at our car, helped out and escorted into the hotel, while our luggage promptly removed and brought in for us and our car parked - all without lifting a finger. The person at the desk was FRIENDLY and greeted us with a huge smile. He asked us our name and was expecting us and was able to immediately locate our reservation without a second's delay. The decor was so interesting and different and it was funky with a classy edge. We felt very at home there. We found our room and seconds later were greeted with a fruit and cheese platter. The attendant brought up our luggage and clothing shortly thereafter. While putting my hanging pants on his luggage rack, a $20 fell out of my pocket and he told me this and handed me the $20 when he brought our things to our room. He could have pocketed that pocket money, but didn't! (So, we gave it to him). Our room was luxurious and well-appointed. We even had a button next to our bed that lit the fireplace. Throughout our entire stay, we were greeted by Mr. and Mrs. (our last name) and were taken care of exquisitely. This is a true treasure, with customer service unlike any other hotel. If you can afford it, you should definitely consider it. The whole experience was just marvelous!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShibaPembroke
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the best hotel we've stayed in! We can't say enough about it. The service and attention to us was impeccable. The room was beautiful and clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff made us feel like royalty, as if we were the only ones in the hotel. The bartenders in Moo Restaurant were fun and mixed a great drink. Breakfast was out of this world! Cannot wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!! STAYED ALL OVER BOSTON AND THIS WAS THE BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: EstatePro27
Reviews.Content: We had a Huge Room overlooking the street towards the park. It had a nice King bed, Fireplace and great bath room. We loved the location and felt it was easy to get around from a public transportation view. We utilized the hotels concierge quite a bit and also the hotel car to go to dinner. We would stay here without a doubt next time in Bean Town. We stayed at 3 other hotels to check out the scene and found this to be the best.

Reviews.Title: “The People Make This Hotel A Winner”
Reviews.Author: rdsltx
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for sightseeing and had elected to stay at XV Beacon based on other reviews. We were not disappointed (except for the view from the room). The room was very nicely finished with a four poster queen-sized bed, HDTV and a fireplace--which turned out to be a great amenity since it was cool and wet in Boston on the day we arrived. While the room was very nice, the two things that make this hotel stand out are the location (one block from Boston Commons and the Freedom Trail), but more importantly, the people. From the doorman who actually seemed happy to see you and eager to help, to the concierge who always had a map and a suggestion, to the bartender who can make some great martini's and seemingly keep 3 conversations going at the same time--all were exceptional! We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite right...”
Reviews.Author: MT_Dallas_TX
Reviews.Content: It's nice, but not what it should be for the money. Small, overcrowded bedroom - no place to turn around, no place to put a room service tray. No washcloths or waste basket in the bathroom. No way to turn on the shower (and let it warm up) without standing under it. No half bottles of wine on the room service menu, full bottles (red) starting at $90. Mini-bar half bottles start at $60 (and go to $295). Mini bar also home to stale $8.70 candy bars. Morning paper was promised but not delivered. Sluggish internet. Small imperfections, but not acceptable to me at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Just delightful...”
Reviews.Author: jjohnzi
Reviews.Content: I was on my way to Provincetown and decided to spend a few days in Boston, just to look around. I prefer smaller boutique hotels over big dinosaur chain hotels and XV Beacon did not disappoint. I was given a large corner room with a view of the Common and a bit of skyline and the room itself was nicely appointed. It was not perfect and some of the custom furniture did show a little wear and tear but this is to be expected. Also, the dark wood on the bathroom doors showed splashes of lotions that I guess the cleaning staff missed. But these are small details. The special couldn't be beat (3 nights for the price of 2) and the breakfast credit was generous. The restaurant was top notch too and accomodated special dietary requests without a problem. One of the best parts of my stay was chatting with Julie, the concierge. She's a no nonsense, straight shooter who gets the job done and made excellent recommendations. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a more intimate, small hotel experience. And the limo service is a great touch too...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: loblolly9
Reviews.Content: I second (and third) everything others have mentioned about this wonderful hotel . . . it truly is a great experience. Oh, and the Lexus with a driver, I felt like the queen of Boston for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CassidyPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at XV Beacon. The staff was outstanding, the room was exceptional and the location, perfect. It was the best experience we've had in a very long time. I highly recommend XV Beacon to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “XV Beacon Hotel is a Boston Boutique Hotel that exceeds all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: BostonBullie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently got married at City Hall in Boston (by the way City Hall great ceremony) and we were looking for a hotel that we could get ready at, closed to City Hall that was also PET FRIENDLY. Well XV Beacon met all of our expectations for an upscale boutique hotel, beautiful lobby, well appointed room, and exceptional roof deck (which is a great location for pictures). What set XV Beacon above most upscale boutique hotels is the staff! Whatever we needed it was there, if not someone quickly brought it to us. Iâ€™ve stayed at several other hotels that claim to be â€œPet Friendlyâ€� yes you might be able to bring your pet but you always feel like they are not really welcome. Well I can say our English Bull dog felt very welcome all of the staff from the door men, to the front desk to the concierge to the GM, who played with Kaptin for awhile, made us feel completely welcome with our puppy. We will definitely keep XV Beacon in mind for family and friends that come to visit and need a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ludwig1827
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very nicely appointed, and they all feature a fireplace, excellent audiovisual options and bath amenities. Beds are very confortable, and the bathrobes from Frette make a difference. Something must be done to improve the service: please read below. Few remarks on my first stay offered me to have a regular rate over the next stay while enjoying the comfort of a Suite. Complains: the front office manager has messed around my bill which boasts an expense that does not exist the concierge promised to give me a couple of tipps over my next destination, but he did not did a proper handover and the morning colleague at my departure was not informed about my requests the turndown service is not always efficient as it should be and few other things must be settled to manage a perfect housekeeping service (e.g. fresh towels)

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service with a Side of Poor Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: CMHTraveller
Reviews.Content: We were going on college visits in Boston so we needed a hotel that was close to a 'T' stop, and one that would give me a true city experience. XV Beacon was honestly the first boutique hotel I've ever stayed in. I see boutique hotels as lacking a lot of things that national brands have, but this is a true exception. Julie and Michael at the concierge desk were by far the best I have ever dealt with. We told them where we were going, and they would give us attractions, restaurants, and other things to do...they were AMAZING! The room was nice, the bed comfy, and the bath products were really good. I did have a few issues though that kept me from giving this hotel a 5. They use electronic keys...REALLY? We thought we lost it like 5 times and they are stupid...give us cards that fit in a WALLET! Also, the shower (shown in a pic) has a glass wall that does not keep water in...curtain please. Our bathroom TV barely worked (the only channel we could watch was E!). And housekeeping was not the best. After doing some tests, the only time they would give us turndown (which came with NOTHING...no chocolate, no water, nothing) was if our 'Service' light was on...not acceptable. However, from the comp. car and driver (Mark) and the other people we encountered at the Beacon, I would highly recommend this fine establishment for anyone who wants to visit Boston. Also, they had free high speed internet, but it was wired...GIVE ME WIRELESS! P.S. TAKE A DUCK TOUR...NOT A TOURIST TRAP...ITS AN AWESOMENESS TRAP!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel on Beacon Hill”
Reviews.Author: saint22
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself and our two young children recently stayed one night at XV Beacon Hotel. I was aware of all the great reviews this hotel has received but my approach to judging a stay at any hotel is to have no real expectations and just see how it goes. To me the most useless reviews involve people saying that their expectations were not met. How does that tell anyone about a place. How should I know anything about you or your expectations. That being said, we had an extremely pleasant stay. We had previously arranged to take the Boston Duck Tour and the Hotel booked its house car, a beautiful Lexus sedan, to take us to the Museum of Science where the Duck Tour begins. We arrived at 1:00 PM and we stored our bags and house Lexus was waiting for us. After the Duck Tour (a must when you have kids) we arrived back at the hotel to check in. The Lobby is an intimate and very striking space. Check in was cordial and we received our keys (yes metal keys) to our room. Our room was on the fifth floor #506. The room was a luxury studio room on the outside corner of the building. The room looked the same as the picture above here on TA. The room looked out onto Beacon Street and down Beacon Hill with the corner of Boston Common visible and the Prudential Building looming in the distance. Outside the windows were window boxes filled with petunias and geraniums. The room was stylish in a masculine way. The furniture was comfortable and attractive. The king sized bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom, while somewhat small was handsomely appointed. The rainfall shower was perfect. My wife and I enjoyed the hotel Bar at their fine restaurant Mooo while our babysitter watched our children in the room. Our bartender was great. She was friendly and professional. We were heading out to dinner and the house Lexus whisked us to our destination. Our driver was great. He recommended a place for breakfast on Charles Street. We went there the next morning and it was terrific. The hotel staff was friendly, sincere and professional. They were a class act. With a perfect location, stylish rooms and impeccable service, XV Beacon Hotel is a perfect choice when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Amazing Service, Delicious Food!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaKelley
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at XV Beacon last month when visiting family in Boston. We were blown away by the service and location of the Hotel. Our room was beautiful and one of the best we have stayed at in Boston, and we have stayed with all the luxury hotels. The staff was helpful, very attentive, and even offered us a ride to our destination in the complimantary Lexus. However, the hotel is located in the heart of Beacon hill so we could walk everywhere. We ate a late night dinner at Moo and the food was just as good as it was the at Federalist (old restaurant). We even decided to grab lunch at the bar the next day before heading to the airport. I would recommend this boutique hotel to anyone, you will not find a more special hotel anywhere else in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - terrific stay”
Reviews.Author: CindySanti10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights last week at XV, and were very happy. The studio room with pull-out was great for 2 adults and 1 child. Excellent customer service throughout - definitely 5 stars for the staff. Room service from Mooo was lovely. I'd like to rate the entire experience 4.5 rather than 4. The room had a few "not perfect" touches including a large crack in the sink and very noisy faucet. But overall, wonderful stay. We will return to our new home in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “XV Beacon-McCartney-Fenway... a Night to Remember”
Reviews.Author: Fenway09
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you appreciate a good shower, you haven't lived until you stay at the XV Beacon Hotel! My wife and I escaped to Boston to see Paul McCartney at Fenway Park ,and although the concert and venue were exceptional, the accomodations at XV made our night. Simply put, the Beacon exudes class and elegance, from the rich woodwork to carefully designed "people friendly" accouterments. Friendly, informative hotel personnel helped us in every way from transportation to a great breakfast recommendation for the next morning. A comfortable bed, wonderful sound system, great climate control, led to an unbeatable ambiance fit for a king and queen.. or maybe even a husband and wife escaping from the hectic life that 5 children lovingly produce. And, if for no other reason...... you need stay at the XV Beacon for the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection and luxury...right in your backyard!”
Reviews.Author: stashinagrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are born in raised in the Boston area, and decided for a quick little one-nighter close to home. We have eaten and stayed at the best restaraunts in the area (Lespalier, The Ritz, etc) and this is BY FAR our new favorite. We discovered XV purely by accident, and were VERY plesantly surprised by this little gem. Tucked in behind the Statehouse and directly next to the Boston Common, XV Beacon is an elegant, modern, stylish and convenient little hotel. There are no heirs of prentention here. From the wonderfully warm and friendly young girl @ front desk, to the guys out front who parked our cars, to the GM of "Moo"(Jim, who made me laugh!!) and waiters and waitresses, everyone was extremely upbeat, friendly, personable and just plain old nice! Not to mention the DELICIOUS meals we enjoyed there. We will not hesitate to book a room here again. (which btw, are beautiful and modern...loved the rooftop deck too!) Slightly pricey for some, but ABSOLUTELY worth every penny!!! The old adage, "You get what you pay for" rings true!! My husband is a tough one to please; he is first generation Italian, and has been eating top notch gourmet food since the day he was born! We loved, loved, LOVED this hotel. For out of towners, they have a car at the hotel that will take you where ever you like!! Theaters, nightlife and historic attractions all within walking distance. If you are looking for modern, trendy elegance then XV Beacon is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel surpassed every expecation I had!”
Reviews.Author: hondajosh
Reviews.Content: The XV Beacon was one boutique hotel left on a short list of luxury hotels I have always wanted to stay at. I tend to only stay in luxury boutique hotels when I travel or at least attempt to. The XV is everything it claims to be. Small, intimate, luxury, a masculine contemporary decor mixed with old world Federealist charm! The staff is impeccable, they approach you by name, and pay attention to every detail of your stay to assure it is nothing less then perfect! Their concierge even went out and brought my partner starbucks while I was out at the bank because he had forgotten to ask me to grab him one! Now that is service! Michael and Jill (their conceirge team) were amazing! The front desk staff was fabulous, they even upgraded my room upon arrival! The bathroom and amenities in the room could even spoil two spa retreat finatics like myself and my partner, right down to the peppermint foot cream and cucumber eye cream kept chilled in the rooms martini bar!---I could go on all day ranting about the XV Beacon. Do yourself a favor, weather you are traveling for business, vacation, or just a one night getaway like I was stay with them. Oh yeah they even have a chaufferred Lexus Sedan LS they will take you around the city in at no extra cost so no need for expensive cab fares! Thanks again XV for one of the best nights I've EVER had in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Stellar”
Reviews.Author: 2andahalfmen
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful oasis in the midst of downtown. The location is perfect, and the service leaves nothing to be desired. The check-in experience was very fast. Travelling with a 9 month old can pose its challenges, and it was so nice to arrive in the room and have the crib set up. Front Desk Experience: From the time we arrived at the front door until the time we were settled in our room was less than 5 minutes. Check-out was also painless and quick. The Room: we stayed in a traditional room and it was lovely. Beautiful touches throughout. The bed was comfortable, and the crib for the little one was perfect. The audio visual system was excellent too. No guesswork to operation. The upgraded amenities were perfect too. And the shower....awesome. The restaurant: we were able to have breakfast and dinner in Mooo. The food is excellent, and lots of variety on both the menu and the wine list. Very relaxing and pleasant dining experience. The concierge desk: special thanks to Julie for organizing our rental for the day. She organized travel for us to the rental agency, and we dropped the car off at the hotel and she organized getting it delivered back to the agency. Perfect. I neglected to get the name of the lady that was working Friday evening, but we mentioned to her that we would be leaving Saturday morning for the airport, and there was one of the hotel's luxury cars waiting for us at 8am. The bell staff: Jack greeted us on return with our rental and took special care of our 9 month old (who fell in love with him). Edward looked after us on the morning of departure and did a fantastic job as well. These guys are pros. Housekeeping / Turndown service: you would never know these folks were around other than having the room refreshed and clean everytime it seemed we stepped out. They did a fantastic job as well. As for all the other staff we ran into during our stay, they were always professional and accomodating. Thank you so much for making our stay so special! These folks are doing a bang up job of running a beautiful, 5 star property. There is nothing out of place or order and you never feel like can't or shouldn't ask for something. You know that they will be more than happy to do whatever they can to make your stay more enjoyable. Congratulations, guys....we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: jomochicago
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful stay. Children we were welcome with open arms, staff was fantastic. Helped us see and experience the city. We used all of the amenities, room service, mooo, house sedan, health club.. all were superb.. This is a MUST stay and be your home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, stylish hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: goingtothesun
Reviews.Content: This was the 1st, but won't be the last time I stay at this hotel. I have visited Boston many times, but apparently this is a relatively new hotel. Great location on Beacon St. by the Boston Common. Small, I would guess around 70 rooms. Very tastefully decorated, with lots of dark woods, high end fixtures, fireplace, stereo, plasma TV and VERY comfortable bed. I travel for a living and therefore truly apprecitate the old thick walls that seam sound-proof. Great restaurant on the 1st floor, the Kobe spring-rolls are a must. Helpful professional staff that new my name from check in to check out. The free local town car was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Escape of rich yet subtle elegance”
Reviews.Author: 37Birthday
Reviews.Content: I could have stayed for a month and still would have felt that it was too short. The graciousness and attentiveness of the staff, the size and decor of the room, the food and amenities of the service made XV Beacon one the best hotels at which I've ever stayed. Fortunately I was there for a personal celebration, which they acknowledged through a elegant dessert dish and a personal note - one of the many notable elegant touches throughout our too-short stay. But, as a frequent business traveler, I would have found the hotel equally as pleasing, with a large work desk and open space that could relax even the most busy, weary executive. Simply stated, XV Beacon has a rich character with all the charm and service of only the very best of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Large, luxurious, cozy room. Wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy06
Reviews.Content: We found a very attentive staff from the moment we arrived until they brought us our car to leave. The rooms are gorgeous--luxurious and cozy at the same time. The room has a comfortable bed, propane fireplace, large flat screen TV and wonderful sound system. XV Beacon is in a fantastic location right in the heart of downtown Boston!!! We dined in the restaurant Mooo which is right off the lobby (no need to even walk outside) and had a wonderful meal. We will definitely stay there again and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “$470 A Night & Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: NycToonces
Reviews.Content: I was there for four days and there were many problems, including: 1. Plumbing problems, i.e. no hot water. There was lukewarm water in the shower and the bathroom sink. Management sent someone up to fix it, but the water was still lukewarm the next night. In desperation, I crouched down under the sink and saw a water valve and turned it all the way open. That fixed the problem. I didn't know I needed basic plumbing skills to stay in a four-star hotel. I was so demoralized by two days of no hot water that I didn't even bother mentioning that the shower didn't drain. I just stood in water up over my ankles every morning. 2. Extra blanket problems. I called the front desk around 10PM to ask for two extra blankets. After a long pause, the night manager said he would check with Housekeeping to see if there were any (?) and that he would call back in 15 minutes if there was a problem. A 1/2 hour later, no call, no blankets, so I called again and finally got the blankets. How gauche of me to expect a hotel to have blankets! 3. The layout. The bathroom has a separate room for toilet and tub, with a sink and vanity area outside of it. Unfortunately, this area is opposite to the bed. There are no sliding doors to close it off, so you both better have the same sleeping schedule. 4. Everyone has their hand out for a tip. It is really obnoxious, especially in a place that doesn't really have a doorman. We were there for 5 days and 4 nights and except for our arrival and departure, where the doorman knew he was going to get a tip, we opened the heavy doors ourselves. 5. Don't bother with the free limousine service. The driver talks your ear off, hustling for a tip. A taxi is cheaper and quieter. I will not stay here again. There were chips and scratches on the furniture, the ceiling fixture was hanging askew, like the scene in a movie after wild frat house party, and I've had better service at a Day's Inn. And at least they have hot water and blankets.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Elegance”
Reviews.Author: NewEngChris
Reviews.Content: Located on that sacred piece of Brahman Boston's Beacon Street between the front steps of the State House and The Athenaeum the XV Beacon is worthy of its heritage. XV Beacon has a sophisticated designer style with careful old world detail and luxurious amenities from the gas fireplace, lovely flowers in the window boxes at each window, white marble an chrome and dark mahogany paneling. The service is unsurpassed. The friendly knowledgeable concierge ready to serve in the comfortable stylish lobby, the introduction to the roomâ€™s amenities by the staff and room service presents what feels like your own staff. Donâ€™t miss enjoying your beautiful room with the morning sun, freshly brewed Khave coffee and the Boston Globe. The roof garden is a highlight overlooking the lights of the city or for lounging in the afternoon sun. Nothing captures the heart and soul of Bostonâ€™s past, present and future like the XV Beacon.

Reviews.Title: “XV Beacon-Perfect Location, Wonderful Staff- A Winner”
Reviews.Author: Soxfan6504
Reviews.Content: Stayed at XV Beacon the weekend of June 13. I am a loyal Marriott member, staying in hotels more than 100 nights yearly. XV Beacon is a breath of fresh air. The staff is dedcated to making your stay as enjoyable as possible. From the valet, concierge, desk clerk, and bell staff, everyone is friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautifully appointed, flat screens, stereo, period furniture, truly luxurious. There is a rooftop deck with breathtaking views of the Boston skyline. We walked everywhere we went; theatre, Fanuel Hall, public gardens , Newbury Street, etc. We are already planning our next night in Boston and it will be at XV Beacon!

Reviews.Title: “Great way to experience Boston in luxury”
Reviews.Author: cmv9298
Reviews.Content: You couldn't find a hotel with a better location in Boston. Although there is a complimentary Lexus to take you to destinations within Boston, absolutely everything worth doing in town is within an easy walk.The only thing is that it's hard to leave your room because it's so beautiful. There's a fireplace, big screen t.v., luxurious bed and bedding ,and a well stocked mini bar. We have never seen a nicer bathroom. The bathrobes are thick and soft.The staff is friendly and helpful. Our concierge, Maureen, was able to get us in to a very popular restaurant with very little notice. There were lots of little touches, too, like the business cards in our rooms with our names on them and cookies and fruit dipped in chocolate. We just snick in for one night and came home feeling pampered. Definitely worth another trip in!

Reviews.Title: “An elegant and comfortable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: zinfandel01
Reviews.Content: At the end of a weeks holiday we decided to treat ourselves to a night at XV Beacon and we were not disappointed. From the moment you arrive you are made to feel special at this hotel and not like just another guest. Check-in was polite and efficient and the glass of home made lemonade was a refreshing treat. The rooms are totally fantastic - the decor manages to combine traditional and modern to create a relaxing environment. The gas fire (which is operated by a switch by the bed!) ipod dock, free internet, flat screen tv and stereo means that your every wish is catered for. The bathroom was also thoughtfully designed with a fabulous rain shower and a jacuzzi bath. A real hairdryer, high quality "fresh" toiletries, luxury bedlinen and towels all added to the experience. The only problem with this hotel is that we didn't want to leave our room!

Reviews.Title: “Amzing experience”
Reviews.Author: Arizcats
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at XV Beacon several times and keep going back. The service is spectacular and the rooms have been updated and are better than most other fine boutique hotels. Everyone from the concierge to the driver of the complimentary car service went above and beyond to make our stay not only memorable, but now I don't think there is another hotel in Boston where I would rather stay. The GM greeted us during our stay as well and she was absolutely wonderful to us, and she definitely cares about her guests, as she likes to make everyone feel at home and is her number one priority. Everything we needed from tickets to events around town, reservations at restaurants, etc was provided to us and made our stay in Boston even better. Even the bathrooms in our room was awesome and perfectly clean with TV's in it! Overall this place is amazing and I will continue giving my business to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay from start to finish...”
Reviews.Author: ottoandsam
Reviews.Content: With a busy summer of travel and projects, an overnight stay in our own city seemed just the antidote to our busy lives. From the moment we pulled up to the valet, we felt like we had stepped into a tiny oasis of calm and relaxation. The warm greeting started with the valet, went right through check in and the bellman taking us to the room. Upon arrival in the room, the music was playing softly and the ice bucket was filled. We were treated to a brief overview of how everything (the fireplace, stereo, etc...) worked. The front desk had confirmed our dinner reservation, but knowing that we had arrive a bit later than anticipated, took the liberty of letting the restaurant know we would be late - a nice treat to not have to do that ourselves. While we loved the idea of the car service dropping us off anywhere in town, we decided to dine at Mooo, the hotel restaurant. The service was impeccable. We were never rushed through dinner and our waiter allowed us time with our cocktails, our appetizers, and our dinner...he made sure we had everything that we needed, but never intruded on our quiet conversation. We asked to split the lobster bisque and it was served in small crocks - and tasted DIVINE! Best ever. We'll be back for it. We also split a tuna appetizer which was refreshing before switching to our filets which were worth the entire stay! Yum! We did not order dessert, but the homemade "mallomars" were just enough sweet treat to top off the meal. After dinner, we took advantage of the quiet roofdeck to see the city in a new light while having a nightcap. Inside a city oasis, it is lovely to have an even quieter spot to enjoy the stars. Getting back to the room, I cannot get over how clean and well appointed it was. The bathroom was modern, but also warm and inviting. The rainfall showerhead made us both re-think our own showers at home, too! What a treat. I could have stayed there forever. It was also nice to have a real hairdryer - not the typical hotel hairdryer (a small thing that makes a huge difference to a lot of women when packing!!!). The gas fireplace set a great mood, even on a summer evening, and we enjoyed just curling up and catching our breath from a busy week. We ordered room service the following morning so as to just continue enjoying our little escape. Service was prompt and the food was fantastic - allowing us a bit more time before heading back into our busy world. As we left, our farewell was as warm and charming as our arrival. And we agreed that XV Beacon would definitely be a once a year treat to ourselves. A perfect escape!! And while we did not bring our pets, the fact that it is a pet friendly hotel makes our recommendation to others even easier!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Frau_Gunta
Reviews.Content: My friend an I had the opportunity to stay at XV Beacon last week and had an amazing time. The room was beautiful and spacious with a working fire place. The bathroom was also gorgeous with unbelievable water pressure. Although all of the amenities are amazing, it was really the staff that really made our stay. Everyone from the doorman to the concierge to the general manager (who we had the pleasure to meet while checking in) were courteous, friendly, and professional. I unfortunately fell ill during our stay and again the staff was amazing and helpful. I cannot wait to have the chance to go back for a second stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden City Gem is the Ultimate Intimate Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: cassiekathlene
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in my breath was taken away. The hotel was perfect in every way. Just a few things to touch on that really blew me away were: -Not only did you get a newspaper delivered to your door in the morning, upon arrival you got to choose from 5 different newspapers. -In the bathroom it was the little things that really made a difference. Even the toilet paper rolls under the sink were individually wrapped up in silver paper and had a purple velvet bow tied around them. The shampoo, conditioner, body wash, body lotion, and shower gel were not just the regular brands that you get in every other hotel, they were the best smelling products I have ever used in a hotel before. The pomogranite conditioner and sugar-lemon body cream were amazing and you could even buy them from the concierge. The waterfall shower head and the jacuzzi bathtub were unbelievable. -There was a card on our bed that had the weather report for our entire stay on it and there were also cards with my name on it, the hotel logo, and the direct phone number to my room. -The fireplace and stereo were able to be turned on with the switch of a button right next to the bed. - I loved the fact that there was a complimentary Lexus that would tkae us into Boston if we decided to go out. -The roof top terrace was amazing and had a spectacular view of the city, a jacuzzi, and also a fitness room. Overall, I loved this hotel and definitely think it is the best hotel I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent get away hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rogerfly
Reviews.Content: Close to very good restaurant selections. Very comfortable with some cool modern touches. Trendy rooms but not at the expense of practical comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JCMPBrooklyn_NY
Reviews.Content: My Partner & I needed some time away and decided to stay at XV Beacon. We were SO impressed. It was just what we needed for a short romantic getaway. A nice sized room, very high ceilings, fireplace, stereo system, wireless internet, fresh flowers in the bathroom (we Love that!), attentive staff and more. It was completely enjoyable from beginning to end. And an incredible location. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing retreat in bustling Boston.”
Reviews.Author: momjane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at 15 Beacon in historic Boston. This quiet, boutique hotel offers a wonderful combination of old world charm with modern amenities. The gorgeous studio we stayed in was tastefully decorated in neutral colors and furnished with a contemporary flair. Loved the ease of working the gas fireplace and stereo from the bed. Loved the shower! Enjoyed wrapping up in the terry robe after pampering myself with the soy shampoo, pomegranate conditioner and lemon sugar lotion. Fitness center was bright, clean and stocked with waters. In our opinion, the rooftop garden patio with comfortable teak furniture is the hotel's best kept secret! A great place to enjoy a drink and some North-End bought appetizers. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for a getaway weekend!”
Reviews.Author: LyndseyMA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at XV Beacon last weekend and it was AWESOME! It is a beautiful hotel with a very courteous and friendly staff that we experienced throughout our entire stay. We loved the delicious treats upon arrival in our room, the stereo and the flat screen TV on the wall. The tasteful dÃ©cor -a combination of old world, yet fashionably contemporary details made our stay very comfortable. We discovered a warm and intimate feel about XV Beacon's rooms with a fireplace, artwork and the detailed woodwork. The fresh flower in the room was a nice touch. The Full Rain shower in the Bathroom was delightful and a perfect way to start the day! We also had a great Brunch in Mooo on Sunday morning- fresh ripe fruit, steamy hot cornbread and the Spinach and melted cheese Frittata was â€œto die forâ€�. It was just a short walk to the Charles for a lovely stroll along the water on Sunday morning. I would highly recommend XV Beacon for a weekend getaway-luxurious and secluded, yet minutes from the bustling Back Bay and Faneuil Hall Marketplace. It was a much needed respite from our hurried lifestyle.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST HOTEL EXPERIENCE we have had in YEARS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sfdonovan
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC!!! A hidden gem in the heart of Boston! OUTSTANDING personal, friendly service! Everyone knew our names! They catered to our every whim! SUPERB room! Turn on the gas fireplace and stereo from the bed! Every amenity you could possibly ask for is in the room! GREAT workout room, which overlooks the roof deck! UNIQUE roof deck! My wife and I made our own private party on the 2-level roof deck overlooking Boston and Cambridge -- which we had all to ourselves!. I walked to Boston's Italian North End, got fresh appetizers from an authentic Italian market, we made cocktails, creating a unique, romantic, private experience above the heart of Boston! WE CAN'T WAIT TO RETURN!!!!!! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND XV BEACON!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Little Boston Gem”
Reviews.Author: NewtonSoccerMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night for a short getaway checking in on a Friday evening Memorial day weekend. XV Beacon is housed in a small historic building with awesome details, art deco design, with a European feel. While checking in, the Concierge offered us iced tea or lemonade which was a nice touch. We stayed in a standard room, cozy, with full of great amenities- a comfortable canopy bed, cd player with great selections, gas fireplace, cordless phones. A nice touch was a welcome platter with cookies and chocolate dipped strawberries. A good way to start a getaway. The bathroom was spacious and the rain shower was awesome- love the water pressure. They offer a line of Fresh bathroom amenities. I especially enjoyed having a vanilla flavored lip balm to use since I had forgotten mine. The hairdryer was a professional one which did not burn my hair- a pet peeve when I travel to most hotels. We sat up at the Rooftop Deck to take in the sights of the City. It was a warm clear evening with great views of the State House, Boston Common and Boston Harbor. We walked around Beacon Hill and Charles Street to checkout some local places. We also went to the North End which is a nice 10 minute stroll for coffee and pastries. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurant Moo during this trip. I had lunch at Moo a while back and the food was great, and the portions were enormous. Morning came and we took our time getting up and ready to head on back home to the kids and our busy lives. My husband and I travel a lot for business and pleasure and have been to many great places. This one was unique since we are locals and it's rare that we stay at a Boston hotel. It was a memorable weekend, albeit short. We're talking about another short getaway sometime soon!

Reviews.Title: “The best 'staycation' ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Mgoldberg2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hip and swanky hotel with a very accommodating staff. I am from Boston and my boyfriend is from Europe. We were supposed to go to NYC, but his business ended up in Boston for a long weekend. He insisted that we still 'get away' though I lived here. We landed at XV Beacon Hotel. From the moment we walked through the front door, it was the perfect vacation. We were greeted with the friendliest staff, assisted with all reservations (cars, reservations, concert tickets, etc). It was incredible. The staffs candor and cooperativeness was our topic at lunch, as both of us have traveled all over the world and not yet been a guest at a hotel that we had zero complaints....not even one between us! The rooms were more than we expected in every way, as well as the attentiveness of the housekeeping staff. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, visitor and Bostonian alike! .....the front desk staff even remembered our names through the entire stay! Amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “XV Beacon was a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: vic_erik
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the XV Beacon recently and from the minute we got out of our car (valet right at the entrance) to the minute we left the service/staff was exceptional. The rooms were beautiful and very clean and much larger than we expected from a historical building. There wasn't anything that had been left out, from the stereo playing when we entered the room to the weather report for the next day sitting on the night stand! The hotel is located right in the heart of Boston next to the Common and a few minutes walk to the waterfront, the possibilities are endless for restaurants and night life. We would definitely go back to this hotel, combined with the location we had a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience from the time we pulled up till the time we drove away.”
Reviews.Author: NBarry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at XV Beacon Hotel last night and absolutely loved it. From the minute we drove up and throughout our stay, we were very well taken care of. Josh, the conceriege, was so helpful and attentive, the room was beautiful and had everything we needed, the roof-top jacuzzi and garden was a nice surprise which we took advantage of and the location was just perfect - situated right between Newbury St. and Fanueil Hall. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “XV Beacon, Beyond Superlatives”
Reviews.Author: brianbabcock
Reviews.Content: Would I recommend XV Beacon to a friend? Absolutely...and I do! My frequent business trips to Boston have, over many years, given me occassion to visit many hotels. Most are five star and all, are excellent but you see, XV Beacon is superlative "value". Simply stated, it's my favorite hotel in the world.. The way I see it, if value is the intersecting point of service and price, these guys at XV Beacon have it "nailed" ! Do I sound passionate ? It's because they deserve this kind of asertive recommendation! They'll meet every need of every customer. At least, that has been my experience. Brian Babcock, St Catharines, On., Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: wjwalshesq
Reviews.Content: Had occasion to remain in town on business one evening and decided to stay at XV Beacon. This is a 1st class destination. From the moment you walk in, the staff is pleasant and accomodating. I was provided an upgrade without even asking for it. The rrom was beautiful and had all the amenities, including a fireplace and flat screen. The robe was luxurious and the towels were big and absorbent. Even the shower head was big and the pressure was great. Finally, I ordered room swervice which arrived right on time, was perfectly done and more than my appetite could accomodate. After having stayed at the new Ritz and the Four Seasons, this is my new 1st choice.

Reviews.Title: “XV Beacon makes you feel like you are coming home to your fully staffed townhouse”
Reviews.Author: bdogNewYork
Reviews.Content: The level of personalized attention and service provided by the staff of XV Beacon is without compare. The dark wood and soft hues are very soothing and sophisticated. XV Beacon is in a perfect location right near the park, great restaurants and bars. Small enough to feel like your own townhouse and large enough to provide all the amenities. And a great restaurant and bar right in the hotel. The only place I would consider staying when I travel to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: kchF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at XV Beacon since it opened and feel it's the best hotel in Boston. The service and staff are excellent and our room had everything in it and then some. The view was spectacular form our King room. We ate at Mooo and thoroughly enjoyed it -the food and service were a 10.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay in Boston - will never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: redpup
Reviews.Content: We booked the XV Beacon after travelling from the UK with a three year old, not getting in to Boston until 7pm-ish -- very late for our three year old!! When we checked in, our room was outfitted with the child bed made up and ready for immediate use (which it was!). This was such a relief for us after a long plane journey and really made a difference for our three year old recovering from her jet lag. The service was also amazing, and we felt like once we arrived we were just completely taken care of and looked after. It was truly great and the only place we will land when going to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Style Made The Difference”
Reviews.Author: SheriffBart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at XV Beacon on a a recent one night (Saturday) stay. I had always wanted to stay here, but remember checking online and seeing the rates at 450/night and up, so on a whim I checked their web page and secured a rate of 349/night. Upon a swift check in, we were offered a $50 upgrade to a Junior suite, which I accepted. It was worth it. We had a top floor room with a cool view over the Beacon Hill neighborhood, a nice sitting area with a flat screen TV and fireplace, a comfy King Bed (be aware that the standard rooms here include only a queen bed), a DVD player with overhead speakers wired in around the room (a nice touch), and an ample bathroom with a whirlpool bath and a rainfall showerhead. Service throughout our stay was outstanding; we were quickly offered the complimentary Lexus sedan service to dinner. We ate breakfast at Mooo the next morning, which was pricey but good. This is a great choice for a luxury hotel stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with Great Service, But Not For Me”
Reviews.Author: BMR10023
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice. The staff is pleasant and helpful and the service is excellent. The location is pretty good (although not as good as the Four Seasons Boston's location). However, the look and feel of the rooms was just not for me. I'd compare staying at XV Beacon to staying in an old but really nice, well-kept brownstone. The showers are weird/old fixtures, things generally look old, and the hotel doesn't have wireless internet access. To access the internet, I had to borrow an ethernet cord and even with that, I had trouble . . . in line with the excellent service, someone was there in 2 minutes to try (unsuccessfully) to fix it. The music system in the room is pretty cool - there are speakers in the ceilings all through the rooms, so you can really enjoy music while in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the XV Beacon-Truely the best in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: paradaCologne
Reviews.Content: stayed at the XV Beacon recently. I have been in many luxury hotels worldwide but this is one of the best. Located in the very center of Boston- walked 15 Minutes to Down Town crossing or to China town or 15 minutes walk or less to charles street. The Boston Common is just slightly opposite the hotel and the State House ist just right next door. 5 minutes to the goverment center. Wow, I can not say enough for this hotel. If you like to do the city sightseeing, the Trolley tour stop is just slightly across the street! There are 3 convenience shops with ATM next to the hotel. If you heading somewhere in Downtown and don't know how to go- get a ride from Hotel Limousine service. It's FREE! Many hotel guests use this service but it always available if you book at least 1 hours in advance! The service from front desk, concierge, restaurant, housekeeping were just wonderful. My room/ traditional room was great and tastefully decorated. Loved the lighting and the Fireplace! Flat HD TV, huge couch and plenty of space. There is a Small Jaguzzi Tub which works very good. The Rainshower is to die for!! Ok, it's not cheap here but you get what you paid for. If you like a bit view go for the studio room, my room was facing the nearby office building but it didn't bother me at all, it seems no one look over into my room at least I'm walking naked. If you like to reward yourself when in Boston, go for XV Beacon and book at least a traditional room.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare service”
Reviews.Author: Chargingruby
Reviews.Content: Just finished a two night stay with two rooms. Faciities are very nice, but the service was downright incompetent. Incoming calls to my son's room didn't work, despite pointing out the problem the first night. Never fixed. When checking out at 5am, requested a bellman who didn't show until we were carrying out bags out after waiting 10 minutes. Asked the night before for a cab to be waiting for us outside at 5am, and of course there was none. Asked for newspapers to be delivered in the morning, and none came. Virtually every request was serviced with ineptitude.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: nilnod
Reviews.Content: We had a great "Girls Weekend" at XV Beacon. The service is wonderful, especially Mark who was our driver for the weekend. Our breakfast was delivered at the exact time we requested and was very good. My only complaint was with some of the room features. We loved the TV, fireplace and stereo system but the lighting was horrible, the heat/ac was erratic and the only full length mirror was on the wall, right next to the bed. There were no hooks in the bathroom to hang your robes or towels. So overall, service, location and food were excellant but the rooms need a bit of design work!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Eric168
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to treat ourselves for our wedding anniversary after reading a Conde Nast review. The first thing that struck us was the smell of the grilled steaks from the restaurant which is in the same building. I really enjoy the smell of steaks but there was a serious ventilation problem going on and all the fumes were being pumped into the lobby. The check in was handled correctly and the staff were friendly, but it felt a bit fake. As soon as there was a little pressure the real attitude surfaced. The front desk was generally dissorganised and simple requests such as having our car ready on time for our departure were ignored. The room was nice and the decor impressive, but it was a little run down. There was a lot a noise from the street. There is no pool and the roof top terrace was not operational in May... there were no spots where we could just hang out and feel comfortable. The complementary car service is not flexible. In essence, you don't get your money's worth. You really pay for the image of luxury, but its far from the real thing.

Reviews.Title: “Needs up keep”
Reviews.Author: reldan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the XV Beacon in July. We were in a suit that cost over $500. The room upon first glance was really nice. Big windows, cool design, nice bathroom etc. However when we looked a littler closer there we things that were not so nice. The cover on the bed had a big stain on it, the light fixture was all cracked, and best of all there were foot prints on one of the curtains. They obviously are not keeping things very clean The other thing that seemed a little strange to me was that the concierge recommended the same awful Italian restaurant to several guests that were staying at the hotel. None of us liked it at all. The restaurant must be giving kick backs. We had asked the hotel to suggest a really good Italian restaurant, and this certainly was not. I must say that with the exception of conceirges , the rest of the hotel staff were very nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great BDAY Gift”
Reviews.Author: TallHotelSnob
Reviews.Content: My wife took me for a surprise night at the Beacon XV enroute to her college reunion (where we stayed at a chain hotel). From the moment we got there it was very clear that this was a different kind of hotel. From the valet at the front, to the woman who checked us in to Frank who brought up our bags, it was clear that great service was their focus. Initially we were given a room that had a queen size bed and when they realized I am very tall and have a hard time sleeping in queen they immediately moved us to a room with a king. Frank even stayed to make sure we got situated in a new room. Once in the room, it did not disappoint. Great bed, large flat screen tv, gas fireplace with switch next to the bed. Great modern luxury decor. In addition, the bathroom was great as well, great supplies, tv next to the mirror etc. Just a great overall experience. We did not get a chance to have a meal at MOOOO their redone restaurant but we did get to go when it was The Federalist. It was so good we were disappointed that they changed it but we hear it is great. We did however go out to a restaurant and the hotel provided us with a Chaffeur driven Lexus LS460 which was such a nice touch, In addition, Matt who drove us over gave us a full review of the restaurant and told us what was good on the menu. For the record his suggestions did not disappoint. My only compaint is that i had to leave the next day and head to the chain hotel. The best way I can describe Beacon XV is that it feels like u r staying in a luxury apartment building, with a great doorman, driver etc. It really was a pleasure and am lucky my wife thought of it. we definitely will be back. As a final note, one of the worst things that happens when you stay at a hotel is you leave something in the room. My wife left her evening bag and we did not realize until we arrived at our next hotel. As this is not the first time we have done this we were pretty sure we would be out of luck. Instead I called the hotel and they immediately went to look for it and called back 3 minutes later and let me know they found it and asked where they could send it.I decided to pick it up and they actually checked id before they gave it to us. Thats awesome...THANKS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but way over priced”
Reviews.Author: UpbeatTraveler
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel is located next to the Mass. State House in a very good location to the Freedom Trail, etc. It is also part of the AmEx preferred hotel program, however, we were unable to recevive many of the benefits of this program during our stay. Part of the program is to receive an automatic room upgrade, if available. We checked into the hotel at about 7:30 PM after our flight from the West Coast for a two night stay. We were told that no upgrades were available that night but would be available the next night. No effort was made in day two to upgrade our room. Additionally, part of the program was to give us an $85 credit for dinner at the restaurant in the hotel. When we went to the restaurant for dinner and told them we were hotel guests, we were told that there were no tables available for us for the entire evening but we could sit at the bar and eat. Breakfast was included as part of the program and available. My wife and I had to share a rather smallish queen bed. In the room, which faced the side of an adjacent building, was only one rack to place our luggage. We had to remove a rather large, clunky fax machine from its stand to be used as the second luggage stand. The bathroom was quite small with only one sink and a shower. In my opinion this hotel is certainly not worth the $500 per night price.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: david_k001
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at XV Beacon, but that quickly dwindled once I settled in. Yes, the staff, except for one incident, was very pleasant and attentive, but my expectations were not met. The hotel is beautiful and in a great neighborhood, but here are my issues: I was told that, with the exception of two rooms, there are no king sized beds at this hotel. When I requested a king bed, I was told king beds are not available in my rate category. Excuse me, but for $400+/night, I can get a king bed at plenty of four star hotels without being told "it's not available in my price category." I'm 6'2" and my wife isn't short, so we prefer a king bed. To deal with the situation, we ordered a rollaway bed so that we wouldn't end up kicking each other at night. I couldn't believe the rollaway. In my opinion, it was ridiculously uncomfortable, so we it taken away. In addition, the hotel wanted to charge us $35/night for the rollaway. I thought that was pretty hilarious given that we couldn't be accommodated with a king bed. Lest I forget, when one of the staff members entered the room to stock the minibar, or bring in the rollaway, they didn't pull the door entirely shut when they exited. Hence our room was left open for anyone to enter. To add to my disappointment, the room was dirty (see photos). There was a substantial amount of dust on the television shelf and in the bathroom, not to mention a grimy build-up of gross material toward the bottom of the shower door seal. The HVAC vent is located above the sleeping area so that air was constantly blowing on us as we tried to sleep. We ordered a blanket, but none were available. A couple of sheets were given to us instead. Evidently the HVAC is not a climate-controlled system that shuts off once the room reaches a specific temperature. Perhaps the system in our room wasn't working properly, but I finally turned it off so that we didn't have a constant draft blowing on us. This, however, created a whole other issue. Food odors from the restaurant started to come through the vent. The four-poster bed is positioned in such a way that one's view of the television is impeded, it's absolutely absurd. We had to call to ask for tissue and toilet paper as it wasn't replenished, nor did anyone think to store any of these extra necessities under the rather ample sized bathroom vanity. There was no hot water in the shower one morning, evidently there were plumbing problems that day. I realize that unexpected issues arise, but this certainly didn't make me any happier, nor did the excessively loud music that permeated from the adjoining room. To sum things up: great location, beautiful boutique hotel, but housekeeping could do a better job. In my opinion, you should add king sized mattresses -- there's certainly enough room to do so. Eliminate the four-poster bed or install a plasma above the fireplace so that one can see the entire television screen. Given the four and five star hotels that are under construction in Boston, I think XV Beacon needs to focus on making some changes if they are going to effectively compete in the marketplace. What I had hoped would be a restful vacation was disturbed by issues that I encountered at XV Beacon.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, will stay again...”
Reviews.Author: BCNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at XV Beacon recently. Loved the style, location, service and amenities. Was upgraded to a Studio room which was a nice size although a bit odd that it has only a Queen bed. While we only ate breakfast and some appetizers in the hotel, it was a great looking room and the service and food was amazing. Went to dinner around the corner at No 9 Park, which I highly recommend. One of the best meals I have had. My only complaint was the noise at the back of the hotel due to the loading docks of the bulding directly behind. Therefore, request a front facing room. They made it up to us by comping our breakfasts (nice touch). XV Beacon is a nice alternative to other luxury hotels (Four Seasons, Taj) in Boston which are nice, but boring.

Reviews.Title: “Fab”
Reviews.Author: CambTrav
Reviews.Content: XV Beacon is beautiful and luxurious and complements the downtown Boston neighborhood in the best way. The negative reviews surprise me. The woman who complained that it took the staff 30 minutes to bring her luggage to her room -- that length of time is not unusual; I've had the same experience at the Waldorf Astoria, for example. Another reviewer left a shirt behind and had trouble getting it back. I had a very different experience when I left my glasses in the room, called XV Beacon the night that I got home, and received them in the mail two days later. XV Beacon is a boutique hotel, without the gigantic staffs of larger hotels. It's just going to be a different experience. I do agree that the continuous flame in the fireplace makes the room too hot and is a waste of energy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and amazing service”
Reviews.Author: marmugster
Reviews.Content: This was our first choice for accommodation in Boston, so we were delighted to find out that they were also dog friendly. Most hotels charge an extra fee, but they just asked us to sign a damage waiver which was fair enough. I don't think that you can beat the location of this hotel, It was close to everything that we wanted to do and see. Lastly, the staff was super friendly and helpful. We look forward to our next trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: WhiteObelisk
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Staff was great. Beautiful room in excellent location. If you can make it work, stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emannh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights while attending a wedding near by. I found the hotel very clean and comfortable. We did have a problem with hot water for the shower but problem was addressed quickly and to our satisfaction. We also used the gratis Lexus which we found to be very convenient and a nice touch. I plan on returning to the XV Beacon in the coming months. Moooâ€™s restaurant which is at the hotel is over priced and steak & service was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Top Drawer”
Reviews.Author: LeslieOC
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is amazing. Expensive, but quality in every way. It is classic and elegant. The service was impeccable. A few of the amenities include fully equipped marble bathrooms, heavenly beds, rooftop garden, sitting area and work station in room, fireplace and entertainment center, It is located centrally and within walking distance of many historical monuments. The staff is extremely attentive due to it's small size. The adjacent bar/ restaurant serves wonderful small plates of food. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: iluveh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 207 at XV Beacon for two nights in November. When we checked in I was disheartened to see that we had been given a room on the 2nd floor. When I asked the woman working the desk if there was anything available on a higher floor, she told me that there was not but not to worry it wasn't on the street side and therefore wasn't noisy. Is it possible that she is unaware of the garbage truck that arrives at 6 every morning and spends 30 minutes loading all the garbage from the hotel restaurant?? Trust me, we would have welcomed a bit of traffic noise by comparison! I mentioned this when checking out as well as my surprise that this particular room was not at the cheapest room rate when it was so clearly in a compromised location. I had intentionally not booked the least expensive rate for just this kind of reason. The man at the desk gave me $200 off our stay which at least was something though it could be considered an admission of guilt. But what really upsets me is that I left a shirt in the room. There is no doubt in my mind because I had it when I was unpacking and didn't have it when I got home the day we left. The room was extremely dark so it doesn't surprise me that I might have overlooked something. I called to inquire and they said that it had not been found. I then wrote the assistant manager an email imploring him to look again and I received no response at all! Then I forwarded that email to the manager of the hotel letting him know that the assistant hadn't responded and I have had no response from him either. Perhaps I am naive but I find this totally unacceptable in a small hotel that should take great care to give good customer service to its guest spending over $1000 for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not THAT nice”
Reviews.Author: bermewjan77
Reviews.Content: It has a great location and for the most part it is a lovely hotel with a nice atmosphere but there are some problems and I probably wont stay here again. One of the reasons I was so attracted to this hotel was that every room had a 4-poster bed but having stayed there now - I really didn't see the point in having very plain metal bed posts round the bed in the Standard Room we stayed in. It looked like we were sleeping inside a fish tank or some kind cage! I think the larger rooms have more decorative bed posts but they should take the posts out of the standard rooms because they look boring and out of place and get in the way of the TV! I sent the following e.mail to the hotel and have had no response: .............. My husband and I stayed with you last weekend and enjoyed it very much but I would like to note a few things for your consideration: 1) We had to call several times for things to be brought to our room. I asked twice for a second robe but never got it and we waited more than half an hour for an ironing board and iron after requesting it twice. Your In-room dining service managed to prepare and deliver a full cooked breakfast in less time than it took for someone to deliver an iron! 2) The fire was always on (although very low - with one small flame - it still created a fair bit of heat) even when it was switched "off" so that we had to have the air conditioning on all the time just to keep the room at a reasonable temperature. I imagine that this wastes a considerable amount of energy and as someone who cares for the environment I found this very unsatisfactory. 3) There was a chair in our room that space didn't really allow for. We had to move it to get into the mini bar and it just didn't fit anywhere else. My advice would be to remove this kind of chair from this kind of room. 4) It was an unpleasant surprise to find the housekeeping area with a mess off dirty laundry and cleaning products at the bottom of the stairs coming down from floor 10 to 9. It looked really bad compared to the high standards elsewhere in the hotel. I assume it is unintended for guests to use the stairs here but this was not clear to me. 5) When we checked out the person at the front desk didn't ask us if we had enjoyed our stay and although he was polite I would normally expect such a question to be asked. When they don't ask it feels like they don't care about their guest's experience at their hotel. We still had a good time but overall - for the price - I feel that the XV Beacon isn't worth it. I hope that this feedback is helpful to you. ................

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: talkative
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights at Beacon XV and we were a little nervous before we arrived because of the mixed reviews it gets on Tripadvisor but we had a lovely time. first, because it was my birthday, my husband rang the concierge and arranged flowers & champagne in the room. on checking in we were told we'd been given an upgrade to a studio as it was a special occasion. the room was large, beautifully furnished & appeared to have been recently redecorated - all the fabrics/soft furnishings were fresh & stylish. the bed & chairs etc all very comfortable. the flowers were beautiful - they must use a very good florist. the location is ideal although be warned there is traffic noise. staff were polite & friendly - room service staff & the breakfast crew in the restaurant are particularly nice. the room was very clean. air conditioning worked well. nice products in the bathroom. there is precious little to complain about. we'd stay there again in a moment.

Reviews.Title: “A bit run down”
Reviews.Author: NYontheGO
Reviews.Content: We had been wanting to stay at this hotel for a while and had heard great things about it. The location is wonderful - within walking distance to many great restaurants and shops, plus the park is right there.
