The service was wonderful at the hotel, but the rooms and hotel in general were very run down and need of some serious updating. Especially for the prices they are charging! The stereo in our room was from the 1970's and didn't even work. The bedside controls for the fireplace and stereo didn't work. The carpeting was not flat in areas, the vase was dusty when we first walked in. Also, had heard such great things about the rooftop and when we got up there it was such a dissapointment. The hot tub sounded too good to be true and they were nice enough to heat it up for us for when we got home that night, but when we went to check it out, it was slimy and dirty... I hope they do some updating and serious cleaning. The updated restaurant was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Tops in Boston”
Reviews.Author: GeneDC
Reviews.Content: Each year I attend a meeting and Boston and I anxiously wait for the chance to stay at this Boston landmark! Everything is EXCEPTIONAL! The staff begins with WOWing you at checkin. The rooms are tasteful, luxurious with every amenity you could dream of! The remote control gas fireplace and incredible soundsystem make you want to curl up in bed and order room service. However, that would mean missing one of my favorite restaurants in the US- The Federalist. Few hotels outside of Europe have incredible in house dining- XV beacon has it! Their wine list, staff and incredible dishes are a constant in the 6 years I have visited this Beacon Hill beauty, Need to run out to Newbury Street- they'll wisk you there or to the airport in their custom Mercedes at no charge! Luxury, style, convenience with attentive, intuitive service.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently-named XV Beacon”
Reviews.Author: pixiecat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the XV Beacon in August 07 for business. Found the location to be lovely & the car service to the office each morning was a very nice touch. (Rode the T back in the evenings, kind of fun!) I stayed on the 10th floor. The room was modern, with nice touches, but cramped and very very dark. The lighting was permanently set at "mood." (hint, the light "buttons" actually have teeny tiny dimmer switches on the sides). Also the shower was freezing for the first two days! Apparently they were having some plumbing problems, but yikes! Invigorating to say the least. The "rain" shower heads were great (they put out a ton of water!) and the shampoos/lotions were top notch. Someone else mentioned that the TV was in an awkward place... now it's not a huge deal, but it is a little weird that the TV is blocked by the bedposts from every angle. Also, I found that the volume on the TV was bizarre... setting "2" was barely audible and setting "3" was too loud. Just strange. Room service is extra-pricey, but not an issue if work is paying! I don't like the name of the restaurant (why must I be reminded of the last words of the animal that I'm about to eat?) but it was pretty yummy and FAST. Overall, it was a lovely experience, not perfect, but great for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: NYCGirlNyc
Reviews.Content: My husband has been staying at XV Beacon since the hotel opened and has stayed there at least 100 times. I have had the chance to stay there about 30 times. We find the service to excellent and have never had an issue with either our booking or accommodations. Here are some further details on the hotel: 1. The hotel is perfectly located for either business travelers or tourists. It is within walking distance to the public garden, Newbury St, Fanueil Hall and the financial district. For those who do not wish to walk, the house car will bring you to most areas in Boston and drivers are courteous and friendly. 2. The hotel is a boutique style hotel, which we prefer, it is not as large as the Ritz Carlton Boston (I have stayed at both the old and new Ritz in Boston) but I find the quaintness of XV Beacon to be more pleasant. 3. Room Service is excellent. Food is usually delivered within 30 mins of ordering and breakfast orders arrive on time when previously scheduled. They will also try to accommodate special requests, for example making a strawberry sundae. 4. Rooms are tastefully decorated and comfortable even if on the smaller side. Housecleaning has never been an issue. 5. Bathrooms are nice and all rooms have a separate area for dressing and grooming which is next to the room containing shower, tub and toilet. The showers do present an interesting problem of leaking water on to the floor and not draining very well. This is an issue that the hotel should spend some time to correct. 6. There is very little turnover of staff, which is a sign of good management. There are a number of people who have been there for a while and they always remember who we are and greet us by name when we arrive. XV Beacon is our little gem in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but overrated”
Reviews.Author: lmk2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the weekend of July 27-30. Right after I booked this hotel, I learned that it was one of Travel & Leisure's Top 100 Continental U.S. hotels (#59). That made me really excited to stay there and have this experience. I don't really get what T&L was thinking when they put this on their list. There has got to be another hotel out there that is more deserving of this ranking. The lobby and rooms do have beautiful finishes (i.e., crown moldings, gorgeous furniture) and the hotel has a really luxurious feel throughout. It is in a great location and you can easily walk to most of the amazing restaurants, shops and tourist sights in Boston. The service was not what I'd expect from a luxury hotel. Some of the staff were really nice and truly wanted to make the experience great. But some (especially one of the front desk attendants) had that annoying "you are so not worthy to be staying at my hotel" attitude that I've experienced in some other trendy hotels (e.g. Gansevoort in NYC). I was rudely put on hold once when trying to call the front desk ("Can you hold? We are SO busy right now" and put me on hold before I could even answer). When we tried to use the free car service that everyone raved about on this site, they told us it was booked for that time but the doorman could hail a cab for us. Thanks. We asked to use the car to the airport and there was a $35 charge - not horrible but just unexpected since they told us at check-in there was a complimentary car available to us considering the airport is a 10 minute drive). Also, the fitness center is really, really small. We had drinks at the restaurant each night (it's now called Mooo, not the Federalist, which to be honest I think is a gross and unappetizing name for a steakhouse). The bartenders were very nice and friendly. Overall, it was a good experience and a nice hotel. I don't think I'd stay again though. If you are looking for the service, luxury and consistency that should come with this price range, stick with the Four Seasons or the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “A Memory to Treasure”
Reviews.Author: MartiniBoy
Reviews.Content: My partner, my best Friend and I needed a bit of spoiling and booked into the XV on Beacon whilst attending the Barbra Striesand concert. We are in the hospitality industry and are normally very critical of establishments that we stay in. I guess we have an eye. Couldnt fault the hotel at all and all in all had one of the most memorable weekends of my life. Brads Rasberry Martini's are still talked about and all in all from reservation to departure the hotel exceeded our expectations. So if you fancy a spoiling this is the place

Reviews.Title: “Not enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: moriahc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fifteen Beacon on our wedding night. When we arrived to get into our room that afternoon, the room was not ready and we had to wait nearly 40 min to get in. This normally wouldn't be a huge problem, but I needed to get ready...for our wedding! I ended up having to rush which wasn't a nice experience. The complimentary chauffeur service was great - we arrived at the church in a fancy mercedes for free! Other problems - the shower did not drain and leaked all over the bathroom floor. The LCD in the bathroom didn't work. The fireplace also didn't work and we had to have someone come down and turn it on for us. The snacks in the mini fridge were very old and stale - at checkout we asked them to waive the snack costs and they nicely did so. The positives? The rooftop garden was lovely and the breakfast the next day was very tasty. As I mentioned earlier, the complimentary chauffeur service was great as well. The rooms and hotel decor were very nice, but in general this hotel is not worth the high costs.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: UrbanNomads
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for the weekend of the 23rd of May to celebrate my birthday and after checking in effortlessly the manager sent a complimentary bottle of bubbly and chocolate covered strawberries to our room. The studio suite was lovely and cosy, the sheets were soft and fine and the bathroom toiletries (the mirrored lip gloss was a lovely touch) and thick bathrobes were gorgeous. The complimentary Lexus parked out the front of the hotel was also great (the chauffeur was so nice and recommended the Metropolis in the South End for brunch). Thank you Beacon XV for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: azrael765
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited the XV Beacon Hotel this Memorial Day weekend, and we were VERY pleased with the experience. The location is perfect, within walking distance to the Boston Commons, Quincy Market, the Public Gardens, even Fenway Park if you're willing to put your walking shoes on. The service was friendly and professional, without the pretentiousness of some luxury hotels. The decor was modern and sleak, just our style. We were offered an upgrade upon arrival to a studio room because the hotel was not full, and the room was delightful. It was spacious, bright with amazing windows, a nice view of Beacon Street. There was a stereo in the room with speakers throughout so the music was lovely. The TV was a little small and rather far from the bed, but oh well, no room's perfect. The bathroom was spacious and beautiful, all marble with nice dark wood accents. They use high-end bath products which was a nice touch. There was limited drawer space which, combined with the small-ish TV, were the only drawbacks. Overall, we were very pleased with the room. We ate breakfast in the Federalist, which was SO delicious. We didn't get a chance to eat dinner there, but would have if we hadn't had reservations elsewhere. We had drinks one night at the bar and that experience was great, excellent selection of spirits. While talking with the restaurant staff we were told that the restaurant will undergo extensive renovations this summer to appeal to a more young, modern crowd, which while understandable, is an unfortunate reality since the current environment is gorgeous and classy. We tried to reserve the complimentary car service, but were unable due to previous bookings, so I would recommend that if you want to take advantage of the car service, book early and don't wait til last minute. We were pleasantly surprised though to learn that because we valeted a Lexus, we did not incur a parking fee. Kinda made up for the car service being unavailable. I would definitely recommend this hotel. My husband and I are rather particular about hotels and were so happy we chose the XV Beacon.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenster001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The first room we were booked into on the 2nd floor was very noisy due to positioning of an exterior air-con unit right outside the window. After a couple of calls to reception, we were shown two rooms on different floors, which although slightly smaller, were progressively quieter - we settled for one on the 7th floor. The reception desk (in particular Josh) were friendly and understanding throughout this process. Our room was very luxurious and comfortable - as you would expect from this type of hotel. Room service was fairly quick (about 30mins) and tasty - although the room really wasn't big enough for the enormous wheely trolley it came served on. We also ate in the restaurant, the Fed, which was also good quality food - the winelist is impressive and extensive. One draw-back if you like to relax somewhere other than your room, is the lack of "public space" at the hotel - there is only a small area in the lobby. There is a roof garden, but it was closed during our stay. Overall, I would recommend the VX Beacon and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “SO sexy! Luxurious!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hotellova
Reviews.Content: XV Beacon is AMAZING! The service is outstanding! We went for a weekend getaway and told the reservationist that it was a special weekend for us. We received champagne and strawberries, as well as a note from the general manager! Also, there is complimentary Lexus sedan that took us to dinner at Mistral. We looked fabulous driving around in the Lexus! If you want a special hotel where you feel like you are staying in a high end Boston Brownstone, this is the place!!! You will not want to go HOME!

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast you'll ever have”
Reviews.Author: MaryCork
Reviews.Content: We were on a business/leisure trip. It was a high star rating and deserved it. Around the corner from Boston Common, Fanueiul Hall, etc. Easy to get to city centre. The hotel breakfast was fantastic, if expensive. Every dish was amazing. When in Boston city, the Mapparium is worth a visit, along with the top of the Prudential building, to get a great idea of where everything is. There are some great museums to visit.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: MuchoTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the XV Beacon Hotel for our first wedding anniversary, and I can't express enough what a throughly enjoyable and welcoming experience it was. From the moment we walked into the hotel until the moment we left, the service was top notch and every little detail was attended to. Every hotel staff member wished us a happy anniversary daily, we had champagne and strawberries upon arrival, the room was very comfortable and romantic with a great working fireplace, and the concierge Jonathan was so accomodating with booking us restaurants, live music shows, tours, spa treatments, etc. The Federalist was much better than expected as well -- probably our best meal in Boston. The neighborhood also can't be beat -- so charming! The price is definitely worth it -- if you want service, this is the place to stay. We travel often around the world and my husband is in the hospitality business, and XV Beacon is without question one of the best hotels we have ever had the pleasure of visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachbella6905
Reviews.Content: This hotel knows service. We travel with one infant and one toddler and the hotel bent over backward to accomodate us throughout our stay with our kids. The concierge selected fantastic restaurants every night that had amazing food and that were kid friendly. The hotel is hip but comfortable and the attached Federalist Bar has a great (non-hotel) feel to it. The hotel has a courtesy car on hand to shuttle guests around the city, which came in handy a number of times, especially at the end of a long day when we were just too tired to walk back to the hotel. The hotel is pricey, but they live up to the price tag with service and location.

Reviews.Title: “XV Beacon great”
Reviews.Author: rmm641
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the XV Beacon it was a great hotel. The resturant was wonderful!! Great small hotel we really enjoyed our stay!! Great little welcoming treats, good amenities and the car service was a nice touch. Wonderful location could not have been better close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kecoco
Reviews.Content: I loved XV Beacon. Orginally had reservations at the Ritz Carlton Boston Common and after much thought decided to switch to XV Beacon. This is not your typical hotel and the room decor may throw you off in the beginning. Relax, the rooms become a retreat from the busy city and at night are very romantic. The bathrooms are fantastic with large powerful overhead rain showers, fluffy towels and bathrobes and great toiletries. Great staff from the front desk, concierge and hotel driver. The hotel provides car service around town - never had a problem with availability. Location is fantastic - easy walk to anywhere in Boston. Best rooms to book - book a studio, which is an even numbered room preferably on a high floor. You are going to love it.

Reviews.Title: “XV Beacon Great Service, Decor lacking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the XV Beacon for our 15th anniversary June 1 thru 4. The service from start to finish was excellent and we can find only minor problems. As for the decor, this hotel will appeal to some and not others. Generally, the light is limited and the rooms are not bright. Dark red and dark wood are the instruments of choice. I had no problem with the decor, but my wife thought it was depressing. The amenites are acceptable and the roomservice is quick. The internet connection works well in the room and you may be able to log on to numerous wireless signals floating around Boston. The location is excellent. The concierge is very helpful and not pretentious in the least. The only drawbacks to the hotel are the gloomy rooms and the fact that the restaurant is inconsistent. The sole was very good, while the sirloin was not. However, if you are willing to spend the money, the wine list is as good as you will find anywhere. We were in a traditional room with plenty of space, the stereo and fireplace are nice additions. Only drawback is the one sink bathroom, but the shower is great.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for business travel”
Reviews.Author: FalmouthTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently spent our 10th anniversary at XV Beacon. I would classify the hotel as ideal for businessmen seeking luxury accomodations. The lobby is dark, sleek and modern, as are the rooms. The linens are luxurious; the bathroom is modern and had a jacuzzi tub. The room (a Junior Suite) was decent sized - not overly large, but comfortable. The room had a very good stereo, well stocked bar and fireplace that could be turned on from a unit next to the bed. Mattress and pillows were very comfortable. The hotel staff went out of their way to ensure that we had a romantic anniversary. Every staff member seemed to know it was a special day for us; we were upgraded to a junior suite; champagne and chocolate covered strawberries were delivered to our room. They were helpful in arranging for an in-suite couples massage. The breakfast at the Federalist was outstanding, as was the car service; we used it multiple times to go shopping and to dinner. Our only complaint was the fact that we had no cold water in our shower. We mentioned it to the front desk clerk before going out for dinner, and were disappointed the next morning when it had still not been fixed. I would definitely stay at XV Beacon again and highly recommend it to business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: lwohara
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the XV Beacon and we would highly recommend the hotel. The concierge staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help up with baseball tickets, duck tour tickets (Sergeant Pepper is a great duck tour guide) and appropriate dinner reservations. We felt the rooms were a nice size and although a tad dark, were above average. I do agree that the mattresses could be better but the sheets and towels made up for the very average mattress. We received excellent, although somewhat slow, service throughout our stay. It was so nice to have the hotel car available to drop us off for dinner and take us to Fenway Park. The doormen were friendly and helped with directions. All in all a very friendly, happy staff in a nice location in Beacon Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Looks like a coffin!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I live in Boston and was trying to get a one night stay at a fabulous hotel as a gift for a friend's wedding night. Although I did not actually stay in this hotel (and never would), I received a tour of the available rooms. As soon as you walk into the lobby, you feel like you're walking into a coffin. Everything is dark red and black (including the elevator) and very stuffy. When I explained my situation to the concierge, he was absolutely unfriendly and awkward; he sent an equally awkward bellboy to show us two different rooms. The rooms were terribly decorated, and the beds had strange protruding posts that looked as if there should have been some sort of canopy. The sheets were dirty and everything was pretty dusty. The furniture was very old, and in general, in very poor taste. The hotel, overall, was depressing. I would certainly not recommend staying there for people who enjoy being in a positive and spacious environment. I am glad I visited that hotel before I booked the honeymoon night. Instead, try the Nine Zero (which is a block and a half away). It's an incredible hotel with much better service, decor and rooms (and the restaurant is amazing, as well).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at XV Beacon for 2 nights, and would recommend it. It was quite pricey, but we knew that going in. Room service breakfast was $58 when all was said and done, and the food was wonderful. My ONLY complaint though would be that the bed mattresses are nothing special. They are not UNcomfortable, but they are nothing close to any sort of "heavenly bed" that some chains boast of. And for $300/night, I thought they would be quite a bit different. We stayed in a Classic room, our view was an office building and the rooms were definitely not spacious. The complimentary Lexus sedan service was phenomenal and clearly quite a luxury. The location was also fantastic for our sight-seeing trip of the city. I would recommend staying here; would stay again but not a necessity for my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Feel real luxury”
Reviews.Author: heaneman
Reviews.Content: Just back from Boston and had a great time. The hotel is excellent and luxurious. The Breakfast was slow and a bit stuffy but worth the wait. The rooms are excellent and the fireplace was quite cute. Unfortunately we were overlooking an office so one would need to be carefull!!. The facilities in the room are good if a little complicated. The doormen are very chatty and their advice quite good. The bar is also quite stuffy by European standards but plenty of choice outside. Overall excellent apart from the above little matters.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem-Do not miss this great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mommy2boys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned today from our stay at XV Beacon and I have never run so fast to tripadvisor to write my review for any hotel, but this one was so exceptional I wanted to make sure that I got it right in before I forgot any of the details of our stay. I am reluctant to "share" this rare find with others but it is truly one of the best hotels that we have ever stayed in. We usually stay at 4-5 star hotels and found this hotel to compare with the likes of the Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons, but with more character and a truly amazing staff. First, it is a smaller hotel with a TON of character. From the minute you walk into the lobby to the moment they bring your car to go home, you feel as though you have your own staff to help you. Michael, at the front desk, is fantastic and even upgraded our room upon arrival. The room was fabulous, with 5 huge windows, a fireplace, sitting area (with a very comfy couch for 2), a walk in closet, and a four-poster queen bed with fine linens. The bathroom featured a 4-inch TV, a towel warmer, a jacuzzi tub with a "rainfall" shower head, AND "Fresh" shampoo's and lotions (which is a skin care line I LOVE from Sephora). The room itself was very cozy, comfortable and romantic - great for a short stay without the kids. We ordered room service from the restaurant downstairs for dinner and lunch, and have to say it was one of the best in-room dining experiences we have ever had. The portions were very large and not too expensive for the great tasting food. Try the Chicken breast entree, the Fed burger, and the salads. My husband had the lobster bisque soup and said it was the best he had ever had. I wish that we had tried their breakfasts but we'll save that for our next visit. Also, they have a new Lexus sedan that you can use as your complimentary transportation while you are there. We did not use it, but if we had wanted to go to dinner downtown the driver would have dropped us off and then we would have paged him to pick us up!! Very nice touch~ We were at the Beacon because we had an appointment at Lahey Clinic today. We stayed over last night and then checked out today. Our appointment ran until 12:30 at the clinic,so we asked if we could have a late check-out so we could come back and have a rest and some food before we hit the road for home. They, of course, said "yes". We ended up checking out at 3 pm and they were MORE than accomodating with our requests. We WILL MOST DEFINITELY stay here again. This is our new Boston hotel. You are definitely missing out on a wonderful and luxurious experience if you pass by the XV Beacon.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased this discerning traveler”
Reviews.Author: am470
Reviews.Content: I really debated on staying at the XV Beacon, but boy was I happy that we did. The fireplace in the room was great. We received a complimentary upgrade which we always appreciate. The Mercedes dropped us off at least a half dozen times during our one night stay. They even drove us to the airport. No charge...we just tipped the great driver, Mark. The service was excellent. I have stayed at many fancy hotels (Ritz, Four Seasons, Oberoi). XV was definitely up to this level. The decor of the hotel is a little more casual than the others. But the service they provide is just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated sytle and over the top service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've read rave reviews about XV Beacon for years, so when my wife and I visited Boston I had to check it out for myself. From the moment we were greeted by the bellman at the front door we were made to feel like the only guests in the hotel. Our room was imaculate and the bed was heavenly. We had dinner in the Federalist - the lobster bisque and beef wellington were amazing. We left the hotel only once so my wife could shop on Newbury and were dropped off and picked up by one of XV Beacon's mercedes sedans. We were scheduled to stay for one night but ended up extending our stay one extra night. We didn't want to leave and can't wait to visit again. XV Beacon is not to be missed when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed With Lackluster XV Beacon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent three days at XV Beacon with our baby. I was really looking forward to the stay because of the terrific reviews and ratings the property always gets in the major travel magazines. From start to finished, we found XV Beacon simply average, which is a major disappointment considering that we were paying $450 a night for a studio suite. We found the room to be in need of an update (the TV in the bathroom looked like it was from 1985). The linens were not at all comfortable and seemed completely ill-fitting for the bed. (Note, if you're looking for a comfy down comforter don't look for it at XV Beacon!). It's nice that they give you a business card with a private fax line....if only the fax line worked! (I missed two incoming faxes in my room.....). Also, although it may seem a bit picky, we were repeatedly annoyed that the doorman was never to be found when we were coming or going from the hotel....just one of those "little things" that's a pain in a hotel that purports to be a "Leading Hotel of the World". All in all, we were disappointed with what we found to be a lackluster hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at XV Beacon on October 21-23. We chose it based on it's proximity to our friend's home in Beacon Hill. I was nervous after reading some bad reviews, but arrived with a very optimistic outlook. Upon arrival we were greeted by the doorman who took our bags & car. All standard procedure & just fine. Check-in was also smooth, but neither here nor there. Our room was the "Traditional" category and was clean & adequately appointed. There was no cd libabry as suggested & the toiletries were not "outstanding" as others had mentioned. The TV in the bathroom malfunctionced & the shower leaked tremendously as other reviewers noticed. When we returned to our room at the end of our second day we found it unmade. The front desk's reply to our telling them was, "oh really". It was eventually made up. Aside from the staff at XV Beacon being generally cold, unhelpful & unpleasant, our friend was treated very horribly. She left the hotel on Saturday evening after cocktails at The Federalist (no great scene). She jumped in a waiting cab & was followed by the doorman who insturcted her very rudely that he had called the cab for someone else & forced her to get out. He refused to flag down a passing cab or assist her in any way. Regretably she didn't get his name, but if she had & we reported it to management I am sure they would not have cared. XV Beacon certainly does not merit it's distinction as one of the "Leading Hotels of the World". I wouldn't have cared about the mediocre treatment (except for the doorman incident), but at $400+ per night, the staff should be a bit more polite & attentive. Also, we are vely low key travelers. I imagine that some of the other more demanding guests at this hotel were even more disappointed with their experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lavish and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Newburyporttraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the XV Beacon Hotel for three days before continuing on an oversea's extravaganza. Upon arrival, we were greeted with friendly and accomodating staff. The rooms were magnificent and lavish with every luxury you can imagine. Frankly we didn't want to leave the hotel... When it was time to go we were driven to the Airport by "Mark" in one of the complimentary mercedes limousines. He was humurous and navigated through the "big dig" like a pro... While in Europe we stayed at several 5-star hotels which did not come close in comparison!! Frankly we wish we had stayed in Boston... The XV Beacon Hotel was a memorable and pleasurable experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Comedy of errors - and not funny!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spent a portion of my honeymoon at XV Beacon and I regret having made the reservation. Upon check-in, our room had a broken switch for the fireplace, the glass on the fireplace was covered in soot, the small tv in the bathroom was hanging out its wall mount by its own wiring, the bathrobe had a tennis-ball sized hole in the armpit, the blanket on the duvet had a hole in it, the curtain rod detached upon contact, the bottom-drawn window shade detached upon contact, and the curtain on the wall had a large tear. I am not kidding. In the days that followed, room service got our breakfast order wrong three consecutive mornings as well as one evening, our room was rarely turned down in the evening despite requesting it again and again, the drain in the bathtub was malfunctioning to the point where we showered up to our ankles every morning in water despite repeated requests to fix the problem, nobody at the front desk wished us a happy honeymoon, one front desk clerk still didn't know our name or room number despite a six night stay, the teapots from room service were always badly chipped, and worst of all we returned one evening to our room to find that the stereo components had been pulled halfway off their shelf with their cords yanked out. We wrote a polite letter to the GM halfway through our stay that went unanswered for a day and a half until my travel agent called and addressed him. Only then did he send a note to us, but he failed to ever apologize and he never followed-up on making personal contact despite promising to do so. He did send us a bottle of sparking wine -- wow. When we checked out, our bill included 5 breakfasts despite the fact that breakfast was included. Don't believe the hype about this hotel -- they don't care, they are not enthusiastic or proud of their jobs, and their leadership is clearly lacking. For $400 per night, do yourself a favor and head elsewhere -- unless you want to be treated like you don't count because that's how we were made to feel...and we were on our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and stylish”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: XV Beacon perfectly balanced a stylish sense of humor with a professional and efficient style. I loved the in-room amenities (like the stereo) and The Federalist was the best dinner I've had in Boston. It could have been totally pretentious, but the staff was so warm. Also, great location.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler, fifteen Beacon continues to be my favorite home away from home in Boston. From the elegant decor to the gas fireplaces to the bathroom amenities, Fifteen Beacon continues to shine above any of the other proprties I have stayed in in the Boston area. The Federalist restaurant also continues to please with their fresh and original menus and incredible wine list.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For what is Boston's #1 most costly hotel the Beacon needs some refinement. First of all there is not a full time concierge. Restuarant reservations were attended to by front desk individuals but a record of the bookings were never left for us to see the details which meant that we had to track down this information with new staff members who were not always aware of what arrangements had been made previously. Upon arrival there were luggage carts and luggage piled all over the small lobby. The luggage racks were in and out of this area all weekend which cluttered up what was the only common space available. The hotel's front desk manager referred us to the sun deck located on the roof....but we found that wine bottles, glasses and newspapers were there and it looked like the area was not maintained for guests but more like a storage for furnture and plants. THE ROOMS WAS GREAT BUT THE SHOWER IN BATH LEAKED EVERYWHERE. When I spoke to a female about this on the phone...she was terribly rude. I THINK WHEN U CHARGE $450 PER NIGHT IN BOSTON...YOU NEED TO RAISE THE STANDARDS FOR LUXURY ALITTLE...This hotel needs some polish. It is too bad since there is not a great deal of competition in the luxury hotel arena in Boston...so this hotel could easily be a winner if it tried alittle harder.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Favourite hotel in Boston. Modern luxury without seeming formulaic. Good for indulgent weekends in town.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had tickets to the Phantom of the Opera at the Boston Opera house. We stayed at the XV and made use of the complimentary car to take us to the show. We also ate at the hotel restaurant the Federalist. We had made reservations when we booked the hotel and they greeted us by name and ushered us right to a table. We had the taster's menu with the wine pairing. The food was decadent and the service was exemplary. The restaurant was crowded but we felt as though we had a private server. I am not a wine connoisseur by any stretch of the imagination but the wait person was extremely knowledgeable and I learned quite a bit without feeling like I didn't know anything to begin with. Ah the rooms. My daughter stayed in the classic room and I in the traditional. Her room was a tad smaller and did not have a jacuzzi tub. Both rooms had a gas fireplace, fresh calla lillies, well stocked fridge with Boston themed goodies and a large soft comfortable poster bed. The views from the rooms were rather dreary. I kept the drapes closed most of the time because I could see into windows on adjacent buildings. Visitors to the hotel are given business cards with name, contact information and dates of stay. It was a delightful novelty to us but I'm sure a helpful tool to the business traveler. My daughter and her friend still talk about the visit and have recommended this hotel to their friends.

Reviews.Title: “XV Beacon is Superb”
Reviews.Author: buksgrrl
Reviews.Content: I don't have a single bad thing to say about my experience at XV Beacon. The service was pleasant and efficient. Car service is great! The room was well appointed, and the mini bar was phenomenal. Chateau d'Yquem and Chateau Mouton Rothschild in a mini bar (didn't want to even ask the price)! Room service was quick and tasty. Our view wasn't fantastic, but everything else more than made up for it. One of the absolute best hotels I've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my friend and i just returned from a night stay at the beacon during labor day weekend. once we arrived we were told of our room and we excitedly went to #806. it was a very nice size room however i think that housekeeping forgot to check all the nooks and cranies...the mini bar had things taken and a few things left behind from the previous guests.....GROSS!!! the fireplace was extremely dusty and we couldnt stop sneezing all night. as for the bathroom...what a cool sink!! as for the shower....yikes. my friend was feeling sick so we actually decided to stay in and order room service. i called down and asked if they had chicken broth and maybe some grilled cheese. my friend is a chef and used to work in a fine dining resturant in RI as did I so we were both prepared to get a "no the chef doesnt do that" as were we aware that the bil would be a lot. the woman said..."um...we might not have chicken broth.." i kinda laughed knowing about working in a fine dining resturant and hotel and understood...knowing full well that of course the kitchen have chicken broth. she told me she would call me back and let us know...which was fine..(thats what i used to have to do as well) we got the call back and the food arrived promtly...COLD nothing like cold soup and cold grilled cheese when youre sick. the in room dining needs to invest...if anything eles in domes for the food....

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Room #402”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at XV Beacon for one night after spending the weekend at Cape Cod for a wedding. The hotel is very well located in downtown Boston and has an excellent reputation. Unfortunately we did not have as nice of an experience as we had expected. Our room (â€œClassic Roomâ€�) was decorated nicely but was lacking in some major areas. The first thing that we noticed was the size of the bed. If it is any bigger than a double bed, I would be shocked (you will notice that the website never describes what size the beds are). The worst part of the room had to be the bathroom. We were put into what turned out to be a handicapped room with a handicapped bathroom (i.e. no tub, only a shower that basically consisted of a shower head and curtain on one side of the bathroom). When taking a shower, you had to strategically place towels around the shower to keep water from flooding the bathroom and spilling out into the hallway because there was no divider between the shower floor and the bathroom floor. Flooding was obviously a problem in the past because the wood on the bathroom doorframe looked like it had been rotting for some time. The worst part was that the white shower curtain was pink with mildew and with nothing holding it back you constantly had to fight it off as you were trying to get clean. The grout in between the shower tiles was also pink with mold and there was no place to put your soap or shampoo except on the disgustingly moldy floor. Additionally, a few of the things the hotel touts as unique are in-room fireplaces and TVs in the bathroom. Well, neither of these worked in our room. We called the front desk about the fireplace and they sent someone up to try and solve the problem. After discovering that the pilot light was unlit, the fireplace was turned on. After about 15 minutes the entire room smelled of gas and the fire, which was obviously out of control, started melting the exterior paint on the fireplace. We complained twice at the front desk and both times received a short â€œIâ€™m sorryâ€� before they turned back to their work. In my opinion, the ultimate disservice was never receiving a response back to a letter that I wrote to the General Manager complaining about our stay. For >$300 stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved fifteen beacon”
Reviews.Author: skier
Reviews.Content: Fantastic small, boutique hotel. Great location and the room was decorated beautifully...felt very homey. Size of the room was bigger than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Beans”
Reviews.Author: SCOTFASA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped in Boston overnight for a visit along our way to Maine, as a special three day get away. We had heard that XV Beacon was an excpetional place to stay, and thought we'd give it a try. We've traveled extensively, and have had the very appreciated opportunity of staying in wonderful resorts and hotels in the world. Our room was quite lovely in that it encompassed expansive windows across two walls and beautiful sunlight, and has a very intimate feel to it. However, a five star hotel should not, for instance, have a writing pad stuck underneath a wobbly desk leg, a lamp and blinds that do not work, and have forgotten to put shampoo in our room. It should not take three phone calls to have ice delivered, especially in a hotel that puts a clear emphasis on service. And, although many reviewers have had terrific experiences there, which I am sure are all accurate, a five star hotel should never have this kind of lapse in service. We were also disappointed in the concierge service -- nice person, but overly expedient in getting us out the door when asked for directions, etc., and fogot to call us back when he was trying to find a dinner reservation for us. Although, I should always remember to ask, we were also not told about the additional valet parking fee, and would have parked our car in the convienent lot next door; because my favorite little light from The Boulder's in Arizona, that was attached to my key chain was completely crushed when we got our car. Some valet service. There were numerous other problems with service, which is most unfortunate for a hotel of this kind. Perhaps this is primarily a place for business travel (it's very quiet and private), with much less care and attention paid to the weekend getaway person.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best... Not Bad...”
Reviews.Author: FlyOneWorld
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 2 night a XV Beacon but ran into many rough edges. At $350 a night I expect quality. The AC does not work! The hot and cold water taps at the sink both run hot water. The bathtub area showed signs of age and was discolored around the edges. The elevator is very slow. On the plus side the room service was very quick and reasonable quality. The prices for mini-bar, which stocks top rate wines and champagne like Opus One/Krug, and room service were very reasonable. The Mercedes drop off service is very convenient. The rooms are spacious and comfortable but could use some touching up. The beds could be better but were acceptable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The meal we ate at the Federalist was very good. All in all I may come back but only in winter.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting stay at XV Beacon”
Reviews.Author: wblakeney
Reviews.Content: Spent almost a week at XV Beacon in prime season - we had one of the larger rooms facing onto Beacon, which put it in the $500 a night range. Unlike the comments of other reviewers, it really wasn't too noisy at all... The location downtown was hard to beat and the concierge and staff were amazing. Loved the mercedes shuttle, which was cheerfully offered. The room was very tastefully decorated, had a SUPERB mini bar - quite nice bathroom. The bed could have been better and I share the other reviews griping about the air conditioning... it was working, but the room was on the cusp of being too warm to sleep comfortably. We were a little apprehensive about the Federalist restaurant - it looked rather drab, but the food and wine list were world class. The cranky old elevators take a little getting used to. Overall, we liked it... not sure it was good value, but we left with a positive impression.

Reviews.Title: “I heard everything!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed a few weeks ago at this hotel and I heard everything! The walls are thin as paper as i heard every conversation from the room next door. I apprectiate that some builings in boston are older, but if you own a hotel you must do something ot soudnproof it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rough Edges”
Reviews.Author: Njal
Reviews.Content: When we arrived it was 95 and the air conditioning was broken in the hotel. The time it was expected to go back on became later and later, so we moved into the Four Seasons for a night. The next day we returned to XV Beacon (the Four Seasons was sold out). The AC was working in the rooms, but I had requested a quiet room, and was somewhat anxious about the second floor front room I had received. The clerk assured me that Beacon Street was quiet at night. It was technically not night at 4:30 AM when the garbage trucks arrived. I asked to be moved to a quiet room in the back, and was warned the garbage trucks in the back came at 6:30 AM. Which they did, but I get up early. The dÃ©cor is elegant and amusing, but the rooms are underlit. It is hard to find anything in the drawers or even to read in bed. But services were good. Room service was prompt, the Mercedes house car was very convenient, and laundry was done quickly. The big problems were the air conditioning (havenâ€™t they heard of preventative maintenance?) and the noise (which all downtown Boston hotels have). If you arenâ€™t a light sleeper and if nothing goes wrong mechanically (one of the elevators seemed to be acting up) XV Beacon is a good but very expensive place to stay. For the cost one doesnâ€™t the rough edges I encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl
Reviews.Content: XV Beacon is by far the classiest hotel in Boston. My husband and I spent our anniversary there this past weekend. Our room was sleek and sophisticated with fireplace and four poster bed. There was champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries in our room upon arrival. What a nice touch and wonderful surprise. The rainforest shower is amazing. You'll end up staying in the shower for a long, long time. The service is first-class and their restaurant, the Federalist, is topnotch. We ended up eating dinner, having late night snacks and then breakfast there. Nice atmosphere, great food and impeccable service. We can't wait to go back.
